loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is a 25-year-old hardworking single woman. She operates a retail shop at O.T.C in the town center along Ronald Ngala Street in Nairobi. This is a very busy location that attracts many customers. 

Caroline was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She has no history with any other microfinance institution and is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET to buy more stock for her shop, especially dry goods such as sugar and wheat flour. Her heart’s desire is to expand her business and open another outlet in Nairobi so that she can have a stable source of income.

loans.use: To buy more stock such as sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Amalyn

texts.en:
Amalyn G. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:   general store, buying and selling of crabs and shrimp, and transportation businesses. She lives in Brgy. 2, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her general store, buying and selling of crabs and shrimp and transportation businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP16,000. Amalyn is now borrowing PHP 27,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.

Amalyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina O. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Divina is married and has four children. Her children's ages are 23, 22, 14, and 5. To make a living, Divina grows crops. The main source of income for her business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also manages a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various products. Divina works hard to feed her family and provide for her family's needs.

Divina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She said she is happy about the microinsurance program it offers. Divina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Charles Mutua

texts.en:
Charles Mutua, age 31, is married to Emily Mbatha, age 25, and together they have two children:  a son, age 5, and a daughter, age 2 and half years old. He lives in Tala and his barber shop is in the market in Tala town. Charles has been running his barber shop for five years. During the time Charles has been in this business, his customers have developed a lot of trust in him, and they attract their friends to his barber shop which has really grown his business. His monthly profit is 15,000 Kenyan shillings.His wife Emily runs a salon in Tala to help him make ends meet for their young family. 

Charles was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of Tala office. With this loan Charles intends to buy shaving machines and change the old ones, and buy towels and more basins for the shop. If the loan boosts business, Charles intends to open other barber shops in the market an also in other nearby markets and employ people to help in the business. Charles is very ambitious – he dreams of having many barber shops where he will employ many barbers to give quality services to his customers. He will be managing the businesses as they grow.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines and basins for his barber shop.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina P. is a married woman who lives in Zone 5, Brgy. Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Pig-fattening businesses. Her husband Ely P., who is 42 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 8 and 15 years old. 

Regina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Regina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to purchase stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children. 

Regina P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sheline Ondeche

texts.en:
Sheline O. is 64 years old and married to Saul. They have two children aged 30 years and 25 years old. They live in Kakamega town.

Sheline has a retail shop that she has been running for the past 12 years. She is in need of cooking oil, flour, soap and soft drinks to add to her stock. She is applying for a loan of Kshs 30,000 from KADET Ltd. Her monthly income is Kshs 9,000.

Her desire is to be able to open up a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, flour and soap to add to her stock

loans.name: Noly

texts.en:
Noly D. is a 61-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Food Vending businesses. She lives in Gatuslao Street, Brgy. 3, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her   General Store and Food Vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 8,000. Noly is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Noly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent. 

For over 12 years, she has operated a fish selling business from home. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Gladys faces a major challenge of seasonality because during the summer hot season fish is inadequate in supply at the market. She hopes to construct her own house in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sugar, soap and washing detergent to start a retail shop. She decided to join Yehu because it has a good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap and washing detergent to start a retail store .

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Flora is married and has two children aged 20 and 18. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flora works hard to sustain her childrne's education. She said college tuition gets higher every year so it is a challenge for her and her husband.

Flora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Fanice

texts.en:
Fanice O. is an experienced 52-year-old tailor from the Kwisero location of Kakamega town in western Kenya. She is married to James Abuti. The couple has three children between 15 and 25 years old.

Fanice operates a tailoring business in Kwisero and has been in this type of business for the last five years with great success. It is for this reason that she is taking her second loan to expand her business by buying tailoring materials for sale.  She will use the profits to invest further in her business.

Fanice has a dream of opening a tailoring school where she can impart her skills to young people interested in this kind of work.

loans.use: To buy ready-made materials to add to her stock

loans.name: Johna

texts.en:
Johna T. is 41 years old, married, and supports her family by operating three business ventures:   tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) operation, buying and selling of used clothes, and food and fish vending businesses. She lives in Zamora St., Brgy. 1, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1989 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard in her tricycle operation, buying and selling of used clothes, and food and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6500. Johna is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can purchase new materials for her tricycle. This will be her 13 loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 24,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Johna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Purchase of new materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Diomy

texts.en:
Diomy A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 47 years old and married. Diomy is a farmer. He owns land that he tills to plant and harvest rice crops. He also owns a sari-sari store that his wife manages. They sell a variety of different products at the store. Diomy works hard to excel in his businesses. He hopes to earn better and improve his family's living conditions.

Diomy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diomy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Diomy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She operates a hardware shop selling cleaning products, chemicals, car wax and polish. Her potential customers are car owners, neighbors and passersby. Elizabeth faces the challenge of delayed payments from creditors who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase paints, tough bond for cleaning products, chemicals and taping screws. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase paints, tough bond for cleaning products, chemicals and taping screws.

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 38 years old. Diosdado is married and has a 10-year-old child. To make a living, Diosdado owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Diosdado has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Diosdado joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdado is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kyabagyenyi Tukwatanise Group-Ibanda

texts.en:
B. N. is a hard-working married father of four children who carries out several agricultural practices including cattle-keeping where he gets products like milk and ghee to sell. He also looks after a banana plantation. All this earns him 120,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis that helps him to support his family. 

Having inherited some cows from his father, he feels it worthwhile to go ahead and purchase more cows and restock the farm. Therefore he is very hopeful that this loan will help him buy a cow for farm expansion. This will earn him more sales revenue from the agricultural produce. He belongs to 'Kyabagyenyi Tukwatanise' group of Ibanda.

loans.use: The purchase of a cow

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza T. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Tuboran, Brgy. Camba-og, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a pottery business.  Her husband Joeffrey, who is 36 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 5 and 13 years old. 

Annaliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twelve loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Annaliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,400, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for future education of her children. 

Annaliza T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her pottery business

loans.name: Stephen Wainaina

texts.en:
Stephen Wainaina K. has been in the public service motorbike business as his primary business and he has operated a retail shop as a secondary business for two years in Kitale-Kenya. He is 29 years old, married to Jane Nyambura and they have one child who is one year old. His wife is also a businesswoman. This adds to the income of the family. From the transport business, Stephen earns a profit of Kshs.10,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD of Ksh.20,000, which he plans to invest in his second business (the retail shop). He will buy one bag of sugar, two bales of flour and two boxes of cooking oil. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, he plans to grow the business for his wife by establishing a retail shop for her. 
  
Stephen hopes to own a Nissan with a capacity of 13 seats, which will enable him to provide for his family's basic needs. He also hopes to see his children being enlightened through education and becoming successful in life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Mary Ann is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Mary Ann joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Natig

texts.ru:
Natig N. 32 qoda. On jenat. Natig yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Agdam, i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy. On jivet v obshejitii qde imeyet odnu komnatu.

Natig uje 10 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom teksista. Kak vi videte na fotoqrafii yeqo mashina staraya i poetomu  Natig seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya mashini. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca.
texts.en:
Natig N. is 32 years old.  He is married.  Natig is an internally displaced person and relocated from Agdam and now lives with his family in Absheron region.  He lives in the communal home and has one room.

Natig has been a taxi driver for ten years now.  As you can see from the photo he has an old car and this is why he needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for the car.  He has learned about this business from his father.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. is 36 years old, married, and supports her family by operating one business venture: a pottery business.  She lives in Sitio Tuburan, Brgy. Camba-og, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her pottery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Grace is now borrowing PHP 14,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her business. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Grace aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. loans.use: Fund the operations of her pottery business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcyline

texts.en:
Marcyline N. is a 23-year-old pharmacist with a pharmarcy in Chaani Changamwe Mombasa. She is married to Nicholas who owns the pharmacy and they are blessed with three children.

She has been in this business for the last two years and has done great. She hopes to use the second loan she is requesting from KADET to expand her stock in the pharmacy shop and use the anticipated profit to open up another shop in the town centre.

She hopes to continue with her education in the future and open up a clinic beside her pharmacy.

loans.use: To expand her stock in the pharmacy shop

loans.name: Bautista

texts.en: Bautista D. is a 42-year-old from Malabor, Tibiao, Antique, Philippines. She stands as father and mother to her six children since her husband left them five years ago. Being a single mother, she has difficulty meeting the needs of her family. Four of her children are still studying so she works hard in order to survive. But through her industry and courage, two of her children are already finished college. This business is very important to the family because this is where she gets the money to meet their basic needs and the daily allowance of her children for schooling. Bautista earns her living with a sari-sari store and food vending. They say, "Life begins at 40." These days, people are serious about their businesses. In the last few months, Bautista joined ASHI because she wants to have additional capital for her business, and she like the free training and orientation offered by ASHI. She really appreciates the training because it is a big help to her and expands her dreams for her family. Bautista's first loan from ASHI was for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which she used as additional capital for her variety store. Her business improved because she already knew how to handle the business and she is friendly. So, for her second loan, she has requested 10,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store and food vending business. According to her, "In business, if you are wise, the bigger the investment, the bigger the income." She hopes that with the strength given to her by our Almighty, and with the support of ASHI and people around the world, she will be able to finish sending her children to college.

loans.use: For a variety store and food vending

loans.name: Boniface Adula

texts.en:
Boniface Adula, age 25, is married to Ivy Wanjiku, age 22, and together they have two daughters, ages 4 and 2 years old. He lives in Umoja and has a carpentry shop there. The carpentry business is located in a highly populated area with a lot of potential and Boniface has many clients. He serves them with a lot of respect and they always give him business. Boniface has been running his carpentry shop for four years and his monthly profit is 25,000 Kenyan shillings. His wife Ivy is a business woman and she contributes to the family income. 

Boniface was introduced to KADET by one of the loan officers in charge of Eastland office. With this loan, Boniface intends to buy strong boards, paint and wood glue of all of different types and colours. If the loan boosts the business, Boniface intends to expand the business and employ more people to help him. Boniface likes listening to his customers to give them good service. He is very ambitious and dreams of his business becoming one of the biggest in the country.

loans.use: To buy boards, paints, wood screws, nails and wood glue

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice M. is 35 years old. She is married to Francis Ngugi, and has been blessed with one child.

Loice operates a Mpesa store and sells gas-filled cylinders in Mtwapa, Mombasa.  She has been in business for the last six years and has done very well. She is involved with KADET and is now requesting her second loan, which she intends to use to add working capital to her Mpesa business. She will use the anticipated profit to boost her gas-selling business.

In the future Loice hopes to open a big store.

loans.use: to add working capital to her business

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide A. is 48 years old, married, and supports her family by operating three business ventures: repair shop, ambulant Vending (bread) and General Store businesses. She lives in Crossing Kanding, Bgry. Camingawan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her repair shop, ambulant Vending (bread) and General Store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8000. Heide is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she can fund operations. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Heide aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent O. is a 31-year-old water vendor and motorbike parts dealer in Kisimani, Mombasa. He is married and takes care of his family. He has been in business for the last four years and has done very well. 

Vincent recently joined KADET, and this will be his first loan, which he will use to purchase more spare parts for resale in his shop. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his parts business.  In the future he hopes to see both of businesses expand.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale in his shop

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl P. is 32 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Buying and Selling (pigs) and Pig-Fattening businesses. She lives in Brgy. La Paz, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Buying and Selling (pigs) and Pig-Fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Cheryl is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to  fund the operations of her piggery.  This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cheryl aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married and has one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

Nancy has operated a cloth-selling business for over two years, selling from door to door to her neighbours. With her KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase ladies’ clothes, children’s clothes and handbags to sell. She faces a major challenge in delayed payments by creditors who purchase clothes on credit. 

Nancy decided to join Yehu because of its minimal collateral and easy accessibility to sustainable services.  She hopes to open a cosmetics shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ladies’ clothes, children’s clothes and handbags to sell

loans.name: Catherine Kalunde

texts.en:
Catherine Kalunde, 27, is married to Sammy Kavengi, who is a mason. They have two children together: a son, aged 5, and a daughter, aged 4. Catherine lives and works in Tala. She has been running a retail shop for 4 years, and earns KES 8,000 a month.  She works hard, and her customers are very happy.  Her income goes towrd meeting her family’s basic needs, including helping her husband to educate their young children. 

Catherine was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office. She intends to use her loan to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and charcoal to boost her business and increase her profits. If the loan improves her business, Catherine will use the extra income to start fulfilling her big dreams for the future by increasing her stock and starting a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and charcoal

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela R. is 48 years old, married, and supports her family by operating one business venture: Cycle Parts Trading business.  She lives in Purok Bulahan, Brgy. Media, Argo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

 By working hard in her Cycle Parts Trading business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30,000. Angela is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her spare parts business.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom .Angela aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of bicycle spare parts sales

loans.name: Judah Keli

texts.en:
Judah Keli, 40, is married to Annah Ndunge, a 38-year-old housewife. Together they have three children: a son, aged 8, and two daughters, aged 4 and 2. He lives and works in Tala. Judah has been running a welding business for 6 years, and his monthly income is KES 20,000. During the time Judah has been in this business his customers have been happy with the good metal doors and windows – among other things – he has provided.

Judah was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of Tala office. He intends to use his loan to buy metals for his welding business so as to expand it and generate more profit. If the loan boosts his business Judah intends to save some money and create a bigger welding operation, employ more people and turn it into a famous business. He wants to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy metals for his welding business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia G. is married, lives in Sta. Catalina, Brgy. Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running three businesses: selling dried fish, bamboo and pigs that she has raised and fattened. Her husband Jaime, who is 59 years old, has his own store and also helps his wife. The couple has three children who range in age from 26 to 36 years old. 

Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she wanted a better life for her family. With the help of 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She has applied for a new loan, for PHP 17,000, to buy more dried fish and bamboo to sell to her customers. Her goals are to continue to expand her businesses and help her children. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and bamboo to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children. Two of her children attend school, while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Fatuma has operated an agricultural business for over fifteen years, growing tomatoes, sukuma wiki (a green vegetable) and sugarcane. She faces the challenges of seasonality and competition. Sometimes she goes without water for two days, which affects her crops. She hopes to expand the business by adding more crops.

Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans for her business. With this KES 30,000 loan she wants to pay for manual labor as well as purchase pesticides and seeds to plant onions, tomatoes and watermelon.

loans.use: to pay for manual labor as well as purchase pesticides and seeds to plant onions, tomatoes and watermelon

loans.name: Anne Shibonje

texts.en:
Anne Shibonje, 60, is married to Kizito Wanjila.  The couple live in the Eregi area in Vihiga, and they have two grown children: Judy Shiosho, 35, and Martin Akunda, 30.

Anne has been running a kerosene business for the past 4 years, and has seen her business grow in that time. She is applying for her third loan from KADET as she is in dire need of a gallon of kerosene to add to her stock. She has a passion for helping needy children in the neighbourhood, and the profits made from this loan will go toward meeting their education expenses.

Her desire is to have a kerosene supply depot. She also wants to help the needy children in society and hopefully one day open a children's home.

loans.use: to buy a gallon of kerosene

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi M. is married and lives in Purok Sampaguita, Brgy. Antipolo, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running three separate businesses: a general store, providing transportation services and selling oil. Her husband Rey, who is 46 years old, works as a truck driver, and also helps in his wife with her work. The couople has six children who range in age from 9 to 22 years old. 

Noemi joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she wanted a better life for her family. With the help of six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Noemi has been slowly lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. She has applied for a new loan, for PHP 18,000, which she intends to use as down payment for a new motorcycle and to buy more items to sell in her general store. Her goal is to save enough money to pay for the education of her children. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store and put a down payment on a motorcycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother with five children, one of whom still attends school (the other four have graduated). She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is her water bills. 

Mama Rose Kiosk (her retail shop) has been in operation for over one year. Before that she was selling dumplings. Her customers are her neighbours. She also plants peas and beans, which provide her with another source of income. Rose faces a supply challenge, as she sometimes gets inadequate stock for resale. She hopes to expand her business and start a vegetable stall in the future.

Rose decided to join Yehu to get loans to start her retail shop.  With this KES 15,000 loan she wants to purchase two bundles of maize flour, one bundle of wheat flour, sugar and paraffin.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of maize flour, one bundle of wheat flour, sugar and paraffin

loans.name: Susan Tapapul

texts.en: Susan Tapapul E. is 39 years old and lives in the Magwara section of Kilgoris town. She is married to David, who works as a farmer. The couple has eight children. Susan is applying for a loan to rent a piece of land where she can do her farming, and also to buy seeds to plant her crop. This is her first loan from Kadet Ltd, which she found out about through a friend. She intends to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand her farm. Her dream is to see her business grow to the point where she can own a piece of land and do large scale farming.

loans.use: Rent a piece of land to farm and buy seedlings

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en: Janerose is married and has two children. She is able to provide for her family because she owns and operates a grocery store. Her business is only one year old but she already employs one person. One day, she hopes to open three more outlets for her business. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to make effective use of loans to buy new items to sell to her customers.  She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her store

loans.name: Kanungu Development Club, Kihihi Group

texts.en: Here we see Charity T., a member of the Kanungu Development Club. She is a hardworking lady who has seven children, five of whom are still in school. She makes a living selling drinks such as water and soda as well as porridge in the market in Karuhinda. Her customers are mostly people who live nearby. Previously, she made a living managing a hotel until she decided to specialize in her current business. Her dreams are to expand her business and build a happy, well-educated family. She has applied for a loan to buy the supplies, such as sorghum and millet, that she needs to make porridge.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as sorghum and millet to make porridge

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen wants a loan to top up his money to buy a car for a transport business. He is married with four children. He is a taxi driver. Stephen lives in a semi permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a permanent house and educating his children so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: To top up his money to buy a taxi

loans.name: Mahira

texts.ru:
Mahira I. 34 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Mehriban ranshe jila v qorode Baku no seychas ona projivayet v Absheron regione. Tak kak Mehriban pereyexala ona pomenyala i svoy magazin.

Mehriban uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Mehriban , ona ochen blagodarna lenderam za pervuyu ssudu. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/74501
texts.en:
Mahira I. is 34 years old.  She is married and has two children.  Mahira used to live the city of Baku, but now she lives in Absheron region.  Because she has moved Mahira had to change her store.

Mahira has been in the business of selling groceries for five years.  This is her second loan and has is very grateful to the lenders for the first one.  Right now she needs 2000 AZN to stock up on groceries for resale.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en: Aggrey, age 47, is a married man with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi permanent house. He says that he started as a small scale farmer. He dreams of building a permanent house for comfortable living. He also wants to expand his plantations and open a store for his output. Aggrey wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes and millet seeds for planting and reselling.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes and millet seeds for planting and reselling

loans.name: Đồng Thôn 3 Nhóm 16 (Nhóm 16) Group

texts.en:
Mơ Trương Thị is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Mơ is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 3 Nhóm 16 (Nhóm 16).


Mơ is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Mơ operates a family member's business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Mơ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Mơ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Mơ plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.


About the other borrowers in the group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 21-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị P. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nguyễn Thị N. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing recycling services.


4.  Kiều Thị L. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Mơ Trương Thị (20203040111) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Mơ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 3 nhóm 16 (Nhóm 16).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Mơ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Mơ kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Mơ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị P. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyễn Thị N. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


4.  Kiều Thị L. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John O. is 50 years old, married to Rose Nafula and they have three children. They live in Bungoma and that's where his business is based.

John runs a bureau that offers secretarial services, e.g., typing, telephone and photocopy services. He also sells stationery in his shop. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a new computer as the one he has is not serving him well. This is the first loan he will be accessing from KADET after being introduced by a friend who is a client already. The profit from his business will basically be used to pay school fees for his children. His desire is to open a computer college in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new computer

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph M. is 36 years old from Misikhu area. He is married to Caroline M. and they have two children aged 8 years and 6 years old.

Joseph sells cereals in the market and is in dire need of buying 14 bags of maize and beans to add to his stock. He has been in this business for the past 3 years and has seen his business grow. His business is centrally based in the market and he has a huge clientele. He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd after successfully completing the first one.

His desire is to diversify into a boutique business.

loans.use: Buy 14 bags of maize and beans to add to his stock.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon wants a loan to buy local chickens for his poultry farm and medicine for his hybrid cow. He is a married farmer with seven children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of educating his children and becoming a model farmer for the locals to learn from. However, he faces challenges of price fluctuations of agricultural products and seasonal changes.

loans.use: To buy local chickens for his poultry farm and buying medicine for his hybrid cow.

loans.name: Isaac Wolio

texts.en:
Isaac K. is 37 years old, married to Linet and they have three children; Brian 10 years, Gregory 6 years and Lucy Adema 8 years old.  

Isaac has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past 12 years and he is in dire need of another motorbike. This will allow him to employ someone to help him in the business. The area has transportation problems and he wants to seize the opportunity and make his business grow. This is Isaac's third loan from KADET Ltd and he has a good credit history with us.

His desire is to be able to buy a Nissan 12-seater minibus to add to his transport business.

loans.use: Buy another motorbike to add to his business

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a member of Faulu Kenya under Bomas united group.  She makes her living running a green grocer shop.  She has been running the business with one employee.  She hopes to own her place of business instead of renting.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become disciplined in handling money as she has to part with some money on a weekly basis as part of her savings with Bomas united group.  She has requested 30,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is a 60-year-old lady from Chavano area in Vihiga. She is married to Caleb Jumba and they have grown-up children all above 18 years old.

Margaret has a cereals business that she is running and is in need of adding 10 bags of maize to her stock. She is applying for her fourth loan and has a good credit history with us. She normally has a big store where she keeps the bags of cereals as she waits for her clients to pick them up from her. Her business is doing well as she has created a huge clientele, given the fact that she has been in this business for the past 10 years.

Her desire is to be able to own a posho mill (grinding machine) for grinding maize.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of maize

loans.name: Zephur

texts.en:
Zephur M. is 59 years old and from the Chavano area. He is married to Mary M. and they have two children: Joyce Ombisa, 20 years old, and Clement Ombima, 18 years old. 

Zephur has a retail shop that he has been running for the past nine years. He is applying for his third loan from Kadet Ltd. and thus, has a good credit history with us. He needs to add sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks and bar soaps to his stock. His profits will be used to pay school fees for his children. His business is centrally based in the market and he has a huge clientele.

His desire is to be able to provide the basic needs of his family without struggle and be able to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: Buy sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc., to add to his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Moses Kilili

texts.en:
Moses is a 32-year-old, single farmer. He has been in the horticulture business for a period of about three years with a monthly profit of approximately 25,000 Kenyan shillings.  

He has never borrowed from any other MFI (microfinance institution) and this is his fourth loan from KADET LTD after successfully clearing the previous three. He intends to buy a water pump for his horticulture farm. 

He hopes to expand his farm to enable him to get more produce for sale.

loans.use: To buy a water pump for his farm

loans.name: Davis

texts.en: Davis, age 21, wants a loan to pay labor costs for workers on his plantations and to buy Irish potato seeds for planting this season. He is a young man who depends on agriculture to make a living. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi permanent house. He dreams of expanding his plantations to increase his income and to be in a position to build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: To pay labour costs for workers on his plantations and buy Irish potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Sabina Kanini

texts.en:
Sabina Kanini, aged 32 years, is married to M., aged 36 years. She lives at Kithuani in Tala and her business is in the same place.

Sabina has been running this shop for four years and her monthly profit is 6,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to cater to the basic needs in the house. She was introduced to Kadet by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office.

After getting this loan, Sabina intends to increase stock of flour, cooking oil, bar soap and other goods for sale so as to be able to make more profit. If the loan boosts the business, Sabina plans that the extra generated income will enable her to turn her retail shop into a wholesale one.

Sabina is very hardworking and has big dreams for the future.

loans.use: Increase stock of goods in the shop

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single mother of a 10-year-old child. With the income she gets from her retail shop, she is able to raise and educate her child. 

Currently, she is running her business with one employee. She hopes to open more outlets for her business in the future.  

She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy margarine, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy margarine, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. is a 40-year-old landlady in Mikindani, Mombasa, who owns several rental houses. She is married and has additional income from her husband and together, they support three children.

She has been in this business for the last six years and has done great. After being introduced to KADET by a friend, she is now requesting her second loan to open up another business of paraffin selling. She intends to use the anticipated profit to expand her businesses and in the future, she hopes to open boutiques in the town center.

loans.use: To open up another business of paraffin selling

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis O. is a thirty-three year old courier services man in Moi Avenue Street, Mombasa.

He is married to Eunice Oduor, who supports his income, and together they are blessed with three children. He has been providing courier services for the last year and has done so well. He is requesting his first loan from KADET to expand his courier business to other centers and intends to use the anticipated profit to open up a sub-branch in other towns.

Francis hopes that he will succeed in life.

loans.use: To expand his courier business to other centers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. is a thirty-two year old general landscaper and green nursery tree planter in Bamburi, Mombasa. He is a single man who only supports himself and has been in this business for the last five years and has done well.

He was introduced to KADET and now he is requesting his first loan to purchase seeds and polybags for his tree nursery, and he intends to expand and start a second tree nursery with the anticipated profits.

He hopes that he will be able to expand his business in future and live more happily.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and polybags for his tree nursery.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam, age 59, wants a loan to enable him to buy more maize and beans for reselling at a margin. He is a married man who deals in buying and reselling maize and beans to make a living. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a permanent house. He dreams of expanding his operations to neighboring areas. Adam adds that the seasonal changes in prices affect his expectation of profit from his business activity.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans for reselling

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret G. is a fifty-six year old second hand clothes dealer in Kongowea area of Mombasa. She is a widow who supports her one son and has been in this business for the last two years, and she is fairing well with the business.

Being her first loan with KADET, she hopes to add more stock of second hand clothes with the loan and use the anticipated profit to start a food kiosk as a secondary business.

She hopes to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To add more stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: John Mutwii

texts.en:
John Mutwii, aged 32, is married to Catherine Syokau, aged 27, who is a farmer, and together they have one child aged one year. He lives at Tala and his carpentry business is in the same area.

John has been running his carpentry business for three years and his monthly profit is Kshs 20,000. John was introduced to KADET LTD by the officer in charge of Tala office.

During the time John has been in this business his customers are satisfied with the wooden things he makes for them.

After getting this loan he intends to buy quality boards, more timber and nails for his business.

If the loan boosts the business, John intends to have more carpentry businesses in and outside Tala so as to target more customers. John is a dedicated businessman.

loans.use: To buy more wood and nails for his workshop.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Francisco C. nasceu na década 60 em Gaza uma das províncias do sul de Moçambique tem 4 filhos e estudam. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo na década 80 a procura de emprego, actualmente trabalha como musico instrumentista e tem um rendimento mensal fixo de cerca de 5.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Através da sua empresa soube da existência da Hluvuku e como tinha necessidade de construir a sua casa foi solicitar o seu 6º empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram aplicados no projecto da construção da sua casa o que veio melhorar a sua vida e da sua família pelo que já possui uma casa condigna e bens.

O seu sonho futuro e de concluir a sua casa e comprar um carro para transporte e para concretizar os seus projectos vai solicitar mais empréstimos no futuro
texts.en:
Francisco C. was born in the 1960s in Gaza, one of the provinces in southern Mozambique.  He has 4 children who attend school.  He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else. 

He left Gaza for Maputo in the 1980s, in search of work.  He currently works as an instrumental musician and has a monthly salary of around 5.000.00mt, which he uses for household expenses.  He is able to save a bit in his bank account. 

He learned about Hluvuku through his business, and since he needed to build his home, he requested his 6th loan, in the amount of 11.000.00mt, which he intends to use to purchase materials (cement, sand, stone, etc.) to continue construction.  His prior loans were used for the same purpose, which has improved his life and that of his family by providing them with adequate housing. 

His dream for the future is to finish construction on his home and purchase a car, and to do this he will request additional loans in the future.

loans.use: purchase constuction materials (cement, sand, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Bernardo Tacalina

texts.pt:
Bernardo Tacalina V. nasceu na Província de Zambezia, centro de Moçambique casado e pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 09 a 19 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria e sustenta seu irmão que vive com ele.

Saiu da Zambezia para Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar, é pensionista do Ministério da Defesa e recebe uma pensão mensal de 7.328.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos (BIM), conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua sobrinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, tinta, areia, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para concluir a sua residência e iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Bernardo Tacalina V. was born in the province of Zambezia, in central Mozambique.  He is married and has 4 children, ages 9 to 19.  All attend school. He only completed school through the 4th grade and did not continue because he was conscripted for mandatory military service.  He lives in his own home and also supports his brother, who lives with him.   

He left Zambezia for Maputo to complete his military service. He is a pensioner of the Ministry of Defense and receives a monthly pension of 7.328.00mt which he uses for household expenses and also saves a bit in his bank account. 

He has previously had loans with other banks (BIM).  He learned about Hluvuku through his niece who is also a client of this institution.  This is his first loan, in the amount of 10.300.00mt, which he plans to use to purchase construction materials (cement, paint, sand, iron, etc.) to continue building his house. 

He promises to pay the loan on time in order to have access to others.  In the future he plans to request additional loans to complete his home and begin a business.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, paint, sand, iron, etc. )

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old, married and has two children who are in school. For eight years, he has been rearing cattle. He works with one employee. He sells cows and goats to owners of slaughterhouses. Joseph also operates a good business of garbage collection for extra income.  

He hopes to add more livestock to his farm in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy goats and cows.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita V. is a hardworking married woman who offers transport services to earn a living. Lucita and her husband use a tricycle to offer short distance transport services for goods and people. A tricycle is a motorcycle with sidecar attached, which is used as a public vehicle. Tricycles are more expensive than tri-bike, although owners have a bigger income. She has been in this business for more than ten years. She values that the organization has supported her to improve her business; hence her better living standards.

She has requested a loan of 25,000 Php to buy another tricycle and some of the money will support the maintenance of it. She hopes to buy more tricycles in the future for better profits. She sees herself venturing into a jeepney (small bus) business in the future.

Having this opportunity of loan from KIVA through ASHI will provide a chance to achieve her ambition in life: to renovate their home, provide a good living and financial means for supporting her family, and funding the education of her children. She doesn’t stop dreaming of her children having their own businesses like her. Lucita wants to thank ASHI and Kiva lenders who are granting this loan. This is one of the greatest chances for her to begin reaching for her dreams.

loans.use: To buy another tricycle (three-wheeled-vehicle).

loans.name: Kirima Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Erisa, age 27, is a married man with three children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a semi permanent house. He has been in the poultry business for the last five years. He started with three hens which multiplied with time. He wants a loan to buy more chicken layers for his poultry business. He dreams of having a huge farm of chicken layers from which he will sell eggs and be able to educate his children.

Erisa is a member of Kirima Tweimukye Group – each member guarantees the others for accessing a loan.

loans.use: To buy more chicken layers for his poultry business

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 40 years old and a father of four. To make a living, he runs a cafeteria. He started the business two years ago. He makes extra income from masonry. Before starting his businesses, he was employed. He hopes to expand his business by opening five more cafeterias.  

He has requested 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sand and cement.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en: Wilber would like a loan to buy trousers, shirts, dresses and clothing materials for suits for reselling. He is married man and a tailor with one child. He lives in a permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of expanding his business by acquiring more sewing machines and more clothing materials for a big shop for big business.

loans.use: To purchase trousers, shirts, dresses and clothing materials for suits for reselling.

loans.name: Narnaa

texts.en: Narnaa N. is a 31-year-old, hardworking woman who lives with her husband and three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. They live in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her two older children attend a local secondary school and the youngest goes to kindergarten. Narnaa has been running a farm-animal trading business since 2006 with her husband. They purchase sheep and goats in the spring at 30.000 to 35.000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and resell them in the fall to be slaughtered. The couple has about 350 heads of herd kept nearby for a relative to look after. Her husband Lhagvajav began a transportation business with their micro-bus in 2009. He runs between Ulaanbaatar and his hometown transporting passengers once or twice a month and earns about 400,000 MNT as a profit. Narnaa wants to get their own plot of land from her business profit. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more sheep and goats to slaughter.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and goats

loans.name: Saviour

texts.en: Saviour, 32 years old, is a married man living in a permanent house in Kyenjojo Uganda. He deals in a produce business selling rice, maize and beans at a margin. In his area, this is a common business for those who have capital because if the season is right, then yields are realized fast. Saviour says he would like to have another source of income and that in the future he hopes to have a rental house. He wants a loan to buy rice, maize and beans for reselling.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize and beans for reselling.

loans.name: Angela Alfeu

texts.pt:
Ângela Alfeu V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 01, 06 e 11 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a Escola. Não conseguiu fazer o nível primário devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 1 irmão que vive com ela.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negócio próprio de venda de roupa diversa ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado, conta com ajuda do irmão e consegue em media um rendimento de cerca de 13.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar 1.500.00mt por mês através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga vendedoura que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mais peças de roupa para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria e satisfazer a sua clientela.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Ângela Alfeu V. was born in the city of Maputo, in southern Mozambique.  She is married and the mother of 3 children, ages 1, 6, and 11.  The eldest attends school.  She was unable to attend elementary school due to a lack of financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports one brother who lives with her.  

She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo.  She has had her own business selling clothing for more than 10 years.  She does not have any employees, but her brother helps her out.  On average she earns around 13.500.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and she is able to save 1.500.00mt per month through Xitique ( a traditional method of rotational savings.)

She has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who also has a business and is a client of the institution.  This is her first loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase more clothing to increase her inventory and satisfy her customers. 

She is confident that she will pay the loan off early and request another one to complete construction on her home.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Buren

texts.en: Buren A. is 34 years old and lives with his sibling in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Buren is a driver and works in the city as a taxi mechanic. Besides his work, he has been operating a cosmetics trading business at a rented stall at the local trading center since 2009. His sibling helps with his business by working as a salesperson. Buren is a modest man and is requesting a 2,280,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to purchase spare parts for his car and also to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Sara Almeida

texts.pt:
Sara Almeida M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique viúva e mãe de 5 filhos já maiores de idade. Fez somente 7ª classe e não continuou porque foi se juntar ao seu marido no outro Distrito. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu da Matola para o Distrito de Matutuine para ir residir com o seu marido. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 20 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 11.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar mensalmente através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança).

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku quando pelo escritório de Boane passava para o seu local de trabalho. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, ovos, verduras, tomate, cebola e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seus produtos.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimo para construir aviário e uma banca convencional.
texts.en:
Sara Almeida M. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is a widowed mother of 5 children who are all adults.  She only completed school through the 7th grade but did not continue because she left to join her husband in another district.  She lives in her own home and does not support anyone else. 

She left Matola for the Matutuine district to live with her husband.  She has had her own business selling basic necessities for more than 20 years, and earns around 11.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves monthly through Xitique (a traditional savings system).

She has previously had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku when she passed through the Boane office on her way to work.  This is her first loan, in the amount of 10.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (cooking oil, eggs, vegetables, tomatoes, onion, etc.) to increase her stock of merchandise. 

She promises to pay the loan on time in order to have access to others.  In the future she plans to request an additional loan to build a chicken coop and a stand to sell items.

loans.use: compra de produtos (óleo, ovos, verduras, tomate, cebola e outros)

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a widowed lady with two children. To raise her family, she sells second-hand clothes in her shop, W. New Arrivals. It has been eight years since she started the business. She also does farming so as to earn extra income.  

She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale one in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, jeans and jackets.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, trousers, jeans and jackets

loans.name: Tuyatsetseg

texts.en:
Tuyatsetseg is 48 years old, married, and mother of 6 children. She lives in a small house with her husband and 4 children in Ulaanbaatar city, capital of Mongolia. Her husband Adilaa works long hours as a taxi driver to support the family. Two elder daughters live separately. Her two sons 18 and 20, are both attending university. The younger two children go to secondary school nearby their home.

Tuyatsetseg has operated a retail butcher business in the biggest meat market in Ulaanbaatar city for the last 14 years. She has gained valuable experience in previous years, and has a loyal customer base. She is grateful to those responsible for making her dream come true by giving her children good education and morals, therefore she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines. She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of meat and increase her business and income potential.

loans.use: To increase her business and to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a young man who is 29 years old.  He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house in which he lives with his wife and two children. He earns income from cattle sales. He dreams of expanding his business. Bernard wants a loan to buy cows to resell at a margin.

loans.use: To buy cows for reselling.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en: Bayanjargal T. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. The family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of his daughters attend a local school while his wife is currently unemployed. Bayanjargal works as a taxi driver. He began his business in 2005, and since then, has gained much experience. He purchased a plot of land where he is planning to build a fence. He is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan in order to improve his car.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard wants a loan to purchase first hand clothes for reselling at his shop. He lives in the town ship of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house in which he lives with his wife and seven children. He earns income from selling clothes. He dreams of expanding his clothing business into a wholesale business and educating his children for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase first hand clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Baatarbek

texts.en:
Baatarbek S. is a 29-year-old, business-minded, hardworking young man who lives with his wife and an infant in Khovd province, western Mongolia. His wife stays home taking care of their child. 

Baatarbek started his transportation business in 2008 and since then, he has gained a lot of experience. He transports livestock. In another word, he purchases goats and other livestock from Khovd province, then he transports them to Ulaanbaatar city. He sells livestock in Ulaanbaatar in wholesale. As his business expanded, he purchased a plot of land where he built a nice house so that the family's living conditions have been improved. Baatarbek is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase goats to resell.

loans.use: To purchase goats to resell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry N. is 31 years old and he supports seven people in his family. He is a farmer and he does wheat farming, which he has been doing for the last eight years.

This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to a good climate and adequate rainfall throughout the year. He learned about KADET LTD from other members within his area of residence who are already registered clients.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by renting a bigger farm to increase his wheat production. He is a hard working man and, supported financially, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno M. is a twenty-five year old boutique owner in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is married to Joseph Nyanje, who supports her income, and together they are blessed with one child. She has been in this business for the last two years and has a good income. 

She was introduced to KADET and now she is requesting her second loan to purchase bales of cloth for her boutique. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business and educate her children. 

In future, Luvuno hopes to succeed in life and have a big family.

loans.use: To purchase bales of cloth for her boutique.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema C. is a thirty-seven year old charcoal dealer and landlady in Mikoroshoni, Mombasa. She is married to Festus Baya, who supports her income, and together they are blessed with three children. She has been in this businesses for the last four years and she has been doing well. 

Rehema is now requesting her second loan from KADET to renovate her rental houses and purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her businesses and in future she hopes to own more rental houses and succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Christopher Mutua

texts.en:
Christopher Mutua, 46, is married to Virginia Mueni. He lives at Tala and his cereals shop is at Machakos Sokoni retail shops. 

Christopher has been running his cereals shop for 5 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 40,000. His wife Emily is a housewife. Christopher was introduced to Kadet by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office.

During the time Christopher has been in this business, his customers have developed a lot of interest in his cereals and have referred other customers to his shop and this has really grown his business. After getting this loan, he intends to buy more rice, beans, maize, green grams and black beans to increase his stock.

If the loan boosts the business, Christopher intends to save the money and buy more stock, which will help him turn his retail shop into a wholesale business. He is a self-motivating businessman and hardworking.
