loans.use: To buy rice, beans, maize, green grams and black beans to increase his stock.

loans.name: Enhbadrah

texts.en: Enhbadrah L. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a nurse at the children's hospital and their oldest son is a college student. Enhbadrah started his business in raw-materials trading, then he changed it to trousers selling. He owns a stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market, where he operates his business. Once or twice a month he purchases his goods from China. Enhbadrah wants his children to get a good education. He is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more goods.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Reuben Mutuku

texts.en:
Reuben Mutuku, 40 years old, is married to Alice, 35, who is a teacher by profession, and together they have one child who is six months old. He lives at Tala and his agrovet business is in the same area.

Reuben has been running his agrovet shop for 5 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. He was introduced to Kadet by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office. During the time that he has been in this business, his customers have been happy with his services and advice. He has applied for a loan which he intends to use to increase the stock of agro chemicals in his small shop and increase business to be able to supply more customers.

If the loan boosts the business, Reuben intends to have more agrovet shops in and outside Tala, so as to increase his customer base and help them reach him easily. Reuben is a devoted businessman, who believes one day he will have a chain of shops and later grow to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: Increase his stock of Agro chemicals.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua S. is a thirty-nine year old food vendor in Mtongwe, Mombasa. She is married to Mohamed S., who supports her income, and they are blessed with two children. She has been in this business for the last three years and her income is great. 

Mwanambua has now applied for her second loan in KADET and she wants to purchase dry food stock like wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her business. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. 

She hopes that in future she will own residential houses for rental, and succeed in life.

loans.use: To purchase dry food stock like wheat flour, beans, and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Sammy Kiplagat

texts.en:
Sammy Kiplagat C. is 33 years old, married to Lilian Rotich, who is a farmer and provides a source of additional income for the family. They have three school going children aged 8, 6, and 4 respectively. Sammy sells potatoes and has been in this business for 2 years and earns a monthly profit of Ksh.15,000.

Sammy learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area, and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy 10 bags of potatoes. The anticipated profits will be used to expand the potatoes business.

In future, Sammy wishes to have a pick-up truck to use for transportation. His deeper desire is to see his children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Moffat

texts.en:
Moffat Mukunyi is a thirty-seven year old retail shop owner and he also delivers milk in the Barsheba area of Mombasa. He is married to Naomi Waithera, who works in their shop, and together they are blessed with two children. Moffat has been in this business for the last five years and has done a great job.

Being a member of KADET, he would like to add more stock of bars of soap, wheat, and maize flour. He intends to use the anticipated profit to boost his milk supply and hopes that he will be successful in life.

loans.use: To add more stock of soap, wheat, and maize flour.

loans.name: Siria

texts.es:
La señora Siria P. de  Valdez  esta casada tiene 55  años de edad,  vive en en Barrio Pacua cua en casa propia   tiene 2 hijos. 
La señora Siria   es comerciante, posee un puesto de venta de ropas para damas y caballeros  bien surtida  viaja a Buenos Aires y San Pablo para la compra de sus mercaderías.  Mediante esta actividad pueden solventar  sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le presente se dedican a esta actividad hace mas de 20 años.  

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercaderías, remeras, vestidos, blusas, shorts y otros.
texts.en:
Siria P. de  Valdez is married and is 55 years old.  She lives in the Pacua neighborhood in her own home, and she has 2 children.

Siria works in retail trade.  She has a well-stocked post where she sells clothing for men and women.  She travels to Buenos Aires and San Pablo to purchase her merchandise.  Through this activity she can pay her bills and cover any unexpected expenses that might arise. She has been in this line of work for more than 20 years.  

She has requested a loan to buy more merchandise: T-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts and other items.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts and other items of clothing

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora F. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en en Barrio Arroyo Pora,  es separada, tiene 3 hijos. 
La señora Salvadora  es comerciante, hace 7 años que se dedica a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. 
Mediante esta actividad pueden solventar  sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le presente. 
Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercaderías como remeras, camisas, remeras, camisillas, shorts, y otros.
texts.en:
Salvadora F. is 42 years old and lives in the Arroyo Pora neighborhood. She is separated and has three children. 

Salvadora is a merchant. For seven years she has worked selling clothing for women, men and children. By means of this business they are able to cover their expenses as well as any unforeseen expense that may arise. 

She has requested this loan in order to buy more merchandise such as knit tops, shirts, T-shirts, shorts and other apparel.

loans.use: To purchase shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses, T shirts and dresses

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga F. tiene 53 años de edad, está separada hace mucho tiempo, y tiene hijos ya mayores de edad independientes económicamente.

La señora Olga es comerciante desde hace muchos años, ella es propietaria de un local de venta de calzados de todo tipo, tales como calzados para damas, caballeros, deportivos, sandalias, ojotas y otros, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mas 15 años y su comercio ha ido creciendo poco a poco con el tiempo mediante que supo invertir. Gracias a esta actividad hoy en dia a ella le va muy bien, ya tiene su local propio en el Circuito Comercial de la ciudad de encarnación y vive en su propia casa que esta situada en el Barrio San Isidro.   

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercaderías, específicamente calzados para niños.
texts.en:
Mrs Olga F. is 53 years old.  She has been separated for a long time and has children who are already grown up and financially independent.

Olga has been a shopkeeper for a long time.  She owns a shoe store which sells all types of footwear including ladies' shoes, men's shoes, sports shoes, sandals and flip flops.  She has been in this business for more than 15 years and it has been growing little by little over time as she knew how to invest in it.  Thanks to her business she now lives very well.  She already has her own premises in the Circuito Comercial (outdoor shopping center) in the city of Encarnación and she lives in her own home which is in the San Isidro neighborhood.

She has requested this loan to buy more merchandise, specifically children's footwear.

loans.use: Purchase of children's footwear

loans.name: Silver Group

texts.en:
Sufian is 31 years old and married with two children. For nine years, he has been selling chickens to hotels. He works from 7:00 am until 8:00 pm and earns a weekly profit of about $67. 

This will be Sufian's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. He used his previous loan to renovate the cage where he keeps his chickens. He wishes to use the current loan to build a toilet at his home; currently he must share with neighbors. Sufian dreams of building up his business so that he can support the best hotels in town.

Sufian is a member of the Silver Group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. Sufian can be seen in the photo, first on the right, wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To build a toilet at his home.

loans.name: Gedion Musee

texts.en:
Gedion M., aged 31, is married to Josephine, and together they have one child aged 9. His primary business is transporting people using motorcycles, a business popularly known as ‘’bodaboda’’ in Kenya.

Gedion and his wife are also farmers as their secondary business, so as to supplement the motorcycle transport business. His business of 2 years generates a profit of Kshs 5,000.

He was introduced to Kadet by the Credit officer in charge of Tala office. With the loan he has applied for he plans to repair and service his motorcycle. 

Gideon’s customers are well-served and contented by his comfortable transportation, and he plans that the extra money generated from the business will be used to improve his farming business and also buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To repair and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ambai Salau

texts.en:
Ambai Salau, aged 30, is a livestock trader. He is married to Mariah, 32, who is a farmer, and together they have two daughters aged 14 and 2. He lives at Enkaroni village in Kajiado, and sells his livestock at Dagorreti and Kitengela markets within Nairobi. He also sells his livestock to the Kenya Meat Commission for better profits.

Ambai has been running his livestock trading business for 2 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 28,000. He was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of Kitengela office, which is near his Kajiado residence. His area of residence has a very busy market, so Ambai’s livestock are bought at good prices, and he uses the profits to take care of his family and educate his older daughter.

After getting this loan, Ambai intends to use Kshs 20,000 to buy cows, Kshs 10,000 to buy goats, and  Kshs 10,000 to buy sheep for trading, and if the loan boosts the business he intends to buy a piece of land and build his own business premises where he can keep his livestock safely.

Ambai is young, ambitious and hardworking and dreams of becoming a big supplier of livestock to Kenya Meat Commission.

loans.use: To buy cows, goats and sheep.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce O. is a thirty-five year old cereals sales lady in Likoni Mombasa. She is married to Hezekiel, who is a contractor, and supports her income. They are blessed with four children. Joyce has been in the cereals and onion selling business for the last year and has done a great job. 

Joyce has now applied for her second loan in KADET, and she wants to purchase more sacks of cereals and onions for sale and use the anticipated profit to boost her second business, which is food vending. She hopes to have a successful future.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of cereals and onions.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por mujeres oriundas de Trinidad,  y son  beneficiadas por el crédito grupal, desde mayo del 2007. Renovaron por 12va vez de forma excelente.

Trinidad es una zona turística más que comercial, por lo que algunas integrantes realizan sus actividades en ciudades aledañas, mientras que otras desarrollan sus negocios en el barrio donde viven.

La directora general, Nancy R., tiene 3 hijos y trabaja conjuntamente con la señora Ramona C., quien ocupa el cargo de directora de finanzas. 
Esta última está casada con Ricardo Chávez, de profesión albañil. 

Doña Ramona comentó en una oportunidad que estaba muy contenta ya que estaba terminando de pagar un terreno para su casa propia con la ayuda del crédito recibido de la Fundación Paraguaya.    
Las dos trabajan en la venta de ropas, y solicitan el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, vestidos, shorts, y otros. 
La mayorías de las integrantes  están desde el inicio del comité, por lo que se conocen muy bien y manifiestan estar contentas de formar parte de un grupo de mujeres y poder ahorrar para tener un fondo de seguridad que les da solvencia en casa imprevisto.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of women who are natives of Trinidad.  They have been beneficiaries of group credit since May of 2007.  They are entering their 12th loan cycle in great shape.

Trinidad is an area that relies more on tourism than commerce, so some of the members carry out their businesses in adjacent cities, while others develop their businesses in the neighborhoods where they live.

The director general, Nancy R., has 3 children and works jointly with Ramona Christaldo, who occupies the position of director of finance.

Ramona is married to Ricardo Chavez, who is a bricklayer.

Ramona states that on one occasion she was very happy because she was finishing paying for a piece of land for her own home with the help of a loan that she received from the Fundación Paraguaya.    

The two women work selling clothing, and they request this loan to buy T-shirts, shirts, dresses, shorts and other clothing items.

Most of the members of this group have been members since the beginning, and so they know each other very well.  They state that they are happy to be part of this group of women, and to be able to save so that they can have a security fund that they can tap into in the event that they have unforeseen expenses.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, shorts and dresses

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Christina is 31 years old and married with four children. For two years, she has been selling cakes and vegetables door-to-door. She works from 7 am until 11 am and earns a monthly profit of about $17. 

This will be Christina's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her first loan to pay school fees for her children, and would like to use the current loan to buy books for her children.

Christina is a member of the Ebeneza Group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. Christina can be seen in the back, second from the left.

loans.use: To buy books for her child.

loans.name: Justina Mutheu

texts.en:
Justina Mutheu, aged 23, is married to Alexander, who is a driver, and together they have one child, a daughter aged 5. She lives in Tala and her business is in the same place. 

Justina has been running a retail shop for 2 years and her monthly profit is Kshs 15,000, which she uses to cater for the basic needs in the house to assist her husband in the daily running of the home. She was introduced to KADET by the loan officer in charge of Tala office, and she has applied for a loan which she intends to use to buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and flour to uplift her business so as to increase profit.

If the loan boosts the business, Justina plans to use the extra income to buy more stock and grow her business into a wholesale business. Justina has very happy customers, because she treats them with respect, is hardworking, and has big dreams for the future.

loans.use: To buy stocks of cooking oil and fat, sugar, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Matokeo Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 30 years old and has one daughter who is in school. Since 2008, she had sold clothing, but starting four months ago, she began selling fruits and vegetables. She works from 6 am until 8 pm and earns about US$ 80 a month in profits. 

This will be Mwanaisha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She plans to use the loan to expand her fruit and vegetable business.  She dreams of one day owning a store where she can sell food and drinks.

Mwanaisha is a member of the 'Matokeo Group'. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. Mwanaisha can be seen in the photo in the middle row, second from the left.

loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 20 integrantes de Coronel Bogado,  se han formado como comité hace poco tiempo, desde febrero del 2010 para ser beneficiarias del  crédito grupal. Renovaron por 3ra.vez solicitando el crédito en 3 meses  a fin de cancelar y volver a solicitar en el mes de diciembre para poder contar con capital para invertir y surtir  sus negocios antes de las fiestas de fin de año, teniendo en cuenta el movimiento comercial de las fiestas de navidad y año nuevo. 
Varias de las integrantes  realizan sus actividades en la zona de la terminal de ómnibus, ya que se encuentra en el centro del movimiento comercial y de la misma ciudad. 
 Cuentan con un ahorro de 1.452.000gs., destinado a fondo se seguridad.

La directora general, Maria G., con 43 años, está casada con Mauro Cabrera, cuyo fruto has sido 5 hijos. 
 Ella y su familia viven en el barrio Santa Librada. Su marido se dedica a la carpintería y ella tiene un kiosco donde se dedica a la venta de bebidas y comestibles de varios tipos.  
   
Comenta que está muy contenta con su grupo ya que trabajan bien y solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas como gaseosa, vinos, cervezas, y carne, y aceite.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 20 members from Coronel Bogado.  They came together as a communal bank a short time ago in February of 2010 in order to benefit from a group loan.  They have entered their third loan cycle, requesting the loan over 3 months in order to be able to pay it off and request a new one in the month of December. This way they will have capital to invest and stock their businesses before the end-of-year holidays, bearing in mind the increased commercial activity of the Christmas and New Year holidays.

Several of the members carry out their businesses in the area around the city's bus station since it is located at the heart of the commercial activity and the city itself.

They have savings of 1,452,000 Paraguayan guaranis which is to be used as a security fund.

The director of the communal bank, Maria G., is 43 years old.  She is married to Mauro Cabrera and they have 5 children.  She lives with her family in the Santa Librada neighborhood.  Her husband works as a carpenter and she has a kiosk from which she sells different types of drinks and food.

She comments that she is very happy with her group since they work well and she is requesting the loan to buy drinks such as soda, wine and beer as well as meat and oil.

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and meat

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 30-year-old married man with two children, aged 9 and 12. He owns and runs a retail shop. Besides that, he runs a restaurant for extra income. He is able to take care of his family with the income he gets from his businesses.  

His retail shop has been active for three years and he hopes to expand it to a wholesale shop. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and soap

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 29-year-old married man with two children aged five and two.  He supplies bread and cakes.  Through his business, he is able to take care of his family.  He has been running the business for five years.  He has requested for a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy a bicycle for transporting his bread and cakes.  With the loan, he will also buy cakes, bread and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle, cakes, bread and wheat flour

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio San Arroyo Porá  surguió por promociones realizadas en la zona, el grupo se encuentra en el 9º ciclo, es un comité antiguo opera con la Fundación desde el año 2006  con pagos excelentes, tienen un ahorro de 3.487.320  Gs. . 
La Directora General es la Sra. María del Pilar T. es casada con 1 hijo, su marido  es albañil, ella invierte en compra de ropas de un comercial donde consigue a buenos precios por la compra en cantidad, luego lleva a su zona y realiza la venta en forma ambulante y también sobre pedido.
 Comenta la Sra, María del Pilar que el crédito que recibe dentro del comité es de mucho valor para ella ya que cada vez que recibe   vuelve a invertir en su negocio y de sus ganancias paga la cuota de su comité y también es un ingreso importante para su familia.
 En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, camisas, blusa de varios colores y modelos para la temporada, shorts, jeans y otros.
texts.en:
This group from San Arroyo Porá neighborhood came together as a result of promotional activities in their area.  The group is in its 9th loan cycle.  It is a long-standing communal bank which has been with Fundación Paraguaya since 2006.  They have made excellent repayments and have savings of 3,487,320 Paraguayan guaranis.

The director of the bank is Mrs María del Pilar T..  She is married with one child.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  She buys clothes from a sales rep.  She obtains them at a good price because she buys in bulk.  She then transports the clothes to the area where she lives and sells them in an itinerant manner and also on request.

Mrs María del Pilar comments that the loan which she receives within her communal bank is very valuable to her since each time she receives it she re-invests it in her business.  From her profits, she makes her repayment to her communal bank and also has a considerable income for her family.

On this occasion she is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, shirts, blouses of different colors and styles for the season, shorts, jeans etc.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts, jeans

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of one. To raise her child, she runs a boutique where she sells shoes and clothes.  On the side, she does dairy farming for extra income. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kes. to buy clothes and shoes.  For this loan, she has been guaranteed by her group members in Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Nyerere Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old and married with two children. For the past year and a half, she has been selling kangas (cloth commonly worn by Swahili women), powdered soap, and face creams door-to-door. She works from 9 am until 4 pm and earns a daily profit of approximately US$ 10. 

This will be Fatuma's second Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  Her dream is to one day build a house and to live a good life.  

Fatuma is a member of the 'Nyerere Group'. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. Fatuma can be seen in the photo in the second row, first from the right.

loans.use: To increase her business selling kangas, powdered soap, and face creams

loans.name: Nar

texts.fr: Madame Nar S. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle habite à Yoff. Elle mariée et mère d’un  enfant de 29 ans. Elle s’active dans la confection d’habits. En plus elle vend  du petit déjeuner dans une école du quartier. Elle a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans ces activités. La vente de petit déjeuner est une activité qu’elle a héritée de sa mère. Et c’est sous l’influence de cette dernière qu’elle a fait son choix. C’st un grand plaisir pour elle de confectionner des habits et de les vendre a crédits a ses clients. Elle est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2004. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus et de garnitures destinés à la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices afin de pouvoir faire face au règlement de la scolarité de ses petits fils. Elle souhaite aussi renforcer son épargne de sorte à parvenir à acquérir un terrain dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Ms. Nar S. is a 53-year-old woman who lives in Yoff.  She is married and the mother of one child, who is 29.  Ms. S. is active in making clothing.  In addition, she sells breakfasts in a district school.  She has over ten years of experience in these activities.  Selling breakfasts is a business that her mother passed down to her.  And under her guidance, Ms. S. then made her choice.  She really enjoys making clothing and selling them, on credit, to her customers. 

Ms. S. has been a member of the Yoff branch since January 2004.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for buying cloth and some trim to be sold.  Her goal is to increase her profits in order to cope with schooling costs for her grandchildren.  She also wishes to bolster her savings, so that she is able to acquire a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: Buying cloth and trim

loans.name: Ndeye Soce

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Socé S. est une femme de 35 ans qui vit dans la communauté de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant de 14 ans. Avant de s’orienter vers la vente de petit-déjeuner elle pratiquait la vente de bonbons. Ce qui l’intéresse dans l’activité qu’elle a choisi c’est son aspect rentable qui lui permet d’assister sa famille. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts dans l’institution. Elle est sociétaire à Yoff depuis février 2004. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs dans le but de renforcer  son fond de commerce en vue des préparatifs de la rentrée scolaire. Son vœu est de développer son commerce jusqu'à acquérir une grande cantine.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Socé S. is a 35-year-old woman who lives in the community of Yoff.  She is married and the mother of a child, who is 14.  Before becoming interested in selling breakfasts, she used to sell candies.  What interests her in her chosen work is the profits, which enable her to support her family. 

Ms. S. has already repaid two loans with the micro-finance institution UIMCEC.  She has been an associate there in Yoff since February 2004.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs with the goal of bolstering her business capital.  This is for preparing for the start of the school year.  Her wish is to develop her business, so as to acquire a large market stall.

loans.use: Boosting her capital

loans.name: Thiaba Khoye

texts.fr: Madame Thiaba Khoye habite a Dakar. Elle est âgée  de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 et 3 ans. Thiaba Koye est éducatrice depuis des années dans un  programme à Yoff. En même  temps elle gère la caisse et la comptabilité. Elle a choisi ce métier dans le but de gagner sa vie. Mais son salaire ne lui permet pas de satisfaire toutes les charges  familiales auxquelles elle est confrontée. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis décembre  2002. Elle a déjà remboursé 6 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires dans le but de soutenir sa famille dans la gestion du manger quotidien. Le financement lui permettra d’améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Thiaba Khoye lives in Dakar. She's 37 years old. She's married and the mother of 2 children, the oldest of whom is 3, and the youngest 1. Thiaba Khoye has been a teacher for a program in Yoff, Dakar for several years. At the same time, she manages the cash and accounting. She chose this career in order to make her living, but her salary doesn't allow her to pay for all of her family's needs. She is a member of the Yodd branch of UIMCEC since December 2002. She already paid back 6 loans. She is now asking for a loan of 50 000 francs in order to buy food products in order to support her family's daily nutritional needs. This loan will allow her to improve her family's situation.

loans.use: achat denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Roy is in her mid-thirties.  For the past three years, she has had a business collecting pieces of wood, often in Iringa, which is in the south of Tanzania.  She then sells the wood to carpenters to be used in construction.  She works from 8 am to 5 pm and earns a weekly profit of about US$ 53.  

This is Roy's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more wood for resale.  Roy is a member of 'Ustawi Group'.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  In the picture, Roy can be seen second from the right in the second row, wearing blue.

loans.use: To obtain more wood for resale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.ar: خالد عمره 44 سنة لديه اربعة اولاد وزوجة يعمل في بيع القهوة والاكسبرس وايضا في مجال بيع السكاكر والزيوت والحبوب لديه رغبة في تحسين وضعه الاجتماعي  ووضع اولاده من خلال تأمين عيش افضل وتامين القوت اليومي لهم وهذا من خلال اخذ قرض من المجموعة لشراء مكنة اكسبرس قهوة وايضا مكنة ايس كريم لديه محبة من جميع محيطه وله زبائنه الخاصين ولديه تاريخ مشرف مع المجموعة انه ملتزم جدا وهو يرغب في فتح مصلحه خاصة له وتطوير نفسه .

loans.use: To buy a coffee machine

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 29 years old and a member of Faulu Kenya under Maono group.  She sells electronics and plastic containers such as disposed basins and pegs.  She has engaged in the business for five years.  She hopes to succeed in the business so as to help her community.  She is glad to be a member of Faulu Kenya because she has gained knowledge on business management.  She has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy radios, bulbs, plastics and spanners.

loans.use: To buy radios, bulbs, plastics and spanners.

loans.name: Busena

texts.en: Busena J. is currently in the business of selling bread at the road side  and is requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell.  Busena is 30 years old and is .arried. Her husband is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more bread to sell

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday K. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer at home  and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Sunday is 50 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 5 children and 3 of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He works in tiles

loans.name: Yumema

texts.en: Yumema C.  is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Yumema is 36 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up charcoal store.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Patrón San Juan Evangelista Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Patrón San Juan Evangelista inicia su sexto ciclo con 14 socias las cuales pertenecen al departamento D. Huancavelica, las socias tienen diversos negocios.
Maria Antonieta es socia del Bancomunal, tiene 2 hijas D. 20 y 19 años, su negocio es L. venta D. materiales D. construcción, tiene una pequeña tienda tipo ferretería, Maria Antonieta inicia su negocio con L. venta minoritaria D. materiales, actualmente da en concesión al Gobierno Regional D. su localidad y tiene múltiples pedidos. Gracias a los prestamos que ha recibido, le ha permitido ir invirtiendo e incrementando su negocio, ahora solicita un préstamo D. S/.500.00 para L. compra D. productos D. construcción como ladrillo y  arena.
El sueño D. Maria Antonieta es tener una tienda propia y una ferretería, posteriormente comprarse una casa en Lima.
texts.en:
The communal bank Patrón San Juan Evangelista is starting its sixth cycle with 14 members who live in the departament of Huancavelica. The members have various busineses. 

Maria Antonieta is a member of the communal bank. She has two daughters, aged 20 and 19. Her business is selling construction materials. She has a small hardware-type store. Maria Antonieta started her business as a small scale vendor of materials. At present, she has the concession of the Regional Government of her area and she has multiple orders.  Thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to invest in and grow her business. Right now she is asking for a loan of  S/.500.00 to buy construction products such as brick and sand. Maria Antonieta's dream is to have her own hardware store and later buy a house in Lima.

loans.use: To buy construction products

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 31 years old and she is married with two kids, ages 4 and 6 years old. Pelagie is a self-employed businesswoman selling new trousers as well as shirts. Pelagie has been in this business for about three years. The business hours are from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

Pelagie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing different styles of new jeans as well as shirts. Hopefully, she will earn more profit which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in her future.

loans.use: To buy different styles of new jeans as well as shirts

loans.name: Itiala

texts.en: Itiala Y. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread like tamia, legemat, etc  and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour to bake more bread to sell.  Itiala is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has 3 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up restaurant.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of baking flour to bake more bread to sell

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Santa María Conavi surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación. 
Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de comidas, almacén,  despensa, lavandería, venta de frutas y verduras , venta de ropas v, venta de cosméticos, Manualidades.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Mariela quien se dedica  a la venta de lencería, ella se encuentra satisfecha con su grupo y quiere seguir trabajando, ya que el crédito la ayuda para algunos gastos y compra de mercaderías.
Es una mujer trabajadora y talentosa, realiza varios trabajos diariamente en su casa y también fuera de ella con el fin de ayudar a mi familia.
Actualmente decidió  invertir en la venta de lencería, cosméticos, perfumes para lo que solicita el préstamo.
Ella desea ofrecer estos productos en sus tiempos libre a conocidos, vecinos, amigos, y otros para comenzar.
Espera que el nuevo negocio le resulte bien y agradece por la ayuda créditicia.
texts.en:
Tis group from  the Santa María Conavi neighborhood began when one of the members had contact with the Foundation.  All of the women do different activities such as:  selling food, a store, a convenience store, a laundry, selling fruits and vegetables, seling clothes, selling cosmetics, artisan crafts. 

One of the members is Mariela, who sells lingerie. She is satisfied in this group and wants to keep working, since the credit helps her with some expenses and to buy merchandise.  

She is a hardworking and talented woman. She performs several tasks every day inside and outside of her house in order to help her family.  At present, she has decided to invest in selling lingerie, cosmetics, and perfumes, for which she is asking for the loan. 

She wants to offer these products in her free time to acquaintances, neighbors, friends and others to start. She hopes that the new business will go well and she is grateful for the lending help.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Stela

texts.en: Stela J.  is currently in the business of selling cakes and bread at the market and is requesting a loan to stock crates of soda to sell.  Stela is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a police man. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up restaurant.

loans.use: Stock crates of soda to sell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Comité Oñondivepa,así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en Capiata en fecha 29 de julio de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas,quien se dedica a la venta de ropas artesanales.
Mediante una charla informativa de la asesora acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Gabriela es una de las integrantes y posee un comedor, se dedica a la venta de comidas, ya sean comidas rápidas y el plato principal de mediodía, posee clientela formada, teniendo en cuenta la calidad y buena atención en su local.
 Desea abaratar los costos de producción adquiriendo en cantidades los productos no perecederos para la fabricación de las comidas, como son aceites, condimentos, fideos, arróz, harina, huevos, etc., así también ampliar con la varidad de bebidas, teniendo en cuenta el calor de la temporada que provoca gran demanda de gaseosas, refrescos y jugos naturales.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa Committee is the name of this group of women, which was formed in Capiata on July 29, 2009, thanks to the current Financial Director, who sells handmade clothing.

By means of an informational talk about the Program, 21 women got together.  They are now in their fourth loan cycle and are working well together in the program, being very well-coordinated and united.

Gabriela is one of the members and has an eatery where she sells fast foods and lunches.  She has steady customers, who take into account the quality and customer service of her business.

She wants to lower her production costs by purchasing non-perishable products in bulk, such as oils, condiments, pasta, rice, flour, eggs, etc.  She would also like to increase the variety of beverages she has, taking into account the seasonal heat that leads to high demand for soft drinks and juices.

loans.use: Purchase products to make meals

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana María  trabaja con la institución desde hace bastante tiempo para ser mas exactos  desde el año 2005, es una cliente muy responsable y de buena actitud ya que nunca tubo problemas en el pago de sus cuotas, la señora tiene una librería- bazar  que atiende todos los días, en la tarde le acompaña su hija que estudia en un colegio de la zona, en la misma librería la señora realiza trabajos de pintado en tela con lo cual se ayuda y como un pasatiempo, su esposo trabaja como fisioterapeuta en un l instituto,  El crédito que solicita es para la compra de material escolar para la librería, quiere surtir su librería, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Ana Maria has dealt with the lending institution for some time, since 2005 to be exact.  She is a very responsible client with a good attitude and has never had a problem making her payments.  She runs a bookstore in which she works every day.  In the evenings she accompanies her daughter who goes to school in the area.  She also creates paintings in her store, both for income and as a hobby.  Her husband works as a physical therapist in an institute.  The loan she is requesting is for buying school supplies for her bookstore.  She is very grateful to the institution for the help she has been given.

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Ana Belisa

texts.es:
Ana Belisa tiene 23 años y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Ana Belisa es una joven emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo platería como por ejemplo aretes, collares, pulseras y otras cosas más, ella vende sus productos en la ciudad de Aguas Calientes. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Ana Belisa con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para comprar materiales como platería. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ana Belisa is 23 years old and a member of the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank, part of the Arariwa Microfinance Unit of Cusco, Peru.  And Belisa is an enterprising and hard-working young woman who works selling silver crafts, such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and other things.  She sells her products in the city of Aguas Calientes.  (In the city of Cusco is located one of the eight wonders of the world, the Inca city called Machu Picchu).

With the next loan she hopes to receive of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy materials for her silver making.

She is grateful for the opportunity given through these means and she promises to comply with the payments from the repayment schedule.

loans.use: ella invertirá el dinero para comprar materiales como platería.

loans.name: San Antonio Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité San Antonio Poty es un excelente  comité conformado el 22 de diciembre de 2008, integrado por 19 mujeres de Capiatá, se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 6º ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades  tales como: compra ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos, compra de bijouterie, compra de frutas, compra de carbón, compra de artículos de mercería, compra de ropa, compra de remedios naturales, compra de tela, compra de carne, compra de remedios naturales, compra de productos para la despensa, compa de helados.
Es un grupo muy activo, todas las integrantes demuestran compañerismo y solidaridad, asisten a las reuniones semanales y realizan actividades para recaudar fondos para el bien común del grupo.

La Sra. Lourdes quien es una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de ropas, ya hace bastante tiempo que se encuentra en ese ramo y como llego la temporada de primavera-verano, desea cambiar y ampliar el stock de mercaderías que posee, teniendo en cuenta la proximidad de fin de año y la buena demanda que se espera por estas festividades.
Ella para abaratar sus cuotas y contar con gran cantidad de mercaderias solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas para la temporada primavera - verano, como vestidos, jeans, shorts, remeras, y otros.
texts.en:
The San Antonio Poty Committee is an excellent committee formed on December 22, 2008 by 19 women from Capiata.  They now find themselves working happily in the 6th cycle of the Committee's Program of Enterprising Women.

The members of this group plan to use the loan for various activities, such as: purchase of ingredients for food preparation, jewelry, fruit, coal, notions, clothing, natural remedies, fabric, meat, other foodstuffs, and ice cream.  It is a very active group, and all its members demonstrate comradeship and solidarity, attend the monthly meetings, and collect money for the common good of the group.

Mrs. Lourdes, one of the members, works selling clothing, which she has done for some time.  Since the spring-summer season has begun, she wants to increase the stock that she possesses, keeping in mind the proximity of the end of the year and the demand she expects because of these festivities.

She wants to increase her income lowering the price of her merchandise, acquiring large quantities for sale at retail and by installments.

loans.use: Adquisición en cantidades mayoristas de ropa temporada primavera-verano

loans.name: Alex David

texts.es:
Alex tiene 27 años, es soltero y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Alex es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo platería como por ejemplo aretes y otras cosas más, él vende sus productos en la ciudad de Aguas Calientes. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Alex con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1500 nuevos soles, él invertirá el dinero para comprar materiales como platería. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alex is 27 years old, single, and participates in the Arariwa Micro Finance Unit's “Señor De Los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Alex is a hardworking and enterprising youth who sells handicrafts made of silver, such as earrings and other items.  He sells his products in the city of Aguas Calientes.  (The city of Cusco is located near one of the 8 wonders of the world, the citadel of the Incas called Machu Picchu.)

Alex is awaiting his next loan of 1,500 Peruvian soles, which he will invest the purchase of supplies such as silver.

Alex is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and, in addition, promises to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: he will invest the money to buy supplies such as silver

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda O. is from the town of Talibon. She is 56 years old. Esmeralda is married. Her business is a sari-sari store where she sells various kinds of products. She opened her store at the front of her house because she wants to be able to manage it any time of day. Esmeralda is happy to be of service to her neighbors, she likes selling to them. She also hopes for her store to grow and have more products to sell.

Esmeralda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and noodles.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Lourdes es una de las socias antiguas de nuestra Institución, ya que primero trabajo en Banco de Emprendimiento ocupando el cargo de Tesorera y ha demostrado ser puntual y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, también demostrando solidaridad con sus compañeras. Pero actualmente ella solicito un crédito individual para poder surtir  su tienda de barrio ya que es la única de su zona, con el dinero del crédito comprara, variedad de galletas y dulces, refrescos, abarrotes, etc. La señora Lourdes  es casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están en la Universidad y un pequeño de 4 añitos, por tal motivo la Sra. Tiene que trabajar duro por los gastos que implica el estudio de sus hijos mayores, uno de los deseos de la Sra. Lourdes es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Lourdes is one of the veteran members of our Institution as she first worked for the Village Bank in the position of Treasurer and has shown herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments, as well as supportive of her fellow members. But currently she is requesting a loan as an individual in order to be able to supply her neighborhood shop as it is the only one in her area. 

With the money from the loan she will buy a variety of cookies, crackers and sweets, drinks, groceries, etc. Lourdes is married and has four children of whom three are studying at the University and one little four-year-old. She must work hard on account of the expenses incurred by her three older children's education. One of Lourdes's wishes is to see her children working as professionals. She is very grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Unidas es un excelente  comité conformado el 05 de noviembre de 2.008, integrado por 15 mujeres  de Capiata, se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 5º ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Es uno de los mejores grupos que se encuentra trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya ya que la mayoría de las integrantes del grupo siguen activas desde el primer préstamo y con eso demuestran solidaridad y compañerismo.

La Sra. Luciana quien es una de las integrantes posee una Mercería, en la cual ofrece variados porductos para el hogar, en cuanto a decoración, arreglos, adornos, chiches etc. se refiere. 
Desea incrementar sus ingresos ampliando el negocio y adquiriendo más variedad de artículos para su comercialización, teniendo en cuenta la demanda existente y la proximidad de las fiestas y actividades de fin de año.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas communal bank is an excellent communal bank which was formed on November 5th, 2008.  It is made up of 15 women from Capiata.  They are happily working on their 5th loan cycle from the communal bank's 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' ('Enterprising Women') program.

It is one of the best groups working with Fundación Paraguaya since the majority of the group's members have been active since the first loan, thereby showing solidarity and comradeship.

Luciana is one of the members.  She owns a notions store in which she offers various decorative products for the home; arrangements, ornaments, trinkets, etc.

She would like to increase her income by expanding her business and acquiring a greater variety of articles to sell bearing in mind the existing demand and the upcoming end-of-year holiday season with its parties and festivities.

loans.use: To purchase articles for a notions store (trinkets, gifts, etc.) in bulk

loans.name: Xecaxjojense Group

texts.es: Doña Santos E. P. es un señora casada, tiene  dos hijos, es analfabeta, se dedica a la agropecuaria crianza de animales, tiene 15 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Xecaxjojense. El grupo cuenta con cinco  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar: la crianza de animales, Comercio, venta de blusas, venta de plásticos y utensilios de cocina. El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de animales y alimentos para la crianza de  estos animales,  y cuando esto crezcan los vendera Doña Santos E.. Espera que su inversió aumente, con la ayuda del crédito que solicita en Asdir. Esperan mejorar sus condiones de vida.
texts.en: Doña Santos E. P. is a married woman who is not educated She has two children. One of them is married, and she is responsible for both. She raises small animals and has been in this business for 15 years. With enthusiasm and with the help of some neighbor women, they formed a group to apply for a loan. The group is called Xecaxjojense. It has five women members who work at various activities; among them we can mention the raising of animals, commercial sale of blouses, and sale of plastics and cooking utensils. Doña Santos E. P. will use the loan to buy animals to raise and thus increase the volume of her sales. She hopes that her business will become bigger and more productive with the help of the loan that she is seeking from ASDIR.

loans.use: Buy animals

loans.name: Veronica Roxana

texts.es:
Verónica  resiD. en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután, tiene un negocio llamado CIBER FRIENDS, vive con su esposo, su madre y su primer hijo, verónica tiene 30 años es licenciada en computación y su padre decidió instalarle un ciber en su propia casa, es por ello que administra este negocio e invierte en él desD. hace 3 ½. En este momento ella solicita un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a las computadoras y en la actualización D. algunos periféricos; esto le ayudara  a tener un mejor rendimiento  D.  las PC, atendiendo mejor a los clientes y dándoles un mejor servicio.
 Su proyección es  tener en buenas condiciones su negocio, mejorar sus servicio y que su familia cuente con  mayores ingresos para solventar las necesidades del diario vivir.
texts.en: Veronica lives in Jiquilisco in the Usulután department.  She has a business called "CIBER FRIENDS."  She lives with her husband, her mother and her first child.  Veronica, 30, has a degree in computing, and her father decided to install an internet cafe in her own home.  She runs this business, and has invested in it for 3 and a half years.  Now she requests a loan to do maintenance on the computers and update some of the peripherals.  This will help her to get better performance from her PCs and proviD. better service to her customers.  Her plan is to have her business in good condition and to improve its services, so that her family will be able to count on a better income to cover the daily necessities of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her computers

loans.name: Dannys Geovanni

texts.es:
Dannys de 19 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, reside en el Puerto El Triunfo, departamento de Usulután ,  vive con su madre y su hermano , es soltero y no tiene hijos, el negocio lo inicio trabajando con su padre luego quiso ser independiente para lo cual inicio este negocio, su única dificultad  es que tienen mucha demanda de producto y no cuentan con un vehículo para entregar la mercadería a domicilio por lo que se ven en la necesidad de alquilar un carro para realizar las ventas generando un mayor gasto para ellos .
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de mas producto y dar abasto a toda la demanda, logrando obtener mayores ingresos viendo de esta manera más cerca el sueño de comprar su propio vehículo, esto le ayudara a progresar como persona y como  comerciante; sus sueños son crecer en el negocio, poseer su carro, tener un buen inventario  de producto, cancelar a tiempo  este préstamo  y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dannys is 19 years old and sells shellfish. He lives in Puerto El Triunfo in the department of Usulután. He lives with his mother and his brother. He is single and doesn't have any children. He started out working with his father, then he wanted to be independent, so he began this business. His only difficulty is that there is a lot of demand for his product and he doesn't have a vehicle to deliver his merchandise to homes, so it is necessary to rent a car to complete his sales, and this generates a considerable expense.

He is applying for the loan so that he can buy more product and meet the demand, and also obtain greater income, thus coming closer to his dream of buying his own vehicle. This will help him progress as a person and as a businessman. His dreams are to expand his business, have a car, have a good inventory of product, pay back this loan on time, and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: Buy shellfish to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 56 años D. edad, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, tiene una carnicería, vive con sus hijos, es una señora muy trabajadora, ella quedo al pendiente D. este negocio desD. que su esposo falleció, la carnicería tiene ya 30 años D. existir, siendo el ingreso del hogar para solventar los gastos, su venta es D. carne, costilla D. res y los derivados del ganado.
Ella quiere comprar más reces para el destazo y D. esta manera darle una mejor atención a la demanda por parte D. los clientes, con este préstamo mejorará su inventario teniendo siempre carne disponible para la venta; su propósito es crecer con el número D. clientes,  tener un negocio estable y en condiciones para competencia.
texts.en:
Doña María ia 56 years old. She lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. She has a butcher shop and lives with her children. She is a very hard-working woman. She has depended on this business since her husband died. The butcher shop has already been in existence for 30 years, providing the household income to pay expenses. She sells meat, beef ribs, and cattle byproducts.

She wants to buy more cattle to butcher so that she can better meet the demands of her customers. With this loan, she will improve her inventory so that she always has meat ready to sell. Her aim is to increase the number of customers and have a stable, competetive business.

loans.use: Buy cattle to butcher

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María Susana, es comerciante de mariscos y semilla de marañón,  es madre soltera tiene un hijo y comparte la vivienda con su madre,  ellas residen en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, este negocio se lo enseño su madre y lo administra desde hace 6 años.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertir en mercadería, fortaleciendo de esta manera el negocio y recibiendo mayores ingresos que son necesarios en el hogar para cubrir de una manera mejor los gastos y las necesidades.
María quiere ser buen cliente, con un buen historial para seguir trabajando con esta institución por un largo tiempo.
texts.en:
María Susana is a merchant of seafood and cashew nuts. She is a single mother with one child and shares living quarters with her mother. They reside in Jiquilisco, department of Usulután. Her mother taught her this business and she has been running it for six years. 

She is seeking a loan to invest in merchandise, strengthening the business by this means and bringing in more income which is needed in the home in order to better cover their expenses and necessities. 

María wants to be a good client with a good history in order to continue working with this institution for a long time.

loans.use: To purchase seafood

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María Nelis, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas, ella vive con su esposo y su hija; este negocio lo atiende desde hace 7 años y trabaja con el apoyo de su esposo.
Ella quiere invertir en el negocio y proporcionar a los clientes verdura y fruta fresca, de diferentes clases, más de las de temporada; solicita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión y lograr alcanzar un desarrollo y atender a un buen número de clientes, obteniendo de esta manera mejores ingresos.
Su proyección es tener un negocio amplio, estable que le genere los ingresos necesarios para cubrir con las necesidades cotidianas y ser un buen cliente en esta institución.
texts.en:
María Nelis lives in Usulután with her husband and daughter. She sells fruit and vegetables. She has worked in this business for 7 years and works with the support of her husband.

She wants to invest in her business and supply her customers with fresh fruit and vegetables of different and more seasonal types. She is applying for a loan to make this investment and reach this stage of development, where she will serve a good number of customers and in this way obtain a better income. Her plan is to have an extensive, stable business that generates the income necessary to cover the daily necessities and to be a good customer of this institution.

loans.use: Buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Zonia Maribel

texts.es:
Zonia tiene 30 años D. edad, es comerciante D. Ropa Americana, vive en Jiquilisco departamento D. Usulután con su esposo y su hija D. 14 años D. edad; este negocio lo atienD. desD. hace un año, ella es discapacitada y sus labores las desarrolla en una silla D. ruedas.
El deseo D. superación D. Zonia es granD., y su espíritu D. crecer como microempresaria la lleva a solicitar un préstamo para la compra D. ropa para la venta, ella a pesar D. su problema físico, está en condiciones para seguir con su negocio y con este préstamo piensa contar con variedad D. ropa, para tener acceso a ventas mayores.
Su proyección con el préstamo es lograr la inversión deseada, que su plan D. mejorar el negocio se pueda desarrollar y ser un cliente excelente en esta institución.
texts.en:
Zonia is 30 years old and is a merchant of American clothing. She lives in Jiquilisco, department of Usulután, with her husband and 14-year-old daughter. She has been looking after this business for one year. She is disabled and carries out her work in a wheelchair. 

The desire to overcome in Zonia is strong and her push for growth as the owner of a micro-enterprise has inspired her to seek a loan in order to buy clothing for sale. In spite of her physical handicap she is in good shape to continue on with her business. With this loan she plans to stock a variety of apparel in order to access bigger sales volumes. 

Her projected goals with the loan are to achieve the desired investment, that her ideas for improving the business would go forward as planned and that she would be an excellent client in this institution.

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Isidra Francisca

texts.es:
Isidra de 43 años, vende comidas rápidas en una carreta, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Hace tres años atrás ella comenzó con el negocio de comidas rápidas en una carretillas. Por la falta de ingresos ella continuo con su caretilla vendiendo hamburguesas, papas fritas, hot dog y bebidas para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. La carretilla la tiene ubicada a cinco cuadras de su casa con la ayuda de sus hijos ha podido turnarse en las noches y obtener mas dinero. Por la ayuda de sus hijos hasta ahora todo le ha ido bien. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes y pollos para hacer mas comidas rápidas. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa ya que ahora es de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Isidra is 43 years old. She sells fast food from a wagon. She lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a district on the outskirts of Guayaquil, where the roads are dirt and the houses are located in the mountains).

Three years ago she began her business of selling fast food from a little cart. For lack of (other) income, she continued with her little cart, selling hamburgers, french fries, hot dogs, and drinks to be able to help with the family expenses. The cart is located five blocks from her house. With the help of her children, she has been able to take turns (attending the cart) at night and obtain more income. Because of her children's help, everything has gone well for her so far.

She wants to use the loan to buy meat and chicken to prepare more fast food. In the future, she wants to improve her house since it is now made of bricks.

loans.use: Buy chicken and meat to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel Ángel P. cuenta con 30 años de edad, el nos contó que desde muy joven trabajó en la elaboración de ladrillos junto con su padre, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y tener un título universitario. 
Con el correr de los tiempos se hizo dueño de una olería (fábrica de ladrillos a base de arcilla que es quemado en un horno), dicho dinero será destinado para la compra de la olería, el lo consiguió trabajando día a día en la olería de su padre, compro esa olería para poder de esa forma trabajar  y así construir su propia casa donde más tarde se pueda independizar.
   El crédito solicitado es para la reparación del trapiche de la olería (mescladora de arcilla), ya que con el tiempo ya le hacía falta un poco de refacción.
  El señor  Miguel Ángel P. agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel P. is thirty years of age. He tells us that from a very early age he worked making bricks alongside his father and so did not have the chance to go to school nor obtain a university degree. 

With the passage of time he became the owner of an olería (a factory producing bricks out of clay that is baked in a kiln). Said money will be used for the purchase of the olería. He obtained it by working day by day in his father's olería and bought that factory so as to have a means of doing this work. He hopes to build his own house where he may one day become independent. 

The requested loan is for repairs to the factory's clay mixer since over time it was needing a bit of refurbishment. 

Miguel Ángel P. gives thanks to the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan that was granted.

loans.use: For repairs to a clay mixer

loans.name: Jose Isaias

texts.es:
José reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su mamá, tiene un negocio que es propio desde hace 4 años aproximadamente, el negocio se llama Máxima Electronic y está ubicado frente a una iglesia en el centro de la ciudad.
Aprendió este negocio hace mucho tiempo cuando entro como empleado y poco tiempo después estableció el propio negocio. Él quiere construir su casa y solicita un préstamo para compra materiales de construcción como arena, cemento y mano de obra, esto ayudara a que pueda comprar los materiales y pueda comenzar su propia vivienda.
El quiere contar con su vivienda, sentirse cómodo y ser buen cliente para continuar trabajando a través de préstamos para desarrollarse como comerciante.
texts.en:
José lives in the El Transito district of San Miguel. He is 25 years old and lives with his mother. He has had his own business for approximately four years. The business is called Máxima Electronic and it is located across from a church in the center of the city.

He learned this business a long time ago when he began as an employee, and a little while later he established his own business. He wants to build a house and is applying for a loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and labor. This will help him so that he can buy the materials and begin constructing his own home.

He wants to have his own house, to feel comfortable, and he wants to be a good (loan) customer so that he can continue working through the loans to develop as a businessman.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Rosa Eva

texts.es:
Rosa de 61 años, es costurera y confeccionista, en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Por la necesidad de trabajar y la falta de oportunidades Rosa comenzó a trabajar como costurera y confeccionista porque era la actividad que mas le gustaba realizar. No tiene horario fijo ya que su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en una parte de su casa. Trabaja haciendo ropa por pedidos. Una de las dificultades al trabajar es que su casa esta mal construida y tiene problemas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y comprar cemento para arreglar un poco su casa. En el futuro quiere seguir con salud y seguir trabajando para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Rosa is 61 years old. She is a tailor and seamstress on the outskirts of Guayaquil, in an area surrounded by the salt estuary.

Because of the need to work and the lack of opportunities, Rosa began to work as a seamstress and tailor because it was what she liked to do best. She does not have a fixed schedule, since her workshop is located in part of her house. She makes clothing on order. One of the difficulties of her work is that her house is badly constructed and has problems.

With the loan she wants to buy fabric and cement to repair her house a little. In the future she wants to continue being healthy and continue working to be secure in her old age.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and cement

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Roció S.  es una mujer de 29 años que vive en la capital de Colombia: Bogotá;  allí tiene una empresa dedicada al diseño y confección de prendas de vestir en la línea infantil y vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 2 y 9 años respectivamente.
Hace 4 años trabajando como operaria de producción en una empresa de confecciones, se le ocurrió iniciar su propio negocio y hace tres,  lo emprendió como una unidad satelital de prendas, así a ella le envían la ropa cortada para que la ensamble en su taller, ubicado en su propia casa, en un barrio muy comercial; Roció trabaja con el sistema de maquila en la línea infantil y quiere avanzar logrando ser mas independiente, para lo cual se está preparando, porque su sueño es adecuar su casa, para diferenciar mejor  la actividad  productiva de su vida familiar y fabricar en el taller su propia línea de confección, de esta manera ella diseñaría sus productos y también realizaría la actividad de comercialización.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y requiere un credikiva para comprar materiales de construcción, adecuar su taller y pagar mano de obra de una producción de ropa infantil ya en proceso; Así Rocio estaria dando sus primeros pasos para lograr expresar independientemente su potencial creativo.
texts.en:
Roció S. is a woman of 29 who lives in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. There she has a business dedicated to the design and manufacture of articles of children's clothing. She lives with her common-law husband and their two children, ages 2 and 9.

Four years ago, when she was working as a production worker in a garment business, it occurred to her to begin her own business, and three years ago, she embarked on her business as a satellite garment unit. Thus they send her cut clothing (pieces) so that she can assemble it in her workshop, which is located in her own home in a very commercial district. Roció works in the assembly plant system in the children's clothing line, and she wants to advance and become more independent. She is preparing to do this, because her dream is to adapt her house, to differentiate better between her commercial production and her family life, and to make her own line of clothing in the workshop. She would design her own products and would also sell them.

This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and she needs a Kiva loan to buy construction materials, adapt her workshop, and pay for labor for the production of children's clothing that is already in progress. Thus Roció would be taking her first steps to independently expressing her creative potential.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to adapt her workshop and pay for labor to produce children's clothing that is already in progress

loans.name: Karina Desiree

texts.es:
Karina de 36 años, tiene un pequeño puesto de cabinas telefónicas. Vive con sus tres hijos en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Por la necesidad económica y debido a que su esposo lo mataron y la dejo con tres niños pequeños que aun estudian en escuelas fiscales se vio en la necesidad de invertir todos sus ahorros en unas cabinas telefónicas. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene un centro de llamadas que le ha ayudado ha mantener a su familia. Trabaja desde muy temprano con una empleada que le ayuda cuando ella tiene que ir atender a sus hijos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar recargas para celulares y una copiadora. En el futuro quiere comprar computadoras para tener un Cyber.
texts.en:
Karina, age 36, has a small phone booth business. She lives with her three children along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil (a periurban area surrounded by a salt marsh).

Out of financial necessity resulting from the death of her husband, Karina decided to invest all of her savings in a few phone booths in order to support her three young children who were attending public schools. This turned out to be a good decision because she now has a call center that helps to support her family. She starts work very early and has one employee who helps her whenever she has to leave to take care of her children.

With this loan, Karina wants to buy rechargeable phone cards for mobile phones and a photocopier. In the future, she wants to buy computers in order to start a cybercafé.

loans.use: Purchase rechargeable phone cards & a photocopier

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 48 años, es vendedora de productos de uso personal herbalife y Avon ( empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo). Vive con sus tres hijos y esposo en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado).    

Hace 4 años atrás comenzó con las ventas de productos de uso personas Avon. Debido a su salud tubo que comenzar a tomar productos Herbalife por lo buenos resultados que le dieron a su cuerpo decidió no solo vender Avon sino combinarlo con productos herbalife. En la actualidad es vendedora de Avon y herbalife trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta que pueda vender los productos en stop. Vende te-batidos, perfumes, cremas, etc.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos herbalife, perfumes, cremas para tener un volumen de ventas mejorado. En el futuro quiere comprar un terreno para construir su casa y tener cuartos de alquiler.
texts.en:
María, age 48, sells personal products manufactured by Herbalife and Avon (a company that helps women entrepreneurs sell cosmetics at a low cost). She lives with her husband and three children along the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil, a periurban area surrounded by a salt marsh.

Four years ago, María began selling personal products as an Avon salesperson. Due to health problems, she began taking Herbalife products and achieved good results that made her feel better. She decided to combine her business by adding Herbalife products to the merchandise she sells. María currently works from 8am until she is able to stop selling her products. She sells powdered shakes, perfumes, crèmes, and other items.

With this loan, María wants to buy Herbalife products, perfumes, and crèmes so that she can increase her volume of merchandise and improve her sales. In the future, she wants to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house and have rooms available for rent.

loans.use: Purchase Herbalife & Avon products to sell

loans.name: Aldea Nimasac Group

texts.es: Doña Isabel Osorio D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad, ella no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, tiene 6 hijos  dos mayores D. edad y cuatro menores, su esposo se dedica al tejido D. cortes típicos y ella a la Crianza D. Animales, ya que cuenta con mucha experiencia en esta actividad, y D. esta forma obtiene ganancias para poder colaborar con los gastos educativos D. sus hijos. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. unas vecinas, organizaron un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina ALDEA NIMASAC, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes, llevando el nombre D. la aldea. El grupo cuenta con 12 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza D. animales, elaboración D. candelas, tejido D. cortes típicos y venta D.  consumo diario.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. Cerdos y aves, y D. esa forma incrementar su Producción y así generar más ingresos. Ya que ella anhela  que su producción crezca, pero por falta D. capital, no ha podido, y considera que con este crédito crecerá su producción y aumentarán sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel Osorio, age 43, did not have the opportunity to attend school. She has six children, two of whom are grown while the remaining four are minors. Her husband manufactures traditional clothing while she raises animals. Isabel has plenty of experience with her business and is able to generate income to cover her children’s educational expenses. With enthusiasm, the desire to succeed, and the help of some neighbors, Isabel was able to organize a group for the purpose of requesting a loan.

This Communal Bank is called “Aldea Nimasac”, a name selected by all of the members which happens to be the name of their neighborhood. The group consists of twelve women who are engaged in different business activities such as raising animals, making candles, manufacturing traditional clothing, and selling daily consumer goods. Isabel will use her loan to buy pigs and chickens so that she can increase her production and generate more income. Her greatest wish is to grow her business, but due to a lack of capital, she is not able to do so. With this loan, she believes she will be able to accomplish her goals.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire pigs & chickens

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
TIMOTEO es casado con Pilar tienen seis  hijos, trabaja todos los días se dedica a la venta de ejotes , chile pimiento tiene un terreno cerca del rio es allí donde tiene sus cosechas y en su casa vende leña y también tiene venta de chamarras. Timoteo   SE DEDICA A LA crianza de pollos , los cuida en sus ratos libres , cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposa ella es comerciante ambulante se dedica a la venta de cortes típicos y sobre fundas por abono , vende todos los días es asi como Timoteo  obtiene ganancias..
Solicita el crédito para comprar PRODUCTOS DE LA CANASTA BASICA y asi vender otro poco mas y asi sobrevivir. Agradese a FAPE por la ayuda brindada manifiesta que es una institución distinta alas demás por su forma de trabajo, su sueño es tener  su propia empacadora y asi exportar nacional e internacional  ,sabe y tiene fe que con la ayuda de Dios su sueño puede ser realidad
texts.en:
Timoteo is married to Pilar and they have six children. He works every day selling beans and chili peppers. Timoteo owns a plot of land near the river where he farms. At home, he sells firewood and jackets. Timoteo also raises chickens in his spare time. He has the support of his wife who works as a traveling merchant, selling traditional clothing and bags of fertilizer. She generates sales every day, as does Timoteo, in order to earn an income.

Timoteo is requesting a loan so that he can buy basic food products and generate a few more sales in order to survive. He is grateful for the help FAPE has provided since it is a distinct institution that has been supportive of his work. His dream is to have his own packing business so that he can ship goods nationally and internationally. Timoteo has faith in God that his dream can become a reality.

loans.use: Purchase basic food products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es: Doña Ana P., tiene cuarenta y cinco años D. edad, es analfabeta ya que desD. niña tuvo que trabajar para colaborar con los gastos del hogar y por eso no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, ella tiene 3 hijas dos mayores D. edad y la pequeña D. 17 años, su esposo es agricultor y ella se dedica a la Crianza D. Animales (Cerdos y Pollos) y ya tiene suficiente experiencia en ésta producción y lo realiza con el fin D. obtener ganancias para colaborar en gastos D. educación D. su hija como del hogar. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. unas vecinas  y compañeras D. un programa D. agricultura organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MUJERES ALEGRES, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 12 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza D. animales, Confección y venta D. ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra D. Cerdos, y D. esa forma incrementar su Producción y así generar más ingresos. Ya que el sueño D. ella es que su producción crezca, pero por falta D. capital, no ha podido, y considera que con este crédito crecerá su producción y generara mas ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
