Doña Ana P., age 45, did not attend school because she had to work in order to help with the household expenses. As a result, she has been illiterate since she was a young girl. She has three daughters, of whom two are grown while the youngest is 17. Her husband works as a farmer while she spends her time raising animals (pigs and chickens). Ana has sufficient experience and is able to generate income to help with her daughter’s education as well as the household expenses. She possesses great enthusiasm and the desire to succeed. With the help of some of her neighbors and fellow participants in an agricultural program, she organized a group for the purpose of requesting a loan.

This Communal Bank is called “Mujeres Alegres” (Cheerful Women), a name that was selected by all of the members. The group consists of twelve women who engage in different types of businesses including raising animals, sewing, and selling traditional clothing. Ana will use her loan to buy pigs in order to increase her production and generate more income. Her dream is to grow her business, but is not able to do so because of a lack of capital. She believes this loan will help her accomplish her goals so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire pigs

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es:
Fernando de 28 años, es taxista informal en las calles de Guayaquil. vive en una zona periurbana rodeada de un estero y llamada Perimetral. 

Cuando el tenia 14 años empezó a trabaja como cobrador en un bus de transporte urbano ya que ayudaba a su mama con los gastos familiares porque su papa falleció cuando el cumplió 10 años  y no había suficientes ingresos. Como el tubo que conseguir el dinero para su casa el quiso seguir la misma profesión de su papa que era chofer. Cuando a el lo liquidaron de una empresa que estaba trabajando el dinero que le dieron lo utilizo para comprar un carro. Fernando convirtió el carro en taxi informal desde ese tiempo he ha venido trabajando en dos turnos desde las 06h00am hasta las 12h00 y desde las 16h00pm hasta las 23h00pm. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar repuestos para su carro y cemento y arena para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere comprar un bus para tener dinero y así construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Fernando, age 28, is an informal taxi driver who travels the streets of Guayaquil. He lives in a periurban area surrounded by a marsh along the Perimetral Highway.

When he was 14 years old, Fernando started working as a fare collector on a city bus in order to help his mother with the family expenses. His father died when he was ten years old and his family did not have sufficient income. In order to continue generating household income, he began working as a taxi driver which was the same profession as his father. When the company he worked for went out of business, the severance pay he received was used to buy a car. Fernando converted it into an informal taxi and now works two shifts between the hours of 6am to noon and 4pm to 11pm.

With this loan, he plans to buy spare parts for his car as well as cement and sand to make improvements to his house. In the future, Fernando wants to buy a bus to earn more money and continue making improvements to his house.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his vehicle & materials for home improvements

loans.name: Superacion Group

texts.es: Doña Rosa P., es madre soltera, tiene veinticinco años D. edad, curso el sexto grado D. primaria, tiene 1 hija D. cinco años, ella se dedica a la confección D. Sudaderos, ya que cuenta con años D. experiencia porque desD. pequeña se dedicaba a esta actividad y con los ingresos, cubre sus gastos personales y la D. su hija, tomando en cuenta que sola ella es la encargada D. los gastos, porque no recibe ninguna ayuda económica del papá D. la niña. El próximo año su hija ingresaría a la escuela del paraje, por lo tanto se le estaría aumentando los gastos y ella sueña con un negocio granD. para salir adelante con su hija. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos D. superación y la ayuda D. una prima y vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un crédito. El Banco Comunal se denomina SUPERACIÓN, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes, con el pensamiento D. que D. ellas depenD. la superación personal y familiar. El grupo cuenta con 11 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza D. animales, elaboración D. utensilios D. cocina, tejido D. servilletas, confección D. prendas D. vestir y venta D. consumo diario.  El crédito ella lo utilizará para compra D. telas, y D. esa forma incrementar su Producción y así generar más ingresos. Ya que el sueño D. ella es que su negocio crezca, pero por falta D. capital no ha podido, y considera que con este crédito la ayudara aumentar su negocio y generara mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y la D. su hija.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa P., age 20, is a single mother with a sixth graD. education. She has a five year old daughter and earns her living by manufacturing sweatshirts. Rosa has years of experience in this business because she has been working since she was a young girl. With the income she earns, she is able to cover her personal expenses and that of her daughter. Rosa is solely in charge of the expenses because she does not receive any financial support from the father of her daughter. Next year her daughter will enroll in school, so her expenses will increase. She dreams of having a large business so that her daughter can get ahead. With enthusiasm, the desire to succeed, and the help of a cousin and her neighbors, Rosa organized a group for the purpose of requesting a loan.

This Communal Bank is called “Superación” (To Overcome), a name that was selected by all of the members with the belief that they can overcome with inner personal strength and the support of their families. The group consists of eleven women who are engaged in different business activities such as raising animals, manufacturing cooking utensils, weaving napkins, making clothes, and selling daily consumer products. Rosa will use her loan to buy fabrics so that she can increase her production and generate more income. Her dream is to grow her business, but she lacks the capital to do so. She believes this loan will help her accomplish her goals, allowing her to achieve personal development and help her daughter grow.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy fabrics

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “Kantu de San Jeronimo” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco comunal esta en el sexro ciclo aproximadamente 2 años de trabajo y la junta directiva está conformada por el señor David que es el presidente, la señora Maribel que es la secretaria, el señor Fausto que es tesorero y la señora Silvia que es la fiscal.    

Algunos de nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de celulares, venta de comestibles y otros socios brindas servicios como por ejemplo; arreglo de carros, fabricación de muebles metálicos, enseñanza, transporte de pasajeros y guía de turismo. 
     
La socia Maribel tiene 34 años y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus dos hijos y su esposo y después se dedica exclusivamente a sus negocios. Maribel tiene una cabina de internet y un locutorio en su domicilio, ella también se dedica a la venta de celulares, a brinda servicio de llamadas y a la venta de productos nutricionales. Ya son varios años que se dedica a los negocios y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia Mónica requiere el préstamo para hacer  mantenimiento de la cabina de internet. 

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the Kantu de San Jeronimo communal bank and live in Cuzco. The communal bank is in its 6th cycle, approximately 2 years of work, and the board of directors is composed of David, the President, Maribel,  the Secretary, Fausto, the treasurer, and Silvia the auditor. 

Some of the members alternate their various activities at home with the sale of cellular phones and food, while other members offer services, for example, car repair, furniture making, teaching, transportation and tourism guides.

Maribel is 34 years old, and wakes up very early to tend to her two children and her husband. After that she is dedicated solely to her business. Maribel has an internet stand and phone booth in her home. She also sells cellular phones, offers a calling service, and sells food. She has been working at this business for several years and has done very well because of the effort she puts into her work. Maribel needs a loan to maintain her internet stand.
     
The members value and appreciate the loans received through this service, and are also committed to making their payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain the internet stand.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es casada con Jose  tienen sus hijos pequeños están en edad escolar , paulina trabaja todos los días vendiendo en su local cosas del consumo diario , tiene que aprovechar en si las festividades para vender al doble , a parte de eso en su casa tiene una crianza de pollos y cerdos los cuida mucho ya que en  estos tiempos los tiene que ir engordando y asi le pagan bien se acerca la feria de san martin jilotepeque, paulina cuenta con el apollo de jose ya que tiene una peluquería y también trabaja todos los días .
Solicita el crédito para comprar productos de granos basicos y compra de cerdos pequeños,agradese a FAPE  por la ayuda brindada , paulina sueña con tener un local propio para ya no alquilar y asi ahorrar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Paulina is married to Jose and together they have young children who are of school age.  She works every day selling daily consumer products from her store.  Paulina plans to take advantage of the holidays in order to double her sales.  In addition to managing her store, she raises chickens and pigs at home and looks after them with great care.  Lately she has spent time fattening them so that she can get paid well when it comes time to sell them at the fair in San Martin Jiltepeque.  Paulina has the support of her husband Jose, who operates a barber shop and also works every day.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains and piglets.  Paulina is grateful for the support FAPE has provided.  She dreams of owning a store so that she no longer has to rent and hopes to save a little more.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains & piglets

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 49 años, es conviviente y participa en el banco comunal “Señor De Los Temblores II” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Marcelina es una madre emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo aretes, ella exporta sus productos al país de Brasil. (En la ciudad de Cusco se encuentra ubicada una de las octavas maravillas del Mundo que es la ciudadela de los Incas llamado Machupicchu).  

Marcelina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para comprar materiales como platería. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old and in a common law marriage. She participates as a member of the Communal Bank “Señor De Los Temblores II”, which is a microfinance unit of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Marcelina is an enterprising and hardworking mother who sells handcrafted items, such as earrings. She exports her products to the country of Brazil.

(The city of Cusco is located near one of the Eight Wonders of the World, the city of the Incas known as Machu Picchu.)

Marcelina hopes to receive her next loan in the amount of 2000 PEN. She will invest the money in the purchase of materials, such as silver.

Marcelina is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase materials, such as silver

loans.name: Cruz De Mayo - Pincha Group

texts.es:
Graciela Isabel U. V., viuda, de 50 años de edad y con 4 hijos. 
Inicio con su bodega hace 5 años a raíz del fallecimiento de su esposo. También se dedica a la agricultura.
Sus hijos se encuentran cursando estudios superiores. 
Ella trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, de este modo vienen sacando adelante sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Graciela Isabel U. V., age 50, is a widow with four children. She opened a store five years ago after the death of her husband. Graciela also engages in farming. Her children are pursuing their higher education.

She works with the help of her older children, enabling her to move forward with her two businesses.

loans.use: Operating capital to invest in a store

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana forma parte del banco comunal “Las Pioneras del Comendador” perteneciente a la comuna de Estación Central. Ella trabaja en su casa con una amiga confeccionando cortinas, faldas de colegio y haciendo arreglos varios, como bastas de pantalón, hace 4 años. Una sobrina le enseñó este rubro. 
Con este préstamo comprará una máquina de coser, ya que la que tiene le está fallando y ya no tiene arreglo. También comprará telas. 
Tiene 4 hijos, de 16, 13,11 y 7 años. Cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo, quien es guardia de seguridad. Su sueño es tener un taller de costuras con las máquinas necesarias en su casa. 
Para Adriana ha sido muy grato trabajar con Fondo Esperanza y participar de las reuniones con sus compañeros de grupo, de quienes ha obtenido apoyo y confianza.
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del XIX. Esta comuna tiene 14 kilómetros cuadrados de superficie, con una alta densidad poblacional que llega a los 9.247 habitantes por kilómetro cuadrado.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of “Las Pioneras del Comendador” community bank which is located in the Estación Central district.  For 4 years she has been working from home with a friend making curtains and school skirts and also making alterations such as hemming pants.  A niece taught her this line of work.

She will use this loan to buy a sewing machine since the one she has now keeps breaking down and can't be fixed.  She will also buy material.

Adriana has 4 children aged 16, 13, 11 and 7.  She has financial support from her husband who is a security guard.  Her dream is to have a sewing workshop with the necessary machines in her home.

For Adriana it has been very pleasant working with Fondo Esperanza and taking part in the meetings with her fellow group members from whom she has received support and trust.

Estación Central is a district in the central area of Santiago (the capital of Chile) which owes its name to the Central Train Station which dates from the 19th Century.  This district is 14 square kilometers and very densely populated at 9,247 inhabitants per square kilometer.

loans.use: Sewing machine and material

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
El señor Zacarías Z. M. es de la comunidad de Cotani Alto de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba. Nació el 11 de de Junio de 1970 tiene 40 años, con tres hijos  que están en la escuela en su comunidad, la casa donde vive es con techo de paja con paredes de barro.

La actividad de don Zacarías es la agricultura trabaja solo con su familia, en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos ayudando entre ellos. El crédito que solicito es para comprar los insumos agrícolas. El objetivo de don Zacarías es de incrementar sus ingresos económicos en los próximos años con lo que está solicitando crédito.

En su comunidad produce papa, papalisa, haba y cereales la producción es estacional en la zona, es la parte alta de la Provincia y está ubicado a 8 km al norte del capital aproximadamente.
texts.en:
Mr Zacarías Z. M. is from the Cotani Alto neighborhood, in the province of Tiraque, in the department of Cochabamba.  He was born on June 11th 1970.  He is 40 years old and has three children who attend the local school.  The house where he lives has a straw roof and mud walls.

Zacarías is a farmer.  He works alone with his family and in some cases with the help of his neighbors who help each other.  The loan which he is requesting is to be used to purchase farming supplies.  Zacarías' goal is to increase his financial income over the next few years which is why he is requesting the loan.

In his community he produces potatoes, 'papa lisa' (a root crop common to the area), beans and cereals.  The production in the area is seasonal.  It is in the top part of the province and approximately 8km north of the capital.

loans.use: Working capital for farming work

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciendo a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella tiene un kiosco en un colegio hace 2 años, el cual atiende ella sola. También hace berlines y queques, los cuales vende también en su kiosco. Su esposo, quien trabaja como temporero (trabajo esporádico durante determinadas cosechas), cuando no esta trabajando le ayuda a hacer sopaipillas y a atender el kiosco. Además en su casa hace tortas y otros productos de repostería por encargo.  Con este préstamo quiere comprar una máquina conservadora. Su sueño es tener una casa, ya que vive con su familia, es decir su esposo y sus 2 hijas, de 15 y 10 años en la casa de una tía, por lo que esta ahorrando para eso. Su motivación es poder darle estudios superiores a sus hijas. Esta muy agradecida de la facilidad con la que Fondo Esperanza le ha entregado los préstamos, ya que ni ella ni su esposo pueden obtener préstamos en los bancos. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in the San Vicente de Tagua Tagua district.  For 2 years she has had a kiosk in a school where she serves on her own.  She also makes doughnuts and sponge cakes which she sells in her kiosk.  Her husband, who is a seasonal worker (sporadic work during harvest times), helps her to make 'sopaipillas' (a type of fried pastry) and serve in the kiosk when he isn't working.  She also makes cakes and other confectionery at home which she sells to order.  She will use this loan to buy a cooler.  Her dream is to have her own house since she currently lives with her family, that is to say she lives in her aunt's house with her husband and her 2 daughters aged 15 and 10.  She is saving up to buy her own house.  Her motivation is to be able to support her daughters through their higher education.  She is very grateful for the loans which Fondo Esperanza have given her since neither her nor her husband could obtain loans from the banks.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To buy a cooler

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
Digna de 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pan, reside en el municipio de Corinto, departamento de Morazán  es madre soltera de 3 hijos entre las edades de 1 a 13 años posee casa propia y el negocio lo administra desde  hace 2 años atendiéndolo  3 días por semana  ofreciendo su producto a los vecinos de la zona, este negocio lo inicio por la necesidad de crecer a sus hijos. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en compra de leña, harina, azúcar, y demás materiales para preparar el pan, este préstamo  le ayudara mucho pues aumentara la producción y generara más ingresos para su hogar.
Los sueños de ella son crecer con su producción de pan y velar por el bienestar de sus hijos creando un futuro mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
Digna is 34 years old and sells bread for a living.  She lives in the town of Corinto in Morazán department.  She is a single mother with three children between the ages of 1 and 13.  She has her own house and she has been running the business for 2 years and serves there 3 days a week, offering her products to the neighbors in her area.  She started this business because she had to in order to raise her children.  She is requesting a loan to purchase firewood, flour, sugar and other materials for making her bread.  This loan will help her a lot because it will increase her production and create more income for her household.

Digna's dreams are to increase her bread production and look out for the well-being of her children, creating a better future for them.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar and firewood

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Communal Bank "Heart of Jesus", located in the district of Juliaca, in the province of San Román, and the department of Puno. She is 42 years old and married with two children. She studied until the third year of primary school. 

Modesta has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business selling handicrafts. 

She is now asking for a loan for 200 PEN, money that will be used to buy more materials: wool of all kinds for her business selling handicrafts. Her dream is to improve her handicrafts workshop.  Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the money she earns on her savings.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as a variety of wools, for her business selling handicrafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of heifers

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.en:
Henry is 38 years old and lives in El Transito department in San Miguel together with his wife and daughter.  He is employed as a driver in a delivery company.  He earns $360 a month and has been working for this company for 10 years.

Henry is in the process of improving his home and for this he is requesting a loan to buy iron, cement and sand and pay the workmen.  His intention is to extend his house little by little so that he can live more comfortably.

Henry's dream is to finish extending his house, to have enough income to support his family and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy iron, sand and cement

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Él vende confites y golosinas de manera ambulante hace 4 años. Sus lugares de venta son canchas y estadios, en donde no permanece en un punto fijo, sino que se va trasladando. Vende solo, pero su esposa, quien también forma parte de Fondo Esperanza, vendiendo productos Avon y haciendo composturas en su casa, lo acompaña algunas veces a vender. 
Con este préstamo viajará a Rancagua (ciudad cercana a San Vicente) a comprar mercadería. A pesar de que Luis lleva 6 años en silla de ruedas (por una discapacidad) y 12 años enfermo, ha ido de a poco aumentando su variedad de mercadería y su sueño es tener un Kiosco, para lo cual esta haciendo las gestiones con su municipalidad. 
Tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, quienes viven con él y lo apoyan también económicamente. A Luis le ha sido muy grato participar en Fondo Esperanza y con sus compañeros de grupo con quienes siente una gran unidad. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Luis is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in San Vicente de Tagua Tagua district.  He has been selling sweets and candies in an itinerant manner for 4 years.  He makes his sales at sports grounds and stadiums where he doesn't stay in a fixed spot but moves around.  He makes his sales alone but his wife, who is also a member of Fondo Esperanza and sells Avon products and makes repairs from home, sometimes accompanies him to sell.

With this loan he will travel to Rancagua (a city near San Vicente) to buy merchandise.  Although Luis has been in a wheelchair for 6 years (because of a disability) and has been ill for 12 years, he has, little by little, been increasing his range of goods and his dream is to have a kiosk.  He is currently negotiating this with his local council.

Luis has 3 grown-up children who live with him and also help support him financially.  Luis has enjoyed taking part in Fondo Esperanza together with his fellow group members with whom he feels great unity.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To purchase sweets and candies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella vende perfumes originales, hace 2 años. Sus lugares de venta son municipalidades, colegios y también vende a domicilio a clientes particulares. 
Con este préstamo comprará perfumes, ya que tiene varios encargos y también comprará para tener en stock. 
Su sueño es comprar un vehículo, con el fin de facilitar los viajes a Santiago (capital de Chile) para comprar sus productos y para vender en lugares más apartados y fuera de la ciudad.  
Para Carmen los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un gran apoyo para su negocio y una gran ayuda, ya que no le pidieron muchos requisitos para  integrarse.  También le acomoda que los pagos sean semanales, ya que de esta manera las cuotas son de menor valor. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in San Vicente de Tagua Tagua district.  She has been selling perfume for 2 years.  She makes her sales in towns and schools and also delivers to the homes of private customers.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes since she has a number of orders.  She will also buy some to have in stock.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle so that she can travel to Santiago (the capital of Chile) to buy her products and to sell in places further from the city.

For Carmen, Fondo Esperanza's loans have been a great support for her business and a great help since they did not ask her to fulfil many conditions in order to join.  It also suits her that she pays weekly because this means her repayments are cheaper.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To buy perfume

loans.name: Silvia Estela

texts.es:
Silvia, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, tiene 38 años de edad, administra una tienda en la que ofrece productos de  primera necesidad para el hogar, tiene casa propia, este negocio comenzó hace un año, siendo una persona de experiencia pues ya antes había administrado una tienda en el centro escolar del lugar donde vive. 
Ella necesita invertir en productos para su tienda ya que a veces los clientes le buscan mercadería que ella no tiene en el inventario, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para realizar dicha inversión, fortaleciendo de esta manera el negocio, atendiendo mejor a los clientes y aumentando sus ingresos.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio estable, desarrollarse como microempresaria, aumentar los clientes, tener mejores opciones de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in Concepción Batres in Usulután department.  She is 38 years old and runs a store in which she sells basic items for the home.  She has her own home.  She started this business a year ago, having already gained experience as she had previously run a store in a local school where she lives.

Silvia needs to invest in products for her store since sometimes her customers look for goods which she doesn't have in stock.  For this reason she is requesting a loan in order to be able to make this investment, thereby strengthening her business, providing better service to her customers and increasing her profits.  Her goal is to have a stable business, to develop as a small businesswoman, to increase her number of customers and to have better options in life.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", located in the district of Santiago de Pupuja, in the province of Azángaro, in the department of Puno. She is 62 years old, and a widow with two children. She studied up to secondary school. 

Modesta has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, and she used the money to increase the capital for her business renting out general goods.  She is now asking for a loan for 3,000 PEN, money that will be invested in merchandise for her business renting out general goods and being a supplier. 

Her dream is to have a store with construction materials to sell and to be able to rent them out.  Her favorite things about the Communal Bank are the meetings and the ease of the loan.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her business renting general goods

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta forma parte del banco comunal “Creación”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Chillán. Ella tiene un bazar, librería y paquetería en su casa, hace  4 meses. Sin embargo desde antes trabajaba ya además en confección de cortinas de baño y sábanas. 
Con este préstamo viajará a Santiago, capital de Chile, a comprar mercadería, es decir, telas y artículos para reponer sus productos en el bazar, como por ejemplo silicona y palitos de maquetas entre otros. 
Su sueño es crecer en su  negocio, para lo cual cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposo. Tiene 3 hijos, pero solo el menor,  de 22 años, quien es estudiante de diseño gráfico en la universidad, vive con ella. 
Para Marta ha sido muy bueno trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, no solo por los préstamos, sino por los gratos momentos que vive junto a sus compañeros de grupo y la asesora de FE. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “Silla del Sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en esta ella han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Marta is a member of 'Creación' community bank in the town of Chillán.  She has had a stationery store, book store and small goods store in her house for 4 months.  She has also been making shower curtains and sheets for some time.

With this loan she will travel to Santiago, the capital of Chile, to buy goods, that is to say material and articles to replace products in her stationery store such as, for example, silicone glue and little sticks for making scale models.

Her dream is to grow her business and she has her husband's support in this.  She has 3 children but only the youngest who is 22 and studying graphic design at University lives with her.

For Marta, working with Fondo Esperanza has been very good, not only for the loans but also for the pleasant time which she spends with her fellow group members and the Fondo Esperanza advisor.

Chillán is a district in the 'centro sur' (south central) region of Chile.  The name means “Silla del Sol” (Sun's Chair) in Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, our indigenous inhabitants.  Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (Birthplace of the Nation) or “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of Artists) owing to the fact that it is the birthplace of a number of prominent characters in Chile's history such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise: stationery store products and material

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power", located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 36 years old and in a common law marriage. She has two children. She studied until the fourth year of primary school.

She works as a traveling salesperson, selling lamb meat. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her first loan was for the amount of 500 PEN, and she invested the money in her business selling groceries, which is the business activity she was involved in at that time. 

She is now asking for 1,500 PEN, money that will allow her to increase the capital of her business selling lamb meat. 

Her dream is to have a butcher's shop. Her favorite aspect about the Communal Bank is the camaraderie between the bank members.

loans.use: Increase the capital of her business selling lamb meat

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Communal Bank "The little stars of gold II", located in the district of Puno, in the province and department with the same name. She is 26 years old, and a single mother of one child. She has a complete higher education degree. 

She works with handicrafts such as hand-woven sweaters, cardigans, and gloves. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for 500 PEN and she used the money to invest in her business. 

Now she is asking for a new loan for 100 PEN, a loan that will allow the purchase of wool to make cardigans. 

Her dream is to grow her business. What she likes about the Communal Bank is the earnings on her savings.

loans.use: The purchase of wool to make cardigans

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
Fernanda forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella vende artesanías en greda, las cuales compra en Pomaire y flores plásticas, las que  compra en Santiago (capital de Chile). Vende sus productos hace 6 años de manera ambulante, en la vereda del frente de un cementerio. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, es decir, flores plásticas y artesanías en greda. Tiene 5 familiares participando en Fondo Esperanza, entre ellos su hija, quien vende flores naturales. Tiene 2 hijos, mayores de edad y una nieta de 2 años, quien, al igual que su hija, vive con ella. 
Su sueño es tener un local establecido, para de esta forma, trabajar más tranquila y protegida del calor y la lluvia. Gracias a Fondo Esperanza, Fernanda ha logrado aumentar las cantidades de su mercadería.
 San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in the district of San Vicente de Tagua Tagua.  She sells handicrafts made from clay which she buys in Pomaire and artificial flowers which she buys in Santiago (the capital of Chile).  She has been selling her products in an itinerant manner for 6 years on the sidewalk outside a cemetery.

With this loan she will buy goods, that is to say artificial flowers and clay handicrafts.  She has 5 family members who are participating in Fondo Esperanza, including her daughter who sells live flowers.  She has two children who are grown up and a 2 year-old granddaughter as well as her daughter who lives with her.

Her dream is to have established premises so that she can work more peacefully, protected from the heat and the rain.  Thanks to Fondo Esperanza, Fernanda has managed to increase the quantity of her goods.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: Clay decorations and plastic flowers

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Él  tiene un puesto de verduras hace 30 años en la misma feria, cercana a su hogar.  Padece de sordera debido a un asalto, hace varios años atrás, en el que sufrió  golpes en su cabeza. 
Trabaja 2 días a la semana y lo acompañan a vender, a veces, su esposa o una de sus hijas. Con este préstamo comprará verduras. 
Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ya que la que arrendaba, se derrumbó por completo debido al terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero, Vivió entonces por casi dos meses a la intemperie junto a su familia, es decir su esposa, su hija, su yerno y sus 2 nietas de 15 y 5 años,  hasta que por medio de Fondo Esperanza obtuvo una mediagua (vivienda temporal hecha de paneles de madera). 
Está muy agradecido de Fondo Esperanza, no solo por la gran ayuda que le han sido los préstamos, por sus bajos intereses, sino que también por el apoyo después del terremoto. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Pedro is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in the district of San Vicente de Tagua Tagua.  He has had a vegetable stall in the same market near his home for 30 years.  He suffers from deafness because he was assaulted several years ago and suffered blows to the head.

He works 2 days a week and sometimes his wife or one of his daughters will accompany him and help him with his sales.  He will use this loan to buy vegetables.

Pedro's dream is to have his own home since the one which he was renting completely collapsed as a result of the earthquake which occurred on the 27th of February this year.  Following the earthquake, he lived for two months in the open air together with his family, that is to say his wife, his daughter, his son-in-law and his 2 granddaughters aged 15 and 5, until he obtained a 'mediagua' (a temporary dwelling made from wood boards) through Fondo Esperanza.

Pedro is very grateful to Fondo Esperanza not only for the great help which they have been to him with their loans and their low interest rates but also for the support they gave him after the earthquake.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta forma parte del banco comunal “Creación”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Chillán. Ella tiene una cordonería, bazar y paquetería, en donde también ofrece sus servicios de encintados (recuerdos de ceremonias como bautizos, matrimonios, etc). Este local lo arrienda hace 4 años y está ubicado en la galería “La Merced” a 7 cuadras de su casa. 
Con este préstamo comprará cintas, adornos para los recuerdos, blondas y tarjetas de navidad. Mirta tiene un hijo de 13 años, a quien ha logrado mantener con su negocio, como único aporte económico de su hogar. Su meta es comprar un local, ya que según sus cálculos es más conveniente que arrendar. 
Para Mirta Fondo Esperanza ha sido de gran ayuda, tanto económica como de orientación sobre cómo administrar mejor su negocio. Además también le es muy grato compartir con sus compañeros de grupo y su asesora.
 Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “Silla del Sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en esta tierra han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Mirta is a member of the “Creación” community bank which is located in the city of Chillán.  She has a store where she sells embroidery, knitting and sewing supplies, stationery and small goods.  She also offers party favor services (mementos for ceremonies such as christenings and weddings).  She has been renting her premises for 4 years in “La Merced” shopping arcade which is 7 blocks from her house.

With this loan she will buy ribbons, trimmings for the party favors, lace and Christmas cards.  Mirta has a 13 year-old son who she has managed to support with her business as it is the only financial support for her household.  Her goal is to buy her own premises since, according to her calculations, it will be more profitable than renting.

Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to Mirta both financially and in providing advice on how to run her business better.  In addition, she is enjoys meeting with her fellow group members and her advisor.

Chillán is a district in the 'centro sur' (south central) region of Chile.  The name means “Silla del Sol” (Sun's Chair) in Mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche, our indigenous inhabitants.  Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (Birthplace of the Nation) or “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of Artists) owing to the fact that it is the birthplace of a number of prominent characters in Chile's history such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To buy ribbons, lace, decorations and cards

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemí is a member of "The Active Women II" of the Communal Bank, located in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, department of Puno. 

Her first loan with the Communal Bank was for the amount of 500 PEN, to increase her working capital.  She sells groceries.  Noemí is 28 years old, single, and has no children. She has a higher education degree. 

She is now asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN, to buy flour, sugar, rice, and noodles for her business.  Her dreams are to have more capital for her business, have a pharmacy and to build a house. 
	
Noemí's favorite things about working with the Communal Bank are its repayment terms and the savings.

loans.use: The purchase of flour, rice, and noodles for her business selling groceries

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 28 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “La Unión” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Mirian tiene un bebe y es madre y padre para su hija pues su pareja las abandono, ella  alterna sus actividad del hogar con su negocio, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. 

Mirian con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar panetones,  dulce, galletas, pasteles, gaseosas, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mirian is 28 years old and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “La Unión” community bank for a long time.  Mirian has a baby to whom she is both mother and father since her partner abandoned them.  She divides her time between her household duties and her business.  She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

Mirian will use her loan for 2,500 nuevos soles to increase her business capital.  She would also like to buy panettones, candies, cookies, cakes, soda, etc.

She is thankful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and she therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy panettones, candies, cookies, cakes, soda, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Progresistas se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en J.A. Saldivar en fecha 20 de Julio de 2.009 gracias a  la Sra. Basilisa A., quien ya había participado del programa y en conocimiento de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, se comunicó con la  asesora para volver a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya. La misma logró juntar a 15 mujeres y hoy día se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto, en el 3er. Ciclo  dentro del programa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Pabla  quien posee una verdulería, en la cual a la vez comercializa diversas frutas, así como ensaladas, jugos, postres, etc.
La misma, posee buena atención e higiene por lo que su verdulería es bastante concurrida por los lugareños principalmente, teniendo ya así una clientela formada. 
Desea incrementar sus ingresos, adquiriendo más variadas frutas y verduras de estación, para obtener mayores ingresos en la diferencia de costo y venta de productos.
texts.en:
'Mujeres Progresistas' (Progressive Women) is the name of a group of women which was formed in J. A. Saldivar on July 20th 2009 thanks to Mrs Basilisa A. who had already participated in the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women Communal Bank) and knew how it worked.  She contacted the Fundación Paraguaya advisor and started working with the organization again.  Basilisa managed to bring together 15 women and they are all working happily on their third loan cycle in the program.  One of the members is Pabla who owns a fruit and vegetable store in which she sells different fruits, as well as salads, juices, desserts, etc.

Pabla provides good service and hygiene which means that her fruit and vegetable store is very popular with the locals.  It also means that she has a number of steady customers.

Pabla would like to increase her income, acquiring a wider range of seasonal fruits and vegetables in order to obtain better profits.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits and vegetables, plastic containers and disposable cups

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena tiene 45 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “La Unión” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Magdalena alterna sus actividad del hogar con la pequeña negocio, ella tiene en su domicilio una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde expende productos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y muchas cosas más. 

Magdalena con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar para esta época navideña que se está acercando dulces, galletas, pasteles navideños, panetones, bebidas, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 45 years old and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “La Unión” community bank for a long time.  Magdalena divides her time between her household duties and her small business.  She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells products such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil and a lot more besides.

Magdalena will use her loan for 2,500 nuevos soles to increase her business capital.  She also wants to buy candies, cookies, Christmas cakes, panettones and drinks etc. for the approaching Christmas holiday period.

She is thankful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy candies, cookies, Christmas cakes, panettones, drinks, etc. for the approaching Christmas holiday period

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 28 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “La Unión” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria alterna sus actividad del hogar con el pequeño negocio que tiene, ella tiene en su domicilio un establecimiento donde expende medicamentos como por ejemplo pastillas, antibióticos, pomada y muchas cosas más. 

Maria con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar medicamentos. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old, single and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “La Unión” community bank for a long time.  Magdalena divides her time between her household duties and her small business.  She has a store in her home where she sells medicines such as tablets, antibiotics, ointment and a lot more besides.

Maria will use her loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to increase her business capital and to buy medicines.

She is is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To increase her business capital and to buy medicines

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 46 años, es casada y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “La Unión” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Elena alterna sus actividad del hogar con el pequeño negocio que tiene, ella tiene en su domicilio un establecimiento donde expende comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar, leche en tarro y muchas cosas más. 

Elena con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 200 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo champagne, panetones, gallentas para la época navideña que se está acercando. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old, married and lives in the city of Cusco.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “La Unión” community bank for a long time.  She has a store in her home where she sells groceries such as rice, noodles, sugar, tinned milk and a lot more besides.

Elena will use her loan for 200 nuevos soles to increase her business capital and to buy goods such as champagne, panettones and cookies for the approaching Christmas holiday period.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy goods such as champagne, panettones and cookies for the approaching Christmas holiday period

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 54 años, vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Rosario tiene 2 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora y su actividad económica principal es la venta de golosinas.    

Rosario con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 500 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar golosinas como dulces, galletas, chocolates, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosario is 54 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Rosario has 2 children and considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising mother.  Her main business activity is selling sweets.

Rosario will use her loan for $500USD to increase her business capital and buy sweets such as candies, cookies, chocolates, etc.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy sweets such as candies, cookies, chocolates, etc.

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es:
Maria Paulina tiene 56 años, vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria Paulina se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora y su actividad económica principal es la preparación de tortas y los vende a la cadena de supermercados “MEGA” y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de cosméticos. 

Maria Paulina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 1000 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar, leche y muchos cosas más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Paulina is 56 years old.  She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru and has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Maria Paulina considers herself to be a hard-working and enterprising mother and her main business activity is baking cakes which she sells to the “MEGA” supermarket chain.  Her additional business activity is selling cosmetics.

Maria Paulina will use her loan for $1,000USD to increase her business capital and buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk and a lot of other things.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk and a lot of other things

loans.name: Soñadoras Del Futuro Group

texts.es: Doña Inés D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad, viuda con cinco hijos, se dedica a la compra D. pollos que tienen un día D. nacidos, los engorda y cuando ya tienen un mes  los vuelve a vender. Tiene veinte años D. experiencia. Y por escases D. capital se reunen con otras vecinas que también cuentan con negocios propios. Deciden formar el Banco Comunal llamado "Soñadora del Futuro", siendo Inés la presidenta el nombre del grupo significa  que sueñan con tener un mejor futuro para ellas como para sus hijos. El capital solicitado lo utilizará para capital D. trabajo, comprando pollos y vacunas. Doña inés sueña con poder distribuir los pollos o tener una pequeña granja el cual la ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones D. vida.
texts.en: Doña Inés is 43 years old and widowed.  She has five children.  She buys one-day-old chicks, fattens them up and, when they are a month old, she sells them.  She has twenty years of experience in this business.  Lacking capital she joined together with other neighbors who also have their own businesses.  They decided to form the “Soñadora del Futuro” (Dreaming of the Future) community bank with Inés as president.  The group's name means that they are dreaming of a better future for themselves and their children.  The loan Inés is requesting will be used as working capital so that she can buy chicks and vaccines.  Inés dreams of being able to distribute chicks or have a small farm which will help her to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Afady Group

texts.fr:
Afady (ASSOCIATION DES FEMMES AND DEFAAR YOFF) est un groupement de femmes qui a été crée a Yoff. Son siège est installé à Keur Apecsy, rue Seydina Mandione Laye a Yoff Mbenguene. L’objet de l’association est d’unir les membres animés d’un même idéal et créer entre elles  des liens d’entente et de solidarité ; contribuer a l’émancipation sociale et a la formation civique de la population ; œuvrer pour la promotion économique, culturelle et sociale des membres ; protéger l’environnement de la localité ; participer a la création d’un cadre scolaire adéquat pour l’éducation ; réhabiliter la conscience patriotique ; lutter contre le chômage des jeunes. Plus précisément l’association a pour but :
-unir les membres animés d’un même  idéal et créer entre eux des liens d’entente et de solidarité
-contribuer a l’émancipation sociale et a la formation civique des populations yoffoise
-œuvrer pour la promotion économique, culturelle et sociale de ses membres
-développer les capacités de ses membres par des programmes de formation appropriés et l’alphabétisation fonctionnelle.
-contribuer a l’insertion sociale et économique des populations yoffoise, en particuliers les jeunes et les femmes
-promouvoir le leadership féminin et l’accès des femmes, en particulier les jeunes aux instances de prise de décisions
-promouvoir une meilleure santé des populations par des activités d’information, d’éducation et de communication
-lutter contre la féminisation de la pauvreté
-œuvrer pour la sauvegarde et la protection de l’environnent.
L’association est représentée par sa présidente madame Fatou Moussa S. ( la troisième sur la photo a partir de la gauche) secondée par une secrétaire madame Aby D., une trésorière madame Mbathio N. et une  vice présidente madame Ndioba Gning. Madame Fatou Moussa S. est spécialisée dans la transformation de céréales locales, la teinture et la fabrication de chaussures perlées. Elle a choisi ces différentes activités pour le développement de leur localité et l’insertion des femmes dans la vie active. Elle recherche l’indépendance économique des femmes. L’association est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis aout 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 700 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de matières premières pour la transformation de céréales locales. Elles avaient arrêté  leurs activités et souhaiteraient les redémarrer. A travers la création de revenus leur vœu est d’améliorer la situation sociale des femmes de la localité.

NB;les autres femmes sur la photo sont les 3 autres me,bres du bureau et quelques membres simples qui sont sous covert du bureau de l'association.
texts.en: AFADY (Association Des Femmes And Defaar Yoff) is an association of women establish in Yoff.  Its main office is set up in Keur Apecsy, on Seydina Mandione Laye Road, in Yoff Mbenguene. The goal of the association is to bring together its members around an ideal and to create among them ties of understanding and solidarity; to contribute to social emancipation and to providing training in civics for the people;  to work for the economic, cultural, and social advancement of its members; to protect the area's environment;  to take part in creating a school system sufficient for education; to restore patriotism; and to struggle against unemployment among the young.  To be exact, the goals of the association are: - Uniting the group members, inspiring them with the same ideal, and creating understanding and solidarity amongst them. - Contributing to the social emancipation and to civic training for the people of Yoff. - Working for the economic, cultural, and social advancement of its members. - Developing the talents of its members through the appropriate training programs and functional literacy. - Helping the people of Yoff to be active in society and commerce, particularly women and youngsters. - Promoting leadership in women and access for women, particularly for youngsters when making decisions. - Promoting better health through information, training, education, and communication. - Struggling to reduce the number of women in poverty. - Working to safeguard and protect the environment. The association is represented by its president, Ms. Fatou Moussa S. (third from the left in the photo); by a secretary, Ms. Aby D.; a treasurer, Ms. Mbathio N.; and by a vice-president, Ms. Ndioba Gning.  Ms. Fatou Moussa S. specializes in processing local grains, dyeing cloth, and making beaded shoes.  She chose these different activities to develop their town and to bring work to women.  She is researching the economic independence of women.  She is requesting a loan of 700,000 francs for buying the raw materials for processing local grains.  The association has been a member of the Yoff branch office since August 2010.  The group members had halted their work and would like to start up again.  By generating revenues, their desire is to improve the social situation of women in the area. Note:  The other women in the photo are the three other members of the office and a few ordinary members who are associated with the group's office.

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr: G. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur de camion, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de  maïs, mil et sorgho. elle s’approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans le marché local d'anié. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce. le crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre d'acheter 5 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de mil et 2 sacs de sorgho
texts.en: G. is a 36-year old woman. She is married and the mother of three. Her husband is a truck driver. She makes a living by selling corn and sorghum. She stocks up in the interior of the country at the local market of Anié. She has over 10 years of experience in this business. The loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase five bags of corn, two bags of millet and two bags of sorghum.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Massogblé

texts.fr: massogblé est une femme de 27 ans , elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. elle a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle fait le lavage à sec. le nom de sa boutique est "ETS HOLLY WOOD". actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est élevée,elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter les produits nécessaires à son activité de lavage.
texts.en: Massogblé is a  27-year old woman; she is married and has one child. She has started her own  dry cleaning business. The name of her store is “Hollywood, Inc.” At present, customer demand is high. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase the materials needed for her business.

loans.use: Purchasing materials needed for the dry cleaning business

loans.name: Edgar Armando

texts.es:
Edgar C. tiene 30 años, lleva 10 años de casado y tiene cuatro hijos los dos mayores van al colegio.

Su negocio lo inicio hace 4 años y es de venta de electrodomésticos y se llama comercial J Y J, tiene 3 empleados que le ayudan a distribuir su mercadería y a cobrar lo vendido. El préstamo que el solicita es para comprar mercadería variada tales como colchas, licuadoras, vajillas, cortinas.

El sueño de Don Edgar es incrementar su negocio, obtener mas ganancias y darles un mejor futuro a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Edgar C. is 30 years old. He has been married for ten years and has four children, the two older of which are in high school.

He started his business selling household appliances four years ago and it is called J and J Stores. He has three employees that help him to distribute merchandise and charge what is sold. The loan that he is requesting is to purchase various merchandise such as bedspreads, blenders, dishes, curtains, etc.

Edgar’s dream is to expand his business, earn more, and provide his wife and children with a better future.

loans.use: To purchase household appliances to sell.

loans.name: Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
HISTORIA G.S. LIRIO DE LOS VALLES

MARIA JUANA T.. Es originaria del departamento de chimaltenango, tiene 28 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pequeños, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, desde hace un año ella tiene la profesion de secretaria oficinista pero por falta de trabajo no puede desempeñar su profesion en ninguna empresa, es por esa razon que decidio abrir su tienda de consumo diario, porque es lo que mas se vende ella necesita surtir su tienda, porque le piden productos y no ha podido surtir y es por eso que necesita el prestamo.

MIRIAM ADELA B.. Es originaria del municipio de Santa Cruz del Quiche ella se dedica a al elaboración de tejidos en choshet, elabora cubrecamas, manteles ropa de bebe individuales, etc.y ademas para la epoca que viene elabora coronas para adornar los panteones de los muertos ella necesita el credito para poder comprar materia prima y poder elaborar su producto para lograr obtener un poco de ganancia para la epoca.

MAYRA T. G.. Es originaria de Chimaltenango, tiene 27 años de edad , tiene dos hijos , se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica, su negocio es ambulante, le encargan blusas y cortes y ella los entrega en las casas tiene dos años en la actividad, y ahora necesita su preastamo para poder comprar mercaderia y poder surtir .
texts.en:
LIRIO DE LOS VALLES

MARIA JUANA T. is originally from the Guatemalan "departamento" of Chimaltenango.  She is 28 years old and has two young children.  She operates a business selling everyday commodities.  She trained as a secretary more than a year ago, but hasn't been able to find a job with a company because there's no work.  She decided to open a grocery because everyone buys groceries.  Now she needs to stock the store with products that her customers ask for, but which she hasn't been able to stock to now.  She will use the loan for this purpose.

MIRIAM ADELA B. is originally from the town of Santa Cruz del Quiche.  She operates a business making and selling crocheted products.  Among other things, she makes bed covers and baby clothes.  This time of year, she also makes funeral wreathes for memorials to the dead.  She is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs for her business.

MAYRA T. G. is also from Chimaltenango originally.  She is 27 years old and has two children.  She works as a street vendor selling clothing.  She buys blouses and shorts, for example, on consignment and delivers them to her customers, work that she has been doing for two years.  She needs a loan now so that she can buy merchandise and stock her business.

loans.use: Buy products and supplies for various businesses.

loans.name: Ayda Mercedes

texts.es:
Ayda de 53 años de edad,  vive junto a su esposo que se dedica a los quehaceres del Campo con sus  4 hijos todos mayores de edad los cuales trabajan en coordinación en pro del desarrollo de su unidad productiva para fortalecer la economia familiar, habitan en la comunidad El Nispero, realiza diferentes actividades sobre todo ganadera y tambien  actividades agricolas, siembra de cultivos de granos basicos, utilizandolos unicamente para el consumo familiar ya que su principal fuente de ingreso es la producción de leche que le genera su inventario ganadero. 

Requiere de este financiamiento para realizar establecimiento de pasto en su finca y asi poder tener condiciones para menejar la alimentación de su hato ganadero. 

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y que no les falte la alimentacion a su familia.
texts.en:
Ayda is 53 years old and lives with her husband who carries out farming tasks together with their 4 grown-up children.  They work together to help develop their production unit and strengthen the family finances.  They live in the El Nispero community and carry out different activities, especially cattle raising but also farming activities such as sowing basic grains.  These are for used for family consumption only since their main source of income is milk production which comes from their cattle.

They need this loan in order to cultivate pasture on their farm and thereby have the right conditions for feeding their herd of cattle.

Their biggest dream is to be able to improve their living conditions and to ensure that their family does not lack food.

loans.use: Pasture cultivation

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Communal Bank "Great Power," located in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, and in the department of Puno. She is 30 years old, and a single mother with one child.  She studied until the third year of her secondary education. 

Rita has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN to increase her working capital to expand the merchandise in her grocery selling business.

She is asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN, to buy consumables such as rice and potatoes, and other things she needs to prepare food.  Her dream is to have a hardware store in addition to her current business.

loans.use: Purchase rice, potatoes and other items to sell more food.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: akouvi est une femme de 34 ans, elle est célibataire. pour subvenir à ses propres charges, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de gagner plus de profits sur ses ventes. elle a une expérience de 10 ans dans ce commerce. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé elle sollicite de WAGES un second crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en: Akouvi is a 34 year old single woman.  To meet her needs, she started a business selling charcoal.  She buys her stock in the interior of the country so she can earn more profit on her sales.  She has ten years experience in this business.  She has already had one WAGES loan that she repaid on time; she is now seeking a second loan to buy about 20 bags of charcoal and to pay for their transportation.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Primaveral Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Pacu cua surgió por promoción realizadas en la zona. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de comidas, peluquería, despensa, confección de toallas bordadas, venta de bijouterie , venta de ropas y, venta de artículos para el hogar.
Una de las integrantes es la señoras Maria quien se dedica a confección de ropas para damas y caballeros, como vestidos de fiestas, trajes, pantalones, abrigos y otros.
Sus confecciones son muy admirados por los clientes, y constantemente le solicitan la prendas de vestir para ocasiones especiales.
Su trabajo lo realiza diariamente con una maquina de coser a pedal, y nos  comenta que es muy sacrificado ya que le daña la vista y la espalda, pero que es su profesión y que ella trabaja por el bien de sus hijos.
Desea que salgan adelante y con un buen estudio, para que puedan tener un mejor vida agrega la señora Maria.
Sobre el grupo nos comenta que se siente muy bien con sus compañeras, y que las capacitaciones que ha recibido de la asesora le fueron muy utiles, y quiere seguir con el comité.
texts.en:
This Barrio Pacu group was formed after advertisements were placed in the neighborhood.  All the women operate viable businesses.  Among the businesses: food sales, hairdressers, groceries, tailoring businesses, jewelry and home products sales.  
Sra. Maria is one of the members.  She makes clothes for men and women: dress clothes, suits, pants, coats, etc. Her pieces are much admired by her customers who come to her over and over to order clothes for special occasions.  She works every day on a pedal-operated sewing machine and tells us that the work has damaged her eyesight and led to back problems.  She carries on, though, because it's her source of income and the means for caring for her children.  She wants to grow and improve the business, she says, so that she can make a better life for herself. 
With regard to the group, Sra. Maria says that she is very happy with her fellow members and that the skills that she has picked up in training there have been very useful.  She hopes to continue with the group.

loans.use: Buy an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: N'mali

texts.fr: n'mali est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et a 2 enfants,  elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de hedzranawoé qui est quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle a une ancienneté de 8 ans dans son activité et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes.le crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre de gonfler son stock de marchandises avec divers produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en: N'mali is a 37 year old woman who is married with two children.  She lives with her family in the Hedzranawoé neighborhood which is on the outskirts of the city of Lomé.  She has had her business for 8 years and has clients from all walks of life.  This loan will enable her to add assorted food products to her range of merchandise.

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: abla est une femme très dynamique, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. son époux est un blanchisseur et ils vivent dans le quartier de n'kafu qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de trousseau de, d'habits et de couches pour bébé. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec une quinzaine de trousseau, une vingtaine d'habits et divers couches de bébé.
texts.en:
Abla is a very energetic women who is married and the mother of two children.  Her husband works in the laundry industry.  They live in N'kafu, an outlying district of the city of Lomé.  

Abla has a revenue-generating retail business selling baby accessories, clothing, and diapers.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES for expanding her stock with about fifteen sets of accessories for babies, about twenty outfits, and a variety of diapers.

loans.use: Buying baby accessories, clothing, and diapers

loans.name: Wilfredo Enrique

texts.es:
Wilfredo Enrique de 30 años de edad, su familia esta conformada por su esposa que se dedica a los quaceres del hogar y a cuidar de sus dos  hijos menores de edad; habitantan en comarca el Nispero, toda su vida se ha dedicado a labores del campo en su unidad de producción en la que realiza actividades pecuarias con su inventario ganadero, como  tambien actividades agricolas, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingreso. 

Necesita este financiamiento con la ayuda de Kiva para invertirlo en establecimiento de pasto mejorado y asi poder brindar mejor alimentacion a su hato bovino.  

La mayor intencion de este cliente es tener una finca con buenas condiciones de pasto para mejorar la produccion de leche, logrando mejorar su ingreso economico en el nucleo familiar, en su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre progresivo, trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Enrique is 30 years old.  His family is comprised of his wife and their two minor children.  His wife does the household chores and takes care of the children.  They live in the Nispero area.  He has been doing farm work all of his life.  He works in his production unit doing farm work with his inventory of livestock.  He also does agricultural work as these are his main sources of income.

He needs this loan with Kiva’s help to establish a better pasture.  Then he will be able to provide better feed for his herd of cattle.

His biggest goal is to have a farm with a pasture that is in good condition in order to improve milk production.  That way he will manage to improve the family income.  In his community he is considered to be a progressive, hard-working, and responsible man.

loans.use: To cultivate the pasture

loans.name: Kassiaki

texts.fr: kassiaki est un homme de 35 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants, il est un coiffeur et a ouvert un salon qu'il exploite pour son propre compte, pour attirer de nouveaux clients, il veut réaménager son salon, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter un antenne, 2 rallonges, 2 serrures et divers. il a une expérience de 5 ans dans cette activité.
texts.en: Kassiaki is a 35-year-old man who is married and a father of two children.  He is a barber and has opened his own shop.  To attract new customers, he wants to fix up his shop.  He is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying an antenna, two extension cords, two locks, and other items. He has five years of experience in this business.

loans.use: Buying an antenna, extension cords, locks, and other items for fixing up his barber shop

loans.name: Norma Agustina

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank group "The little stars of gold II," located in the district, province and department of Puno. She is 39 years old and married with five children. She did not finish primary school. 

She works selling sweets, cakes, cookies, soda, etc.  Norma has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year and her first loan was for 500 PEN to increase the amount of merchandise in her business. 

Norma is asking for a loan for 500 PEN to expand her business selling sweets. 

Her dream is to have a store that is filled with all types of products.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand her business selling sweets.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank group "Active Women II," located in the district of Juliaca, in the province of San Román, and the department of Puno.  She is 31 years old and in a common law marriage with two children.  She studied until the fifth year of her primary education.

Norma has worked with Manuela Ramos for six months. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, to increase the capital for her business selling livestock.

She is now asking for a loan of 800 PEN to buy animals for her business.  Her dream is to have a grocery store and to have more animals.

loans.use: Purchase more animals for her livestock selling business.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
El Sr. Cristobal de 49 años de edad, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 4 hijos todos menores de edad pero que tambien colaboran en los quehaceres dela unidad productiva, habitante de Col San Miguel, se dedica a realizar actividades agricolas, sobre todo en los cultivos de raices y tuberculos, como yuca y quequisque, los que le sirven como su principal y mayor fuente de ingreso para la estabilidad laboral y economica del nucleo familiar, estos cultivos son tradicionalmente producidos desde hace 10 años, los que atiende en conjunto con su familia.  

Necesita este financiamiento para realizar un buen manejo tecnico al cultivo de Yuca, como es el uso de fertilizantes y agriquimicos, esperando que los resultados sean sastifactorio a la hora de la cosecha,  espera ser beneficiaddo con KIVA, para realizar la obra que tiene proyectada.  Su sueño llegar a ser un productor mayoritario de raices y tuberculos y birndarle mejora condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 49 years old.  His family is comprised of his wife and their four minor children.  They also help with farming chores.  He lives in Colonia San Miguel.

He is a farmer, and he mostly grows roots and tubers like yucca and “quequisque” (a root grown in tropical areas).  These are his primary and greatest sources of income in order to provide work and economic stability for the family.  He has been growing these crops, together with his family, for ten years.
