texts.es: Concepción del Carmen P. D. V., resiD. en Colón, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante D. productos varios, así mismo vive junto a dos hijos D. 18 y 16 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda en la cual venD. productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar y para las personas tales como: jabón, shampoo, pan, leche, golosinas, granos básicos y otros productos más los cuales son fundamentales en este tipo D. negocios. El negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. Lourdes en donD. posee varios años D. dedicarse a este oficio, y por lo que es muy conocida en el lugar, contando con varios clientes fijos. Concepción cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos y amigos, ya que es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, la cual se dedica por completo al bienestar D. su hogar. Concepción solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio con todo lo necesario para aumentar su inventario y D. esta manera ofrecer más productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias y poder salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Concepción del Carmen P. D. V. resides in Colón, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. There she lives with her husband, who works as a merchant selling various products, and their two children (ages 18 and 16) who are in school. Concepción has a store where she sells basic necessities for the home and personal products such as soap, shampoo, bread, milk, sweets, basic grains, and other products that are usually found in this type of business. Her store is located at the Lourdes Market where she has gained several years of experience. As a result, she has become well-known in the market and accumulated several established customers.

Concepción has many good references from her neighbors and friends. They indicate that she is a very responsible and hardworking person who is dedicated entirely to the welfare of her household. Concepción is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business with everything she needs to expand her inventory and offer more products to her customers. This will help improve her earnings and allow her to get ahead alongsiD. her family.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie B. 43, of talibon Bohol has been a sari-sari (convenience) store owner since 1990. He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to offer to his customers. 

Jovie plans to include rice in his inventory. He also plans to venture into other business opportunities to increase his income.

The additional income will be used to finance his child education and to meet his family's daily needs.

loans.use: sacks of rice, softdrinks and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy Baco is 33, she is from Talibon Bohol and has operated her small sari sari (convenience) store business since 2005. 

She is asking for funding from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to expand her business, to increase her profits.  With the funding she could purchase more merchandise to sell and increase her profits.  She would also like to invest in another business one day.

The additional income would enable her to provide an education for her children and to meet their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old and married. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Maria says she opened her store because she wants to serve the people in her community.

Maria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Maria is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP to purchase rice, soft drinks and other products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, softdrinks and other products to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma W. sells toilet bowl products. She plans to use her loan to expand her business so she can stock products frequently needed by her clientele.

This loan will boost her business and she believes this will maximize her profits. The additional income will contribute to he family's daily needs and living standards.

Elma will use additional income to educate her children and dependents.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia T. runs a sari-sari (convenience) store business in Albur, Bohol. She sells vinegar, coffee and other various products. She is asking for a loan to expand her business to maximize her profits buy offering additional merchandise. 

The additional inventory will mean that she will be able to provide for the increasing needs in her household, as well as afford better medical care for her family.

loans.use: to purchase softdrinks and other goods

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en:
Antonette C. is from the town of Albur. She is married and has a child. To make a living, Antonette operates a restaurant. 

She wants her business to grow, but at this time she lacks enough capital to buy and sell food in greater quantities. She would like to take care of the basic needs of her family such as food, clothes and school fees.

Antonette is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase one sack of rice, soft drinks and other ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks and other ingredients

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn U. sells different kinds of goods including rice.  Her challenge is that she lacks the capital to expand her business. She hopes to improve her sales and profits so that she can offer her family a better life.

One day she would like to become a wholesaler to retailers in her area.  She also plans to raise pigs in her backyard.

Bebelyn is 41 years old. She lives in Baclayon, Bohol.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and raise piglets

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.en:
Cipriciano owns a store where he sells a variety of goods. He also sells processed food and earns from selling sausages and hotdogs.  At this time his capital is too low to expand his business.  His income goes directly towards the needs of his family.

His goal is to have a warehouse and become a wholesaler.  Cipriciano hopes that he will improve the living conditions of his family and be able to create jobs for people in his community.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish, sausages and purified water

loans.name: Maximino

texts.en: Maximino R. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 46 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Maximino owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Maximino is just starting this business. Maximino joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maximino is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maximino from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina A. runs a rice farm business in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to improve her harvest. She hopes to maximize profits through buying fertilizers and quality seeds.

The additional income that she will be able to generate from her farm will be a great help to pay the school fees of her children, as well as to afford the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gypsy

texts.en:
Gypsy A., lives in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She owns a farm where she plants rice.  Gypsy would like to increase her harvest and become financially stable.

With her loan, she will purchase a variety of good seeds and fertilizers to increase her yield.  She is glad to be able to provide her community with her rice at a reasonable price. The additional money she earns from her farm will provide her family with their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en:
Jelita S. owns a farm and grows rice and root crops, in the town of Trento Agusan Del Sur.  With the additional farm supplies, she hopes to increase her harvest. In that way, she will be able to earn a higher income.

Her main goal is to expand her business to become more financially stable in the future. Any additional income will be reinvested into her business and support her family’s needs.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie S. is 51 years old. She lives in Trento Agusan Del Sur with her husband. They have owned a rice farm for quite a long time now and have eight children.

One of her dreams is to see her farm grow and become more productive.  However, with limited access to capital, she finds that hard to do.  Julie will primarily use the loan to buy fertilizers.  She aims to expand her business.

Any additional income will go to her family's daily consumption and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a single man who owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He operates a juice and french fry business. His potential customers are his neighbors and people who pass by.

Abdalla faces a challenge. During rainy season customers don't buy cold drinks. He hopes to expand his business.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan he wants to purchase materials to put up a shelter and chairs for his customers. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: To purchase materials to put up a shelter and chairs for his customers.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P. is 33 years old and from Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur.  She has been selling pigs since 2004. She is asking for funding from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to expand her business by buying more piglets and feed.
 
Marilou is married and has four children. The additional profits will allow her to better provide for their daily needs and maybe start another business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is a married woman with one pre-school age child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills for the family.

She has operated a vegetable stall, selling green vegetable and tomatoes for over two years.  Her customers are neighbors and visitors. Matilda faces a challenge of fluctuating prices and that effects her profits.

Matilda hopes to expand and even establish another business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu because of its mission of empowering social-economically marginalized entrepreneurs.  With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of tomatoes, onions and vegetables.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina S. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 51 years old, married and has four children.  Her eldest child is 20 years old while the youngest is 11. 

To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a fishing business, selling assorted fish at the market.  Josefina works hard to sustain her children's education.  She wants them to finish college and have bright futures.

Josefina joined CEVI to access financial services and to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.  

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a widowed woman with six children: five of whom graduated while one attends school.  She owns a house that doesn't have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.

Rukia faces a major challenge.  During the rainy season, the selling price for the fish is lower compared to the dry season.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan she wants to purchase more sacks of fish. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of fish.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily P. is from the town of Albur. She is 53 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Emily makes and sells cooked food.  She has a stall where she sells. Emily has added candies and other snacks to her offerings. 

Emily joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. 

She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Emily is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food. Emily plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children, one girl and three boys all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a cloth material selling business going from door to door and from home.  Christine has run her operation for over twelve years. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. 

Christine faces a challenge because the price of materials fluctuates. She hopes to rent a stall to sell cloth materials and to avoid going from door to door in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of materials for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of matereials for resale.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina O., 52, is married and lives in the town of Baclayon. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store, selling vinegar, soy sauce and other kinds of products.  Vivina said her store help to provide for her family's needs.  She hopes to expand her store. 

Vivina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Vivina is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela T. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 42 years old and married. She started her fishing business when she married her husband, who is a fisherman.  She helps to operate their boat and catches and sells assorted fish at the market.  Estela works hard to pay her obligations and to provide for her family's needs.

Estela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Estela is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She operates a kiosk (retail shop) selling drinking mineral water, ground nuts and smoking cigarettes. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby.  She also sells fish. 

Nancy faces the challenge of seasonality due to inadequate stock of items to sell when wholesale prices fluctuate.  She misses out on some sales.  Nancy hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services. With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase bundles of drinking mineral water, ground nuts, smoking cigarettes and sweets for resale.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of drinking mineral water, ground nuts , smoking cigarettes and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Juna

texts.en:
Ma. Juna B. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 39 years old, married and has two children.  She owns and operates a handicraft business, making and selling key chains and coin purses to tourists and local community members.  Ma. Juna also sells pork barbecue at night, outside their house.

Ma. Juna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Ma. Juna is requesting a new loan of 19000 PHP to purchase ingredients for barbecue and materials for making key chains.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making tarsier souvenirs and barbecue ingredients

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with one child who is two years old.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She operates a cosmetic and clothes selling business, going door to door to neighbors.  During rainy season it becomes hard to move from door to door selling cosmetics and clothes. She hopes to establish a shop to sell her products in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, Nuru wants to purchase cosmetics and clothes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase  cosmetics and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia C. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Eugenia is married and has one school-aged and one adult child. To make a living, Eugenia plants and harvests corn for sale. Eugenia has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Eugenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenia had successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Eugenia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He runs an electronics shop, selling mobiles phones and mobile batteries. He has been in operation for the past five years, selling in a shop and as a retailer to passersby. He faces a challenge of seasonality in his business. Denis hopes to expand and open another electronics shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shllings, he wants to purchase a stock of mobile phones. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase stock of mobile phones

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a tireless woman. She is 67 years old but still works long hours every day, tilling a small hectare of farm. She is doing this for a living, to earn an income and support her family.

Because she has limited access to capital, she has been unable to expand her business. The loan she applied for will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She believes she can maximize profit on her farm by buying the farming needs.

The additional income will go to pay for her family's daily needs, such as food, as well as investing in other possible new business opportunities. She also hopes to earn enough to support her family.

loans.use: Seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, who is from Banga, South Cotabato, has had her farm since 2008. She started her business with very little funding and wants to expand her harvest. Funding from CEVI would enable her to meet her goal for expanding her business and allow her to buy fertilizers and seeds. This would increase her yield.

The additional income would help Elizabeth to better provide for her family's daily needs and new business opportunities.

loans.use: Seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily C. of Surallah (near Banga) is 39 years old and has been earning a living by planting rice since 1995. There are many demands in her family and Emily feels that to support her family, she needs to expand her business. She plans to use her loan to buy farm supplies and seeds. She also sells chorizo (spicy sausage) and dried fish. She hopes to acquire more of those. Emily plans to use her increased income to provide for the daily needs of her four children and to pay for their educational expenses.

loans.use: Fertilizer and items for food sales like chorizo (spicy sausage) and dried fish

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He has operated a charcoal-selling business for over one year, selling as retail and from home to restaurant operators, neighbors and passersby. Joel faces the challenge of competition from other charcoal sellers and also poor quality of charcoal, leading to low sales volume. He hopes to expand his business from retail to wholesale in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bags of charcoal. Joel decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Planting rice has been Enriquita C.' livelihood. She is from Banga, South Cotabato. She never stops dreaming that someday she will be a successful businesswoman and she will be able to buy her family an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs.

She would like to apply for a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. The loan will hopefully help her improve her harvest. The income will be used to support her family and her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry P. lives in Banga, South Cotabato. He has owned a small farm since 2000. He has one son. With his child still studying, he wants to make sure that he is always ready financially.

He applied for the loan hoping that he can buy fertilizers and farm supplies that he thinks are lacking on his farm. The additional income will go to his family's daily consumption, his child’s schooling, and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Jill

texts.en:
Jill C. has owned a rice farm since 1995. She has many worries and she plans to use her loan to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers and seeds. With a good harvest from her farm, she will be able to support her family more.

Jill is married and lives in Banga, South Cotabato, Philippines. With her profits she will be able to send her children to school, venture into other business opportunities, and take care of her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

She has operated a food stall business for over three years, selling from home to manual laborers constructing houses, to neighbors and to passersby. Fridah faces a challenge of manual laborers taking food on credit and failing to pay. She hopes to build a permanent cafe to provide faster and prompt services to customers.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sack of rice, a bundle of wheat flour and cooking oil for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu because of its affordable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of rice, a bundle of wheat flour and cooking oil for her food stall

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with three children; two attend school while one is too young for school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees, rent and medical bills. 

He operates a cobbler business. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. David faces the challenge of low pay for the shoe-making business. He hopes to establish a wholesale outlet for his shoe business in the future. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more shoe soles for making shoes. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe soles for making shoes

loans.name: Graham

texts.en:
Graham is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is house rent.

He operates a cobbler business, making shoes for his neighbors and passersby. Graham hopes to establish a shoe shop to sell shoes in the future.   

He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business. With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase more shoes and purchase leather equipment to design shoes.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and leather equipment to design shoes

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with two children:  One attends school, and the other one is too young for school. He owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his child.

For more than eight years, he has operated a vegetable stall, selling to his neighbors and passersby.  Bakari faces the challenge of fluctuating market prices for vegetables. He hopes to expand his stall in the future.

He decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to improve his business. With this KSh 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase stocks of vegetables, fruit, tomatoes and onions to resell.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Kinyaara United Group

texts.en: Jack wants a loan to enable him to buy firewood to make bricks. He is a married man with three children. He rents a house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a bricklayer. Jack dreams of educating his children. He wishes to buy a machine to help ease his work and a lorry to transport firewood and bricks. Jack is a member of Kinyaara United. Each member guarantees the others for the purpose of accessing credit, given that they know themselves very well in terms of character and financial standing.

loans.use: To buy firewood to make bricks for selling

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 32 years old, and married, with a 3-year-old child. She earns a living by selling fish. Analiza has been a fish vendor for more than 8 years. She buys directly from fishermen and sells assorted fresh fish to the market. Analiza is happy to have her small business and hopes that it will grow.

Analiza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and she is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Angelita  plants and harvests rice for sale. Angelita has been engaged in farming for more than 3 years. Her husband, who is also a farmer, was able to buy a motorcycle and now uses it to transport people around their community when he is free from farming duties.

Angelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP  to purchase farm supplies and repair the motorcycle. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and repair a motorcycle

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose D. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 45 years old, and married, with 4 children. His children are 18, 17, 11 and 8 years old. To make a living, Jose plants and harvests rice for sale. Jose wants to provide a better life for his family. He also dreams of seeing all his children finish college and be successful.

Jose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has five children. To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a tailoring business. Her main source of income comes from providing general tailoring and alteration services to local community members. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Wilfreda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional materials such as needles and thread. Wilfreda plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as needles and thread

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido S. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 56 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Brigido owns and operates a general store. His main source of income comes from his retail business selling a variety of products in the local community. Brigido works hard to maintain his store.

Brigido joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Brigido is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Brigido from CEVI. He plans to save the additional revenue generated from his business to use as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to invest in business expansion

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea B. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 66 years old and married. She has a sari-sari (retail) store that she manages with her husband. They both work hard to improve their business. Aurea sells coconut wine and bananas and she is planning to also sell rice. 

Aurea joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Aurea is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase sacks of rice and other products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice and other products to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 58 years old and married with six children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates an agriculture business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice to sell. 

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from CEVI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from CEVI. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from her business as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 52 years old and married, with 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefina runs a general store, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Josefina also makes coconut candies that she sells at her store. 

Josefina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a cereal-selling business.  She has also sold dumplings for more than six years. Jackline faces a major challenge of seasonality for the products she sells. In the future, she hopes to own a cereals shop.    


With the loan of KSh 40,000, she is seeking to purchase iron sheets to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu for assistance with expenses related to food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets to renovate her house.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGEY a été crée le 27/08/2010 jour du 1er financement, il est composé de femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Le Groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DAGATH

Madame THIANE G., debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce. En fait elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits alimentaires (riz, huile, biscuits, sucre etc.)

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille tout en faisant l'expansion de son activité commerciale
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKKU LIGGEY was established on October 27, 2010, the day of the first loan.  The group is composed of women who are all from the same village.  The group is part of the Banc Villageois de DAGATH.

Ms. THIANE G. (at the far right in the photo) is the group's leader.  She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four children to support.  

She has a small business.  In fact, she owns a shop where she sells a variety of foods (rice, oil, bookies, sugar, etc.)  

Her new loan will enable her to bolster her shop with merchandise in order to increase her profits.  

Her goal is to provide for her family while expanding her business.

loans.use: Developing and advancing her business

loans.name: Sop Sa Aladji Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité  SOP SA ALADJI a été créé le 7/08/2009. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DAGATH

Madame Ndèye Marème D., debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.

Elle fait de la restauration, tous les matins, dans son petit restaurant elle vend le petit déjeuner 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille et faire la promotion de son activité
texts.en:
The Sop Sa Aladji solidarity group has been created on August 7, 2009. It is composed of 13 women who live in the same neighborhood. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Dagath. Mrs. Ndèye Marème D., standing on the far right in the photo, is the leaD. of this solidarty group. She is married and is the mother of four.

She cooks food for sale, every morning, in her small eatery, where she sells breakfast foods.

With her new loan she would like to expand her stock of products and increase her revenues. Her goal is to provide for family needs and to grow her business further.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies needed to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph wants a loan to purchase soft drinks, beer, waragi (a local brew) and general merchandise for selling at a profit. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a semi-permanent house where he lives with his wife and seven children. He dreams of educating his children, building a permanent house and adding wholesale items to his retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, beer, local brew and general merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson would like a loan to purchase cosmetics, cooking oil, sugar, rice and other domestic merchandise for reselling at his shop. He is married with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of having a stable family socially, spiritually and financially. He hopes to grow his business into a big one in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, cooking oil, sugar, rice and other domestic merhandise for reselling.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Thirty-nine-year-old Edison would like a loan to buy beans for reselling at a margin. Edison has a motorcycle transport business and he wishes to start a produce business. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda in a semi-permanent house. He hopes to buy a vehicle for special hire in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans for reselling.

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es:
El Joven  Pedro tiene la necesidad de superarce en la vida, el tabaja de dia y
estudia de noche quire terminar su preparatoria para asi poder entra a la univercidad
y terminar una carrera por eso solicito el prestamo a fundacion para comprar una computadora y asi poder hacer con mas facilidad sus tareas.
texts.en: Young Pedro would like to better himself in life.  He works by day and studies at night.  He wants to finish his sixth form (senior high school) studies so that he can go to university and complete a university course.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FVP so that he can buy a computer and thereby be able to do his homework with greater ease.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Sergio Guadalupe

texts.es: El Sr. Sergio Guadalupe y su esposa son  un matrimonio joven,  tienen un bebe al cual adoran y lo que mas les interesa es su seguridad y la de la misma vivienda, ya que con esfuerzo han ido construyendola, el motivo de esta solicitud, es para construir una barda al frente de su vivienda, asi cuando ellos salgan a trabajar, se van tranquilos por que su casa esta segura, ademas de mejorar el patrimonio de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sergio Guadalupe and his wife are a young marriage.  They have a baby that they adore and what is of most interest to them is his safety and the safety of their home since they have been building it with much effort.

The reason for this loan request is to build a front wall so that when they go to work they will feel safe because the house is secure as well as to improve their son’s estate.

loans.use: To build a wall in front of his house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr.Juan García es un hombre muy trabajador el hace trabajos de carpinteria y albañileria y hace tres años coloco en su casa una tienda de abarrotes que con la ayuda de su Esposa la Señora Juanita, es atendida, el siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante , sigue mejorando las condiciones de su casa y ahora negocio requiere el credito para terminar la elaboracion de la barda ya cuenta con algo de material solo que no lo pudo terminar por falta de recursos para eso es su credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan García is a very hard working man; he does carpentry and bricklaying jobs.  Three years ago he installed a grocery store in his home that his wife, Juanita, tends to.  He has always been a very hard working, responsible person with desires to get ahead in life.

He continues to make improvements to his home and now it’s the business that needs a loan to finish building a wall.  He already has some of the necessary supplies but he was unable to finish it due to lack of funds so this is the reason for the loan.

loans.use: To finish building a wall.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La  señora Z. T. Maria Elena tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres en un barrio de la ciudad de Tarija. Maria Elena es madre soltera tiene una hija. Maria Elena se dedica al comercio de verduras actividad que viene realizando desde hace mas de 6 años esta actividad la realiza en el mercado campesino.                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Maria Elena quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarle una mejor vida a su hija pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprar mas mercadería es por eso que el credito sera destinado para la compra de mercaderia para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Maria Elena  nos cuenta que quiere darle a su hija toda la comodidad que pueda para que sea feliz, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de un lote de terreno.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Elena Z. T., age 25, lives at home with her parents in one of the neighborhoods in the city of Tarija. She is a single mother with one daughter. Maria Elena is a vegetable merchant who has been in business for more than six years at the farmer’s market.

She wants to improve her income so that she can provide a better life for her daughter and indicates that she would like to buy more vegetables. Therefore, this loan will be used to buy merchandise so that she can increase her earnings.

Maria Elena says she wants to give her daughter all the comforts to make her happy. With the next loan that she will request, she plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es:
El señor Crispín tiene 34 años está casado con la señora Florencia, juntos tienen 3 hijos de (12, 9 y 2) años, desde hace mas de 12 años esta familia tiene una gran pena ya que la hija mayor tiene la enfermedad de parálisis cerebral, su hija nació normal y por una negligencia médica de hospital  ha cambiado totalmente su vida de la niña y de los padres.

El señor Crispín y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba, su principal actividad es el servicio de albañil y también trabaja de taxista con su vehículo propio y que además esta vehículo es muy necesario para transportar a su hija a un centro especial de rehabilitación todos los días , la esposa trabaja de limpieza con diferentes familias .

El préstamo está destinado para la reparación de su vehículo, y de esta manera conservar su herramienta de trabajo y de transporte para su hija.
Entre sus sueños y metas de don Crispín es tener su casa propia ya que ellos viven solo cuidando una saca, y lo más importante que algún dio se puede recuperar o por lo menos tener una mejoría de su enfermedad para que pueda llevar una vida mas normal.
texts.en:
Sr. Crispín is 34 years old and married to Sra. Florencia. Together they have three children (ages 12, 9, and 2). For more than twelve years, this family has faced a great challenge since the oldest daughter suffers from cerebral palsy. She was born normal, but negligence at the hospital completely changed the life of this young girl and her family.

Sr. Crispín and his family live in the city of Cochabamba. His main business activity is masonry, but he also operates his own vehicle as a taxi driver. Crispín finds his car very useful since he must take his daughter to a special rehabilitation center every day. His wife performs housekeeping jobs for different families.

This loan will be used to repair his vehicle, so that he can maintain it for work and for transporting his daughter. Among his dreams and goals, Don Crispín wants to have a house of his own where his family can live by themselves. The most important thing he can give his daughter is the chance to make improvements with her condition so that she can live as normal a life as possible.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La srta. Veronica tiene como actividad la elaboracion y venta de empanadas tucumanas en dierentes lugares donde las distribuye por mayor, atendiendo pedidos y otros contratos, trabajando de esta manera junto a su Mamá dentro de su hogar elaborando estas riquisimas empanadas, generando de esta manera ingresos para ella, sus estudios y su familia, que esta compuesta por ella y su mama; en esta oportunidad solicita credito porque se presento la oportunidad de comprar un puesto de venta con el cual mejorar su atencion y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que es muy conocida por sus ricos productos, es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Veronica has a business making and selling beef empanadas in various places where she distributes them at wholesale and takes orders and other contracts.  She works with her mother inside her home making these rich empanadas, in this way generating an income to support her studies and her family, which is composed of herself and her mother.  At this time she requests a loan because she has been presented with the opportunity to buy a sales post where she could provide better attention and service to her customers, since she is already known for her delicious products.  She is a very responsible and hardworking young person, and she is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a stall where she can sell her food

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: El señor José Omar K. F. se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas hace mas de un año aproximadamente , su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio Fonavi San Martín Ica en el cual vive con su esposa y su menor hijo también con sus padres con los cuales comparte los gastos familiares.El Solicitante presenta experiencia acrediticia con el cual se compró una moto líneal , está solicitando el crédito para ampliar su negocio comprando mercadería para campaña navideña se le otorgará el crédito por que tiene buenas referencias y tiene capacidad para asumir una nueva obligación.
texts.en: Jose Omar K. F. has had a business selling drinks and candy for more than a year.  His business is located in his home in the San Martin housing development in Ica, where he lives with his wife, their minor child and his parents, with whom they share the family expenses.  Jose has taken a prior loan, which he used to buy a motorcycle.  He is requesting this loan to expand his business by buying merchandise for the Christmas season.  He will be granted this loan because he has good references and has the capacity to assume a new obligation.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel tiene como actividad la costura de fundas para asiento y cortinas para minibuses y flotas que realizan el transporte de pasajeros, ayudando de esta manera a su esposo el Sr. Fernando quien trabaja como conductor asalariado de servicio publico, también realiza distintos tipos de confección  de prendas según a sus pedidos, es una familia joven que recién tiene una hija y esperan otro bebe, en esta oportunidad solicitan crédito para la compra de una maquina industrial con la cual mejora su calidad de trabajo generando mejores ingresos para ella y su familia son una pareja muy trabajadora uno de sus deseos es el de tener una fabrica que se dedique a la confección de fundas de asiento para todo tipo de movilidades, están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Maribel engages in sewing seat covers and curtains for minibuses and long-distance buses used in passengers’ transportation. In this way she helps her husband Fernando, a public transportation driver; she also creates different kinds of clothes according to the requests she receives. This is a young family: they recently had a daughter and are expecting a baby. The loan requested will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve the quality of Maribel’s work and consequently increase the income for her and her family. This is a very hard-working couple, and one of their dreams is to own a factory that will produce seat covers for every kind of vehicle. They are deeply thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Lesbia Rosa

texts.es:
Lesbia es una mujer trabajadora, de edad avanzada, muy dedicada a su familia. Hoy en día trabaja como responsable de un colegio infantil y costurera que ha hecho su profesión por años.
Es madre soltera, y ha venido mejorando su casa poco a poco y con ayuda de los financiamientos de la institución, en donde logro hacer la división de cuarto ya que le era de mucha necesidad.
Con este financiamiento lograra la mejora para una higiene mejor. La compra de un inodoro, para instalarlo entre otros materiales como: arena, cemento, pega y otros.
texts.en: Lesbia is a hard-working, elderly woman who is devoted to her family.  She currently works in an elementary school as well as working as a seamstress which has been her profession for years.  She is a single mother and has been improving her house little by little with the help of loans from our organization.  For example, she really needed to put up partitions in one of her rooms and managed to do this.  With this loan she will improve her house's hygiene.  She will buy a toilet to install and also other materials such as sand, cement, adhesive, etc.

loans.use: To buy a toilet in order to achieve better hygiene and other materials needed to carry out the work

loans.name: Martha Graciela

texts.es: La señora Martha es un cliente nuevo en la institución, la actividad de la cliente es la venta de productos  para bajar de peso, estos productos son naturales que ayudan a diferentes enfermedades que puede adquirir la persona, su negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, su esposo tiene la actividad de profesor, el trabaja todos los días por las tardes y en las mañanas le ayuda a su esposa en su labor, la señora Martha tiene la profesión de auditora en un momento de la vida ejerció su profesión pero por causas de la familia y por los constantes viajes que tenia en su trabajo ella decidió dejar su trabajo, al decidir eso inicio su trabajo de venta de estos productos, el crédito será invertido en la compra de producto para adelgazar, este producto que quiere adquirir es muy demandado por sus consumidores, la pareja actualmente tiene dos hijos uno de ellos  ya esta en el colegio y el otro todavía no. Están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Martha is a new customer of this institution. She in engages in selling products to lose weight: these are natural products that help treating different illnesses that can affect people. Hers shop is located in her own house. Her husband is a teacher: he works daily during the evenings, while in the mornings he helps his wife with her activity. An auditor by education, at one time in her life Martha has worked in this capacity, but due to family issues and to the fact she was constantly travelling she decided quitting her job; after taking this decision she also started her present activity. The loan will be used to buy a slenderizing product that her customers request the most. Martha and her husband have two children: one goes to school while the other is still too young. They are deeply thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy products to lose weight.

loans.name: Nestor Javier

texts.es: EL Sr. Néstor mas conocido tiene 41 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de la Paz  El Sr. vive con su esposa en una casa Familiar,  junto a sus 2 hijos uno de 16 años y otro de 3 añitos de edad se dedica al Trasporte publico dueño de microbús y con una Derecho de línea el dinero de solicito es para la compra de llantas recauchutadas (refaccionadas) para su microbús ya que ya están muy viejas las que actualmente tiene. Además el Sr  Néstor esta ahorrando para poder comprarse muy pronto una casa para poder habitarla junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos y así brindarles comodidad ya que viven un poco incomodas, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Néstor is very well known in his community. A native of La Paz, he is 41 years old and he lives in a family house with his wife and their two children, aged 16 and 3. He engages in public transport: he owns a microbus and a permit for one line. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy retreaded (repaired) tires for his microbus, as the ones he is actually using are very old. He is also saving in order to buy a house in the near future: he wants to offer a comfortable dwelling to his wife and children, as at the moment they are living in uncomfortable conditions. He is deeply thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy retreaded tires for his microbus.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a son. She lives and works in Novaya Kahovka, Kherson region. She sells sportswear at a local market in her hometown. She began this business 10 years ago. Her business has grown to 30,000 Grivnyas in working capital, and provides her income of about 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Svetlana has a reputation as a goal-oriented, hard-working and pleasant merchant. She enjoys her work and responds to economic opportunity. Svetlana is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of sportswear to sell at her kiosk at affordable prices. Svetlana is hoping to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of sportswear

loans.name: Carmen Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Carme es muy de trabajadora y madre de familia, ella desde que se divorcio ella se ha hecho responsable de sus tres hijos, hasta que que dos de sus hijos empezaron a trabajar, ahora solo depende de ella un hijo, ella a luchado mucho por su casa  y ahora busca terminar un cuarto.
texts.en:
Carmen is a very hard working mother.  Since her divorce she has been responsible for her three children’s care until two of them started working.  Now, only one of her children depends on her.

She has fought much for her house and now she wants to finish a room.

loans.use: To finish the wall in a room.

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ángela del Carmen L. V., tiene la edad de 40 años habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, es casada y su esposo es albañil, y apoya a los gastos que incurre la familia mensualmente, ellos tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos mayores de edad que trabajan y sobreviven de manera independiente y un adolecente que se dedica a los estudios y depende económicamente de sus padres, la señora Ángela es domestica, ellos son una familia muy humilde y que sus ingresos le han impedido el realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda que favorezcan el habitar en mejores condiciones a su familia, es para esto que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que mejoren las comodidades diarias de sus hijos con la instalación de una malla que brinde seguridad a todos los integrantes de su familia, y a futuro heredarles un hogar digno donde puedan convivir con los suyos.
texts.en: Mrs. Ángela del Carmen L. V. is 40 years old. She lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. She helps out with the family's monthly expenses. She has 3 children. Two of them are grown and they work and survive independently. The other is a teenager who is in school and depends on his parents financially. Ángela is a domestic worker. They are a very humble family and their income has impeded their making improvements on their home to make their living conditions better.  That is why she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials to improve the daily comfort of her children by installing a fence that will offer security to all of the family members. In the future, they will inherit a home fit to live in with their own families.

loans.use: To buy an iron fence

loans.name: Cesar Percy

texts.es:
El cliente Cesar Persy C. M. se dedica ala extracción de oro en una mina ubicada en la provincia de Barranca.
El solicitante tiene su casa propia construida de material noble gracias a su trabajo, vive con su esposa y su hijo de seis años de edad ,está solicitando el crédito para la compra de una herramienta para su uso en la mina , se propone otorgarle el crédito por tener capacidad de pago y además cuenta con ahorros en el cuál están depositados en otra entidad bancaría.
texts.en:
Cesar Persy C. M. works extracting gold from a mine located in the Barranca province.

He has his own house, that was built with good materials thanks to his work.  He lives with his wife and his six year old son.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase a tool for use in the mine.  He feels he deserves this loan because he is able to pay it back and he has savings which are deposited in another bank.

loans.use: Purchase a tool to use at work in a mine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Rosas De Sajama Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. ROSAS DE SAJAMA inicia su ciclo Nº 2 en el Centro Focal de Cascada.  Esta asociación está compuesta por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva tiene a la cabeza a la señora Magaly como presidenta.

La señora  Magaly es una mujer joven de 28  años de edad, casada, madre de dos niños. Este es su segundo ciclo en esta asociación.   Con respecto a su negocio ella y su pareja cuentan con los negocios de Servicio de Tornería y macrame. Este crédito será invertido en impulsar estos negocios,pues ellos son los que dan sustento a la famlia.
  
Desde hace cinco años trabaja con su esposo en la torneria y realiza el macrame, compra los materiales por mayor de la ciudad de La Paz y el servicio de torneria y su trabajo en macrame son realizados en el mismo domicilio.
El crédito solicitado de Bs. 2000.- le serviría para aumentar el capital de ambos negocios.
 Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como: tienda de barrio, venta de libros, venta de mantas, venta de verduras,  Taller de torneria, servicio de taxi, venta de fruta, tejido, venta de comida.
texts.en:
The ROSAS DE SAJAMA communal bank is starting its second cycle in the Cascada Focal Center.  This bank has nine members, eight women and one man.  The governing board is headed by Magaly as group President.

Magaly, 28, is married and has two children.  This is her second cycle within this bank.  She and her husband have two businesses:  a metal shop and macramé.  This loan will be used for both businesses because they are what support the family.

For the last five years she has worked with her husband operating a lathe and making macramé; both businesses are home-based.

The requested, Bs.2000 loan, will serve to increase capital for both businesses.

With respect to the businesses of the other group members, they are: neighborhood grocery store, book sales, blanket sales, vegetable sales, metal (lathe) shop, taxi services, fruit sales, weaving, clothing sales

loans.use: Capital for the metal shop.

loans.name: Alegres De Tilata Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. ALEGRES DE TILATA inicia su ciclo Nº 2 en el Centro Focal de Cascada.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva tiene a la cabeza a la señora Leonarda como presidenta.

La señora  Leonarda es una mujer madura de 47 años de edad, casada, madre de cuatro hijos. Este es su segundo ciclo en esta asociación, comenta que le gusta la capacitación y la atención en salud porque fue bien atendida.   Con respecto a su negocio ella vende "menudencias"(hígado, riñones, panza, etc.) de vaca desde hace 20 años.   Este es un negocio que le enseño su comadre. Sus ventas son realizadas en "La Ceja", zona popular y comercial de la zona de la Ciudad de El Alto,los horarios son a partir de las cuatro de la tarde hasta las nueve de la noche, recibe la ayuda de su hija.

El crédito solicitado de Bs. 3500.- serán invertidos en  mercadería.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados,  como: venta de carne, tejidos de mantas, albañilería, artesanía en tejidos, venta de dulces, tejido de chompas, venta de menudencias (hígado, riñones, panza, etc.)
texts.en:
The Alegres de Tilata communal bank is beginning its second loan cycle in the Cascada community center. This association consists of eight members – seven women and one man. The head of the board of directors is Leonarda, the president.

Leonarda is a mature 47-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of four children. This is her second loan cycle with the group and she comments that she likes the training and the health care because she was well attended. Regarding her business, she has been selling cow giblets (liver, kidneys, stomach, etc.) for 20 years, a trade that her godmother taught her. She makes her sales in La Ceja, a working-class and business area of the city of El Alto. Her hours are from 4pm to 9pm and her daughter helps her. Her individual loan for 3,500 Bolivian Bolivianos (BOB) will be invested in merchandise. The businesses of the rest of the group members vary – meat sales, knitted blankets, building, textiles, candy sales, knitted sweaters, and giblets sales (liver, kidneys, stomach, etc.).

loans.use: To purchase giblets (liver, stomach, kidneys, etc.)

loans.name: Palomas Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. PALOMAS  inicia su ciclo Nº 1 en el Centro Focal de Cascada, sin embargo cuenta con algunas socias que ya han participado en los servicios de Pro Mujer. Es el caso de la señora presidenta la señora Virginia, quien comenta que ya está doce años en la institución.  Esta asociación Palomas, está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón. 

La señora  Leonarda es una mujer madura de 52 años de edad, divorciada, madre de cuatro hijos. La señora refiere que ha participado en otras asociaciones y con el dinero su negocio ha crecido y ha podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  Su negocio inicio con un pequeño puesto a la puerta de su casa en el que vendía chicharrón de pollo, con el tiempo pudo adecuar un ambiente para abrir una pensión.  Además, comenta que hace unos años ella recibió un diagnóstico en el consultorio de salud en Pro Mujer, que le salvó la vida, pues puso al descubierto una enfermedad que requería una operación de emergencia.  
El crédito que ha solicitado de Bs. 2000.- será invertido en la compra de insumos para su pensión.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados,  como: pensión, artesana de cuadros en lana,  trenzado de mantas, bordados, confección de ropa, venta de cosméticos,  compra - venta de plata y oro, venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The PALOMAS community bank are beginning their first loan cycle in the Cascada regional office.  However, the group contains some members who have already taken part in Pro Mujer's services.  This is the case for the president of the group, Virginia, who comments that she has been with the organization for twelve years.  The Palomas group has eight members, seven women and one man.

Leonarda is a mature lady who is 52 years old.  She is divorced and has four children.  She says that she has participated in other community banks and with the money her business has grown and she has been able to improve her living conditions.  Her business started with a small stall in the doorway of her home from where she sold deep-fried chicken.  Over time she managed to make the alterations necessary to open a guesthouse.  In addition, she comments that some years ago she received a check up in the doctor's office at Pro Mujer which saved her life since it diagnosed an illness which required an emergency operation.

The loan she has requested of 2000 bolivianos will be used to buy supplies for her guest house.  With respect to the businesses which the rest of the organization's members carry out, they are varied and include: guest house, hand-made wool pictures, making braided rugs, embroideries, dressmaking, cosmetics sales, buying and selling of silver and gold, and grocery sales.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies, rice, noodles and oil

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Sarah has a business of selling charcoal and firewood, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal and firewood.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Sarah hopes to own a house and stop renting. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: Charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Rechael

texts.en:
Rechael N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Rechael has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Rechael has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase tomatoes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rechael hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Rechael hopes to own a retail shop. Rechael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: Tomatoes

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Ritah has a business of selling roasted food, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rita hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  

In the future, Ritah hopes to complete her studies and become a dentist. Ritah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching trust in each other.

loans.use: For charcoal

Joan N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are currently in school. Joan has a business of a food stall, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joan hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Joan hopes to own a motorcycle.        

Joan is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

Betty N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. None of her children are currently in school. Betty has a business in agriculture, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase tomatoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food. In the future, Betty hopes to own a salon.        

Betty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.use: Tomatoes

Resty N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Resty has a business of a salon, which she has had for six years.         

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids and treatment oil. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Resty hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Resty hopes to own a motorcycle. Resty is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standards of living.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is a 17-year-old living in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. Single and with no children, for the past two years Teddy has operated a poultry and pig production business.

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase chickens and pigs. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees, and in the future hopes to become a businesswoman.

Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to become independent and responsible.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N., who is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda, is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Harriet has a shop selling spare parts and soft drinks. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase oil machines. With the help of the loan, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. Her goal is to own a house.

Harriet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by working together.

loans.use: To buy oil machine

loans.name: Jasimin

texts.en:
Jasimin N., a 20-year old a single mother of one child, lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past six years, Jasimin has had business selling passion fruit wholesale. She also has a cosmetics shop.

To help expand her business, Jasimin has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more sacks of passion fruit. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her child. In the future, she aspires to own a house in Kampala.

Jasimin is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her acquire new social relationships.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of passion fruit

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Faridah hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her child.  In the future, Faridah hopes to own a boutique.  Faridah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

Aisha N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the South region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Aisha has a business of outside catering, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil and baking flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Aisha hopes to own a boutique. To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soap and sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Irene hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Irene hopes to become an international business woman. Grace W. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children. Grace owns a retail shop, which she has had for three years.  She sells air time for phones.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sweets and drinks.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Grace hopes to own cows.  Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

Margret N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Margret owns a cosmetic shop business, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase lotions and braids.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Margret hopes to own a salon.   Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being cooperative with each other.

loans.name: Silvia Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Silvia Del Rosario C. C. se dedica a trabajar como obrera de campo y también tiene su mototaxi propia la cual la maneja su esposo, ellos viven en casa propia tienen dos hijas menores como carga familiar.La solicitante cuenta con buenas referencias acriditicias por que sus artefactos los adquirido alcontado y actualmente no tiene deuda  y en otras entidades a pagado bien por tal mótivo se propone otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en: Mrs. Del Rosario C. C. works as a field worker and she also has a mototaxi (three wheeled motorized vehicle) which is driven by her husband. They live in their own home and they have two underage daughters who they take care of. The member has good credit references since what she owns she has paid in full. At this time she has no debt and in other organizations she has paid all of her debts, it is for this reason that she is to be given the loan.

loans.use: Work Capital.

loans.name: Inelda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Inelda R. del municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno, en el departamento de Bolívar, es una mujer casada con 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 28 años,  que desde hace seis años inició  su microempresa de venta de mercancías variadas,  acompañada de una amiga con quien  logró obtener su primera clientela en un mercado doméstico conformado por en un grupo minoritario de habitantes de su pueblo; pero gradualmente el espíritu emprendedor e  independiente de Inelda, la llevó a pensar en trabajar directamente y acudió hace alrededor de 5 años a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo donde recibió su primer financiamiento y logró independizarse de su amiga. Este es su cuarto financiamiento y con su credikiva estaría preparándose para la temporada de fin de año, que viene con muchas solicitudes de sus clientes con relación a productos que ella vende:   vestidos para niños, para damas y caballeros y ropa interior.  Inelda con sus productos obtiene una utilidad del 28% y esta inyección de capital de trabajo le augura éxito , pues hay dinero circulante en el mercado en esta temporada y sus ventas repuntan pues es una bella época de integración familiar y fiestas para despedir el año.
