Inelda se muestra muy satisfecha con sus financiamientos en la Fundación, porque ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar, especialmente los estudios de su hija que se prepara como fisioterapeuta, realizar adecuaciones de su vivienda y aumentar sus ventas, las  que mucho han contribuido con el aumento de sus utilidades para generar oportunidades a sus hijos y mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.
Su sueño es tener un local en su casa, o punto de ventas provistos de vitrinas bien dispuestas y surtidas,  donde los clientes encuentren todo lo que ellos necesitan, así como lograr que su hija termine su carrera y se perfile para ser una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Inelda R. from San Juan Nepomuceno, Bolívar department, is a married woman with three children whose ages range from 18 to 28, who six years ago started her micro business selling assorted merchandise with a friend who helped her get her first customers in a domestic market made up of a minority group of townsfolk.  Gradually her enterprising and independent spirit moved her to work directly and five years ago she came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo where she got her first loan allowing her to become independent from her friend.

This is her fourth loan and she will use the Kiva funds to prepare for the end of year season that is approaching.  She has many pending orders for her type of merchandise from customers: children’s clothes, women’s and men’s clothes and underwear.

Inelda earns a 28% profit and this injection of capital foretells success for her because there is cash circulating in the market this time of year and sales spike because it’s a beautiful time when families come together at parties to say farewell to the year.

Inelda is very satisfied with loans from the Fundación because they have helped her support her household, especially her daughter’s training as a physiotherapist, some house repairs and increases in sales which have contributed to higher profits leading to opportunities for her children and to home improvements.

Her dream is to have store in her home or a sales point with well situated and stocked display cases where customers can find everything they need as well as have her daughter finish her professional training so that she can be poised to become a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy women's, men's and children's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children; two attend school while two are married. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

She has operated her business of selling food for over two years, selling from her home to her neighbours. Fatuma faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, fewer customers turn up to purchase food. She hopes to build rental houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour and sacks of beans. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school.  He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transportation and food expense.

He operates a boda boda (motor bicycle) and taxi business. He has been in operation for over three years. Abdalla faces the challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to own a car hire company in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to get loans and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank and cement to put up his tank with.

loans.name: Draft;wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transportation and food for the family.

He has operated a poultry business and charcoal selling, both retail and from door to door, his potential customers being butcher operators and food vendors. He faces the challenge of seasonality, chicken diseases and food vendors. He decided to join Yehu to have four branches to supply frequently. 

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to pay school fees for his children. He decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with five children; three attend school while two are too young for school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

She operates a grocery business, selling tomatoes, cabbage and green vegetables. In addition she sells charcoal contributing to her other source of income. Mishi faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, cabbage and fried fish. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, green vegetables, cabbage and fried fish.

loans.name: Moyran Del Carmen

texts.es:
Hace 10 años Moyran una mujer casada y con tres hijos en las edades de 5 a 17 años, logró iniciar su emprendimiento llamado “Nuevo Milenio”, una tienda que surgió producto de la experiencia que vio en su madre  y de la necesidad de generar ingresos para salir adelante, pues  ella  y su familia, dependientes económicamente de su esposo afrontaban una crisis, pues este había quedado desempleado. Así fue como inició comprando a crédito todos su equipamiento y enseres y también los productos que vendía, siendo este su mayor desafío pues debía pagarlos en un término de quince días; La gran capacidad de trabajo y disciplina , de ella y de su esposo fueron importantes  para que desde ese mismo momento les fuera muy bien en su tienda y hasta lograra comprar la casa donde no solo Vivian sino que tenían su tienda,  el ingreso principal del hogar y el puesto de trabajo de la pareja,  que aun trabajan juntos,  y en algunas ocasiones son apoyados por su hijo mayor,  que ya  se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. Su amabilidad y buen servicio es tal, que sus clientes vienen diariamente desde muy lejos, para comprarle los bienes y mercancías que Moyran y su esposo ofrecen en su tienda y que en su mayor parte son parte de la canasta familiar y articulos de miscelanea.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con ello aspira a aumentar la compra  y la oferta de sus productos de contado,    pues más adelante aspira a tener su propio un local donde instalar su tienda, pues    en la actualidad funciona en la parte delantera de la casa y quiere separar su actividad productiva de su vida familiar.  Con su credikiva comprará ranchos,  víveres  licores en gran volumen, preparándose para inyectarle este capital en una época de incremento de las ventas y está contando con lograr mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Ten years ago Moyran, a married woman with three children whose ages range from 5 to 17 years, managed to start a business called “Nuevo Milenio” (New Millennium), a store that arose from her mother’s experience and the need to earn income to get ahead because she and her family, who depended economically on her husband, were facing a crisis when he lost his job.

This is how she started out buying all her equipment, shelves and products on credit.  This was a huge challenge because she had to pay them off in two weeks.  Her capacity for work and discipline, as well as her husband’s, were vital for them to start doing well with the store immediately so much so that they even managed to buy the house they lived in and where the store was situated.

The store is their main source of income and the couple’s place of employment; they still work together.  Sometimes their oldest son helps out because he’s studying in the university.

Her kindness and good customer service is such that customers come daily even from far away to buy goods and merchandise that Moyran and her husband have in stock in their store and which, for the most part, constitute basic household items and miscellany.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she hopes to use it to increase stock inventory taking advantages of discounts offered for cash purchases.  Later on she hopes to have a location for the store since it currently operates in the front part of her house and she’d like to separate work from family life.

She will use her Kiva funds to buy snacks, foodstuffs and liquor in large amounts preparing to inject capital during this season of higher sales hoping thereby to earn higher profits.

loans.use: She will buy snacks, foodstuffs and liquor in large amounts to inject capital during this season of increased sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a selling stall, purchase iron sheets, timber and pay labor charges.

loans.name: Kadii

texts.en: Kadii is a divorced woman with five children, three of whom attend school while two are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For over 10 years, she has operated a grocery business, selling coconuts, onions and matoke (bananas for cooking) on a retail basis to her neighbors. Kadii hopes to build a house in the future. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, onions and matoke (bananas for cooking) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and matoke (bananas for cooking) for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a business of selling Maandazi (dumplings - Kenya Doughnuts) and peas. She sells her items at the market and from home to her neighbours. Mwanakombo faces a challenge of competition from other food vendors in the market. She hopes to expand and get more clients to increase her income in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase a sack of sugar, a sack of peas, one litre of cooking fat and a bundle of wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of sugar, a sack of peas, one litre of cooking fat and a bundle of wheat flour.

loans.name: Wakati

texts.en:
Wakati is a married woman with nine children, three of whom attend school, while the others have graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a maandazi (dumpling) business selling from door -to-door to her neighbours. Wakati faces a major challenge of competition from other sellers in the market. She hopes to open a different type of business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase blocks to construct a house for her son. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to finance education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase blocks to construct a house for her son.

loans.name: Sulmaris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sulmaris Martínez D. Ávila, es una mujer D. 39 años que vive en San Juan D. Nepomuceno, donD. tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios D. internet, copias y también venD. papelería en general. Tiene 4 hijos en las edades D. 4 a 18 años a quien aspira lograr llevarlos hasta que sean profesionales exitosos y gente D. bien.
DesD. hace alrededor D. dos años está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y ha logrado obtener, con este su credikiva,  el tercer financiamiento.  Sulmaris  inició su negocio hace algo más D. dos años, comprándoselo a una amiga, con los recursos D. ahorro que le dejaron sus anteriores trabajos con la alcaldía municipal.  Inició con cinco computadores y luego agregó el servicio D. fotocopiado y más equipos D. cómputo;  Sulmaris es una mujer que además D. tener este negocio,  también trabaja en una empresa social del estado, por eso su mayor desafío es la multiplicidad D. trabajo que diariamente enfrenta entre las dos actividades, aunque ha logrado ajustarse muy bien con el apoyo D. una amiga, que se lo atienD. diariamente mientras Sulmaris lo trabaja al medio día y en la noche,  además D. los sábados , ayudada por sus hijos.
Con el apoyo D. la Fundación en financiamientos Sulmaris ha logrado adicionar otros productos como el D. venta D. papelería, adicionalmente su esfuerzo se ve reflejado en la seriedad él.  D. allí que su sueño es ampliarlo agregándole variedades para que sea un punto D. servicio muy reconocido en el pueblo y con el lograr ofrecerle a sus hijos las posibilidades D. estudios profesionales para que se conviertan en personas exitosas en su vida personal y familiar.
Con su credikiva Sulmaris comprará un telefax, papelería y detalles que empacará muy delicadamente, para que se conviertan en los regalos típicos D. las familias en estas fiestas D. fin D. año. Su mayor desafío es el mantenimiento preventivo y manejo apropiado que requieren los equipos D. tecnología, en lo que ha logrado avanzar con la asesoría D. un técnico en el asunto.
texts.en:
Sulmaris Martínez D. Ávila, 39, is a woman living in San Juan Nepomuceno where she has an Internet café.  She also provides photocopying services and sells general stationery items.  She has four children ranging in age from 4 to 18 years that she hopes to support until they become successful professionals and upstanding citizens.

She has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for about two years and has obtained, counting this Kiva loan, thirteen loans.  Sulmaris started her business a bit more than two years ago; she bought it from a friend with savings she had from previous employment as a city employee. She started out with five computers and then added the photocopying and other computer-based services.

Besides owning this business, Sulmaris is also employed by a state-run social agency so her greatest challenge is the daily work load she faces in both activities.  She does, however, have help from a friend who tends to the store daily during the morning and Sulmaris works afternoons and evenings as well as Saturdays with help from her children.

With loans from the Fundación Sulmaris has managed to add other products, like stationery.  Her efforts are reflected in the business’s formality. This leads to her dream of enlarging it adding more variety so that it will become a well known service point in town so that she can proviD. her children with the possibility to have professional studies so that they can become successful in their personal and family lives.

She will use her Kiva funds to buy a fax machine, paper goods and gift items that she will gift wrap delicately so that they will become typical family gifts for end of year festivities.

Her biggest challenge is to keep her technical equipment in good working order and to proviD. preventive maintenance for it; for that she relies on professional assistance from a technician versed in that matter.

loans.use: She will buy a fax machine, paper goods and decorative items that she will wrap very delicately so that they can become typical family gifts for end of year festivities.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a married woman with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over ten years, she has operated her retail shop, rental house and water vendor businesses; neighbours and passersby being her potential customers. Hanna faces a major challenge of delayed payments from creditors who take goods on credit. She hopes to purchase a matatu (fourteen passenger van) in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get education on business management and to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 4 sacks of rice for her retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sacks of rice for her retail shop.

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada is a married woman who has seven children. Two of her children attend school while the others have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a cashew nuts and water selling business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Sada faces a challenge of seasonality in business. She hopes to purchase a big water tank in the future. 

With the KES 35,000 loan, she wants to purchase water pipes and to pay for their installation fees and labor charges. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes, pay for the installation fees and labor charges.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a vegetable selling business for the past eight years, selling potatoes, green vegetables and fruits to her neighbours and passersby. Domitila faces a challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans. With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase tomatoes, fruits and sukuma wiki(green vegetables).

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, fruits and sukuma wiki(green vegetables).

loans.name: Corazon De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. CORAZON DE ORO  inicia su ciclo Nº 10 en el Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Como grupo se ha renovado, cuenta con muchas socias nuevas, como es el caso de la Presidenta y la Secretaria de Actas, sin embargo, para el cargo de tesorera eligieron a la señora Francisca, quien cuenta con nueve ciclos de antigüedad, lo que les permitirá contar en la mesa directiva con una persona con experiencia.  Esta asociación está compuesta por ocho mujeres. 

La señora  Francisca es una mujer madura de 52 años de edad, casada. El negocio de la señora Francisca es el de realizar macramé a las mantas, ha desarrollado el mismo desde hace treinta años.  Esta labor es realizada en su domicilio, lo que le permite cumplir con las tareas de hogar.  Las ventas también son realizadas en su casa.  El crédito solicitado de $us 650.- será invertido en la compra de materia prima.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados,  como: macramé de mantas, tienda de ropa, producción de mantas, elaboración de cuadernos, macramé de mantas, venta de condimentos y venta de mantas de vicuña.
texts.en:
The CORAZON DE ORO (Heart of Gold) communal bank starts its 10th cycle within the Germán Busch Focal Center.  It has been renewed and has many new members as is the case of the President and Recording Secretary.  However, for the post of Treasurer Francisca, who has been in 9 previous cycles, was elected which will place a person with experience on the governing board.  This communal bank has 8 members.

Francisca is a mature, 52 year old, married woman.  She has made macramé decorations on blankets for 30 years.  She works at home which allows her to do her household chores too.  Sales are also home based.  The $650 USD loan will be used to buy raw materials.

The other group members are in a variety of business activities.  Among them are: macramé on blankets, clothing store, blanket weaving, notebook making, macramé on blankets, spice sales and vicuña blanket sales.

loans.use: To buy macramé supplies.

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. TRIUNFADORAS están ingresando a su tercer en el Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Como grupo es relativamente nuevo, sin embargo, la presidenta es una socia que ya tuvo experiencias en otro grupo, las señoras piensan que esto les dará la oportunidad de tener a una buena líder en el cargo.

La señora  Marcela es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada. El negocio de la señora Marcela es el de realizar venta de mantas.   Las mantas son una prenda de vestir muy apreciada e indispensable en la vestimenta de las mujeres de pollera.  Ella cuenta con un puesto en la zona 16 de Julio, un barrio popular y muy comercial de la ciudad de El Alto.  El crédito solicitado de Bs1500.- será invertido en la compra de mercadería.

Las socias de base y mesa directiva, también cuentan con negocios de demanda popular, como ser: Venta de golosinas, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, comercio de productos de belleza, venta de mantas, venta de abarrotes, venta de productos, ayudante de cocina, venta de ropa de mujer de pollera.
texts.en:
The TRIUNFADORAS (Victorious Ones) communal bank is starting their third cycle within the Germán Busch Focal Center. The group is relatively new but the President is a member with prior experience in another group so the women feel this will give them the opportunity to have a good leader at the head of the group.

Marcela, 33, is married.  She sells shawls.  These shawls are a valued and indispensable article of clothing for women.  She has a stand in the 16 de Julio area, a popular, very commercial area of El Alto.  The Bs.1500 loan will be used to buy merchandise.  

The regular group members as well as the members of the governing board have popular businesses.  Some are:  sweets sales, neighborhood grocery store, food sales, beauty products sales, shawl sales, grocery sales, product sales, kitchen helper and women’s clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy shawls.

loans.name: Suhgerel

texts.en:
Suhgerel M. is a 39-year-old, hardworking man who lives with his wife and 4 children in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. His 3 older children attend a local secondary school, while the youngest stays at home. 

Suhgerel started a taxi service in 2002. He sold his own herds for cash to buy a car that he could use as a taxi. His wife also runs a clothing business at the local market to help him to provide for the family. Their plan is to build a nice, big house to improve their quality of life and, also, to get a shipping container at the market which his wife can use as a workplace. The couple will work very hard to achieve their goals in the coming two years. 

Suhgerel is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his car and more goods for the clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Badamgarav

texts.en:
Badamgarav D. is a 26-year-old, optimistic and hardworking man, who lives with wife and 3-year-old child in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. He graduated from the Agriculture College as a carpenter in 2002. During 2006-2007 he worked in Kazakstan and in 2007-2009 in Ulaanbaatar as a carpenter, where he learnt much and gained much experience. 

Now, he operates his own carpentry workshop in his hometown and produces wooden furniture for local customers. His wife runs a clothing business at the local market and helps to provide for the family. 

Badamgarav is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials for his carpentry business and more goods for his wife's clothing business. His future plan is to expand his workspace.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima V. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 49 years old. Prima is married and has six children. Her eldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is only 10. To make a living, Prima runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Prima is working hard to sustain her children's education and to provide for the increasing needs of her household.

Prima joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prima has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Prima is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin P. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 29 years old. Edwin is married and has three young children. To make a living, Edwin operates a fishing business.The main source of income for the business comes from gathering and selling seaweed to the market.

Edwin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase an engine for a fishing boat. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase an engine for a fishing boat

loans.name: Silvina

texts.en:
Silvina R. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 48 years old. Silvina is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Silvina raises pigs for fattening and sale. Silvina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Silvina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Silvina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Silvina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa B. is from the town of Banga. She is 66 years old and widowed. Elisa 's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elisa also raises pigs for fattening. Elisa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Napisa

texts.en:
Napisa J. is 55 years old, single, and has three children. She was born into a low-income family of farmers and helped her parents in the household: she milked cows, pastured the cattle, and looked after her younger siblings. When Napisa was 15, she was given in marriage in accordance with antiquated nomadic traditions which fortunately quite rarely exist in present times. However, she was able to finish school and with an infant at her side, entered Trade College. 

The salary of her husband, who was a policeman, was too low and didn’t meet the essential needs of the growing family. In order to find an additional means of subsistence, Napisa began to work as a sales assistant. Later, she made it a career and took on the position of head of the local department store. 

This experience became the basis for Napisa’s own business in reselling goods, which she started in 2008. Together with her elder daughter, she opened a small grocery store and managed to develop it. Now Napisa is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by expanding her range of products. With the revenue from this investment, Napisa plans to open one more sales point at the market for her daughter.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Salkinoy

texts.ru: Хужакулова Салкиной проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж, работает в колхозе. Сама Салкиной имеет среднее образования. Занимается торговлей. Она привозит в город фисташки, миндаль и продает оптом. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. На полученную прибыль она намерена купить крупнорогатый скот.
texts.en: Salkinoy K. lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 43 years old, married and has 4 children.  Her husband works at a farm collective.  Salkinoy has a secondary education.  She is involved in sales.  She delivers pistachios and almonds into the town and sells them wholesale.  Salkinoy has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.  She wants to use the resulting profit to purchase cattle.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 38 years old and married to Carren Achieng. They have three children: Jerald, 13 years old and in Standard 7; Eunice, eight years old and in Standard three, and Ted who is one year old. They live in Daraja Mbili in Kisumu.

Raymond has an agrovet business that he has been running for the past six years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD as he wants to buy some animal and poultry feed to add to his stock. His monthly income is Kshs 15,000 and he intends to use the profits to pay school fees for his children.

His desire is to rear poultry and dairy cows so that he can be purchasing feed from his own business. He also hopes to have a big agrovet business in his area as well as to expand to other areas, especially rural areas where agriculture is highly practiced.

loans.use: Buy animal feed

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg P. is 52 years old. She is a widow who lives with her 20-year-old daughter in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her daughter attends a college while Altantsetseg operates a ger-bracing supply production business. She produces ropes, belts, and straps used in ger construction. She started her business in 1973 and has gained much experience as a maker of these products over the years. In the future, she is planning to expand her business into an industrial level by having her own workplace and hiring more employees in order to export her products to the Kazakhstan. Over the many years of owning this business, she has built a stable and successful operation and her earnings have enabled her to provide for her family.  Altantsetseg is a kind, gentle and hardworking person. She is a diligent worker and hopes to continue to grow her business and improve her family's standard of living. She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase horse manes and tails and machinery that can reduce manual work in order to produce ropes and straps.

loans.use: To purchase horse manes and tails

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.ru: Азизова Хосият жительница Яванского района. Возраст, 35 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама Хосият не имеет высшего образования. Работает на рынке. Продает одежду и обувь. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. Она намерена привести сезонные товары.
texts.en: Hosiyat A. lives in the Yavan region. She is 35 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is now working in Russia. Hosiyat does not have higher education. She works on the market and sells clothing and shoes. She has been in this business for more than ten years. She is asking for a loan to increase variety of her merchandise. She plans to bring in seasonal goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en:
Hurelbaatar B. is 27 years old and lives with his wife and 3-year-old daughter in their own apartment in central Mongolia. His daughter attends a kindergarten and his wife is doing her Master’s degree program at the university. 

Hurelbaatar supports his family by operating a PC game center under his house in the town. He began his business in 2009 with help of his wife and sibling and they have built up a stable and successful operation within this short period. Today, his PC game center has 13 computers. For the future, he is planning on expanding his business by providing more services such as a scanner and black/white and color printing, etc. so that he can accommodate more customers. 

Hurelbaatar is a modest, honest and hardworking man and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase equipment for his PC game center.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his PC game center

loans.name: Gereltod

texts.en:
Mr.Gereltod is 35 years old and lives with his wife and infant daughter in a small house where he operates his catering business in Ulaanbaatar,the capital city of Mongolia. Few years ago he sold his house to buy a suitable place to open a catering business. 
Mr.Gereltod used to work in a restaurant as a kitchen assistant for a many years and has gained a lot catering experience. Then he decided to open his own catering business. Currently he runs the business together with his wife and his elder sister. In the photo with him is his wife, infant daughter and his elder sister. He has chosen good location for the business and it is one of the most crowded place in the city and many of his customers are taxi drivers.  The daily earning is 50,000 to 120,000 MNT

He is a  very hard-working and optimistic person and is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase more kitchen equipments for his catering business such as a tables, chairs, refrigerator and some supply materials.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchen equipments for his catering business such as a tables, chairs, refrigerator and some supply materials

loans.name: Kiyomiddin

texts.ru: Ибрагимов Киёмиддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Клиент недавно вернулся с России и имел 1000 долларов США сбережения. Приобрел торговую точку на рынке "Тиджорат" с намерениями открыть собственный бизнес. Сейчас он занимается торговлей спортивной одежды, обуви и других принадлежностей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 месяцев. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Kiyomiddin I. lives in the Yavan region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He has secondary education. He has recently returned from Russia and brought $1,000 US dollars in savings. He has acquired a vendor space on the Tidjorat market with the purpose of opening his own business. Right now he is selling sportswear, shoes and other goods. He has been in this business for five months. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Badamhand

texts.en: Badamhand T. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. All her daughters, ages 11, 16 and 18, attend a local secondary school. Her husband, Batdorj, operates a taxi service after purchasing his motorcycle for 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) from an individual. Badamhand operates a dairy-product trading business in her town. Her husband's sibling is a herder in the countryside and owns 120 livestock. She owns a cow with three calves that produces the milk and she sells it to stores. She has been operating her business since 2004 and has gained significant experience and built a stable operation. Badamhand is a hardworking and diligent person. For the future, she plans to buy a new car for her husband's transportation business and build a house for her family. She says, "I (have) plans to build a house and to purchase and preserve more dairy products at (a) wholesale price before such products grow scarce." Badamhand is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase large amount of dairy products from herders and to buy construction materials for her house.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of dairy products

loans.name: Davagsumberel

texts.en: Davagsumberel T. is 52 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in Mongolia's Arhangai province. His oldest child is a university student, and his youngest child attends a local secondary school. Davagsumberel operates a tire repair and service business in his town. He began his business in 2004 with 50,000 MNT in working capital, which has since grown to 2,000,000 MNT. Over the years, he has built a stable and successful operation and has gained significant experience. For the future, he hopes to continue to grow his business. Davagsumberel is a gentle and hardworking man, and he says: "All I want is to expand my business and hand it down to my son." He is a modest and hardworking person who is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT in order to purchase tires for his repair center.

loans.use: To purchase tires

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en: Javzanpagma B. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her two children, ages 12 and 15, both attend a local secondary school, while her husband is a carpenter and produces a variety of wood products in their home. Javzanpagma has been operating a household goods trading business at the local market in her town since 2010. For the future, Javzanpagma hopes to expand her business and have her own shop. She is a very hardworking and friendly woman. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with seven children, two of whom attend school. The others have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a hardware store and a barbershop. Constance faces the challenges of theft and seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her hardware shop in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bags of cement and chemicals for her barbershop. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cement and hair chemicals for her barbershop

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki is a married woman with seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She sells second hand-clothes and also has a restaurant. For over seven years she has sold from door to door and from home. Riziki faces a major challenge of late payment by customers who buy goods on credit. With the Kshs 80,000 Riziki wants to purchase construction materials for her stall and clothes to resell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She decided to join Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services to economically marginalized entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her stall and second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand his business and buy some essential tools

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a widow with six children, three boys and three girls, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. For over ten years, Pamela has operated a food vendor business selling deep-fried chicken, fish and potatoes and also runs a tailoring business. She works in a shop, from door to door, and from home. Her customers are school children and neighbors. In the future, Pamela hopes to establish a butcher shop and become a supplier of chicken and fish. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase one sack of potatoes, cooking oil, 10kgs of peas, one bundle of wheat flour and a freezer.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cooking oil, peas, and wheat flour plus a freezer.

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiku

texts.en:
Eunice bought her truck two years ago and has been using it for transportation in Naivasha town. She is 38 years old and has been taking care of her seven children alone after her husband died.

Eunice was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her third loan and she repaid all her previous loans in good time. She plans to use the loan to open a grocery shop to supplement the income from her transportation business. In future, she hopes to own a fleet of trucks for transportation.

loans.use: To open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old single man living with his parents in Lebanon. He has more than fifteen years of experience in car repair and has run his own small repair shop for three years. His shop is situated in a busy area so he has been able to gain many customers and help his father with the household expenses. With his loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he wants to increase his capital and buy needed equipment. In the future, he hopes to diversify and sell car oil in his shop.

loans.use: purchase needed equipment

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina P. is the single mother of a 3-year-old girl who lives in Karakol town.  She finished hairdresser's courses, but couldn’t find a well-paid job. Being a very energetic and hardworking person, Madina decided to start her own business selling vegetables.  She rented a selling place at the local market and managed to earn 10,000 KGS monthly.  This business became successful with the help of Madina’s mother who supports her in all activities. 

These two women got past many difficulties and were able to make their business a good source of income for the family. Now Madina plans to use this loan of 25,000 KGS to broaden the range of products she sells and to raise her floating capital in future.  With the revenue, she plans to give a good education to her daughter.  As for her personal plans, Madina dreams of marrying and giving a birth to one more child.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Ziyafar

texts.ru:
Ziyafar N. 47 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 5 detey, sin kotoromu 20 qod on uchitsya v universitete, doch kotoroy 19 let toje uchitsya v universitete i zanimayetsya tancami, doch kotoroy 16 let ona uchitsya v shkole, sin kotoromu 15 let on toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom i sin 14 let toje uchitsya v shkole. Ziyafar yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjara, seychas projivayet v Absheron region.

Ziyafar i yeyo muj Tagi( na fotoqrafii)uje 2 qoda kak delayut okna i dveri iz plastika. Seychas oni nujdayutsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye materiali dlya toqo chtobi delat okna i dveri.
texts.en:
Ziyafar Nagieva is 47 years old. She is married and has five children. Her son is twenty years old is studying at the university and her daughter is nineteen who is also going to the university and taking dancing lessons. Another daughter is sixteen years old who goes to school and son is fifteen years old and also goes to school and does sports, another son is fourteen and he is also in school. Ziyafar is an internally displaced person and has relocated from Kalbadjar and now lives in the Absheron region.

Ziyafar and her husband Tagi (pictured on the photo) have been making windows and doors from plastic for two years now. At this time they need 2000 AZN to buy necessary building materials to make windows and doors.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials to make doors and windows

loans.name: Anne Wanjiru

texts.en:
Anne opened her cyber cafe in Naivasha town late last year and so far she says it's profitable.  She is 41 years old, married to Simon M., and they have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to expand her cyber cafe and she will use the loan amount to buy two more computers for her cyber cafe.

In future, Anne hopes to develop her cyber cafe further and also start offering computer courses.

loans.use: To buy two computers for her cyber cafe

loans.name: Philip Nganatha

texts.en:
Philip has been selling flasks, 'sufurias', basins and buckets in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 33 years old, married to Rahab Njeri, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more 'sufurias' and flasks for sell.

In future, Philip hopes to grow his shop to a wholesale one and supply his products on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy more 'sufurias' (pots) and flasks for resale

loans.name: Begaim

texts.en:
Begaim S. is 44 years old and lives in Panfilovka village in the north of Kyrgyzstan. She graduated from medical college and currently works as a nurse in the local hospital. Begaim has two children: one daughter who is 19 and a son, 23 years old.  Her husband works as a fireman in the local boiler house. Begaim has very close-knit family, where all members support and help each other. 

In 2000, in order to cover the family’s expenses, Begaim decided to engage in cattle breeding, using an initial capital of 3,000 Kyrgyz Soms. She bought cattle and managed to enlarge her herd to four cows, two bull calves, and six sheep.  

Begaim plans to use the loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by purchasing one milch cow and two bull-calves. With the revenues from this investment, Begaim plans to buy a car for her family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Gunay

texts.ru:
Gunay D. 20 let. Ona ne zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy. Gunay zakonchila shkolu i nachala idti na kursi parexmaxera nauchivshis etomu delu ona uje 2 qoda kak otkrila sebe salon i rabotayet tam. 

Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit neobxodimiye veshi chobi ulidshit svoy salon.
texts.en:
Gunay D. is twenty years old. She is not married and lives in the Absheron region together with her family. Gunay graduated from school and started taking hair dresser classes. She has learned this business and it has been two years since she has opened her beauty salon.

At this time she needs 2000 AZN to buy supplies to improve her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy necessary supplies to improve beauty salon

loans.name: Teresiah Waithira

texts.en:
Teresiah has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  She is 37 years old, a single mother of one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend  and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the cash to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings which she will plant after harvesting the maize in her farm.

Teresiah is very hard-working.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings to plant

loans.name: Maiko  Embarbal

texts.en:
Maiko Embarbal, aged 44 years, is married to Timpiyian, aged 40 years, and together they have two children, aged eight and 10 years. He runs a butchery as his primary business which he has operated for a period of 10 years.

Maiko was introduced to KADET LTD by the Credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office. His business of 10 years generates a profit of Kshs 4,000 per month.

With the loan Maiko plans to buy bulls for slaughtering in his business so as to have more meat to sell. He also wants to uplift the standard of his butchery so as to attract more customers. His business is in a remote area and most of his customers are men who come to buy and eat meat from his butchery. The same people also buy the soup that he makes from bones--a real source of attraction to most of his customers as the majority loves the soup. 

Maiko is persistent in his goals and he dreams that in future he will export his meat to outside counties and earn more money to educate his children.

loans.use: Buy bulls for slaughtering

loans.name: Mathew Kibet

texts.en:
Mathew has been rearing and selling sheep and goats in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He is 32 years old, married to Priscilla Karonei, and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy more sheep which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

In future, Mathew hopes to start keeping cows for both meat and milk.

loans.use: To buy more sheep which he will rear and sell later

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For over ten years, she has operated a butcher shop, selling to neighbours and food vendors. Lydia faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season, the price for meat is very high, so fewer customers turn up. 

Lydia hopes to have a furnished well-equipped butcher shop.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase ten pieces of windows, four pieces of doors and five bags of cement to renovate her butcher shop.

loans.use: To purchase windows, doors and cement to renovate her butcher shop.

loans.name: Jane Njoki

texts.en:
Jane started selling clothes in Naivasha town in January of this year.  She finds the business very  profitable.  She is 53 years old, married to Jimmi M., and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to selll as she targets the coming holiday season.

In future, Jane hopes to have a big boutique selling different types of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Fredrick Muchunu

texts.en:
Fredrick has operated his butcher shop in Naivasha town for the last three years.  He is 30 years old, married to Joyce Wangari, and they have two children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy goats for slaughter and sell the meat from his butcher shop.

In future, Fredrick hopes to grow his butcher shop and be able to fill large orders for meat.

loans.use: To buy goats which he will rear and slaughter for sale

loans.name: Parviz

texts.ru:
Parviz H. 35 let. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey .Doch kotoroy 10  let ona uchitsya v shkole i xodit na muziku ,doch kotoroy 6 let toje uchitsya v shkole i novorojdenniy sin  kotoromu 9 mesecev. Parviz yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Agdam ,seychas projivayet v qorode Baku.

Parviz uje 11 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom taksista. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya svoyey mashini. Eto uje vtoroy ssud Parviza, on ochen blagodaren lenderam za pervuyu ssudu.
texts.en:
Parviz H. is 35 years old.  He is married and has three children.  His ten-year-old daughter goes to school and studies music.  His six-year-old daughter goes to school, and he has a newborn son, nine months old.  Parvoz is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Agdam who now lives in Baku.

Parviz has been driving a taxi for eleven years.  He started this business with his father.  Now, he needs 2000 AZN to buy repair parts for his car.  This is Parviza’s second loan.  He is very thankful to the lenders for his first loan.

loans.use: Buying repair parts for a taxi

loans.name: Miriam Wanjiru

texts.en:
Miriam has been selling clothes in Naivasha town for the last six years.  She is 26 years old, married to Dedan Hure Irigaha, and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the money to buy more clothes for sale, targeting the coming holidays which are the  peak season for her business.

In future, Miriam hopes  to grow  her boutique and sell clothes for both genders and all ages of people.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent a piece of land and plant potatoes

loans.name: Daniel Adero

texts.en:
Daniel is 26 years old, a single man from the Usenge area on the outskirts of Kisumu city. He is divorced with two children who are under his care: Migan, three years old and in baby class, and Daniel, two years old.

Daniel has a phone accessories business that he has been running for the past two years. He is applying for a loan to buy new phones for sales to add to his stock. His monthly income is Kshs 12,000 and his business is doing well. This is the first loan that he is applying from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client here.

His desire is to open another shop in Bondo town where there is high demand for mobile phone accessories. He plans to own his own house in the future.

loans.use: Buy new mobile phones for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is from Lebanon. She has owned her small grocery store since 2006. She features all types of food, dairy products, detergents, etc. Her business income is vital to help her husband who works as a farmer. Today, she is requesting to borrow US$ 1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve her business and increase her shop inventory. She expects that her business will continue to grow in the coming year. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands. The strong network of community relationships is an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: increase her shop inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has made his living as a professional home painter for almost 10 years now. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients and he also takes home projects. His business income is an important source of support for his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing paints and painting tools in order to be able to take on more projects and increase his business level. In the future, he hopes to open a paint shop and where he will have two parallel jobs, selling paint and also working on projects.

loans.use: purchasing paints and painting tools

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé de quatre  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent le quartier Bagadadji  de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le quartier. 
Les membres du groupe font le commerce d’articles divers tels les cosmétiques, les pagnes wax et  bien d’articles divers de boutique (thé, citron, lipton, bonbons, lait en poudre, des conserves …). 
Dans le but de satisfaire leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante, les membres du groupe ont de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. Tous les six prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Madame Ami Cissé, la présidente du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 40 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché de Bamako. Elle  les revend  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de Ségou, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Ami Cissé espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer en condiments et acheter les fournitures scolaires des enfants. 
Elle a pour ambition à l’instar des autres femmes du groupe d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group is composed of four married women who live mostly in monogamous families, are on average 33 years old, and have two children. They live in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).  They know each other as neighbors and through their work in the district.

The members of the group buy and sell a variety of items such as cosmetics, pagnes (lengths of colorful cloth used for dress making) and numerous grocery items such as tea, Lipton soup, candy, powdered milk, canned goods, etc. With the goal of meeting the demands of their growing clientele, the members of the group have collaborated with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their seventh group loan.  The six preceding loans have been properly repaid.

Madame Ami Cissé, the president of the group, plans to use her loan to buy 40 pagnes at wholesale in the main market of Bamako.   She resells them at retail, for cash and credit, door to door and while traveling through different districts in Ségou, to a clientele composed of women and men. Madame Ami Cissé hopes to earn with this loan a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used for daily food needs at home and to buy school supplies for her children. 

Her ambition, like that of the other women of the group, is to buy a plot of land to build a home.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (lenths of colorful cloth used in dress making)

loans.name: Allah Kabo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Allah Kabo sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Somonodougouni dans la commune rurale de Konodimini, dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le petit commerce de poissons frais et fumés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Yaya Sogoré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 8 corbeilles de  poissons frais au bord du fleuve Niger dans le village. Elle les revend en détail, à domicile, dans le village en ambulant et à la foire de Konodimini, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Madame Yaya Sogoré compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants et les petits besoins du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif d’entretenir ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’augmenter le volume de son activité génératrice de revenus.
texts.en:
The four women of the Allah Kabo group are married and live mostly in polygamous families, are on average 41 years old, and have three children.  They live in the village of Somonodougouni in the rural community of Konodimini, in the region of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).  

They know each other through family ties and are involved in the business of selling fresh and smoked fish.  With the goal of increasing their working capital, the members of the group decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their first joint loan.  

Madame Yaya Sogoré plans to use her loan to buy eight baskets of fresh fish on the shore of the Niger River in the village.  She resells them at retail, door to door in the village, as well as at the market in Konodimini for cash and on credit to a clientele of men and women.

Madame Yaya Sogoré plans to earn with this loan an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA which will be used to meet her children’s health needs and the everyday needs of her home.  Her objective is to maintain this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase the volume of her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Harrison  Mwangi

texts.en:
Harrison is single and hardworking, He joined KADET LTD  through his contacts to existing clients. He is servicing his sixth loan with KADET  and he has repaid the previous loans successfully.


Harrison has no history with any other MFI. He plans to use the loan to add more stock. He has been in the hardware shop business for four years. He will  use the anticipated profits to open another small hardware shop.

Harrison hopes later to be able to own a big hardware store in town.

loans.use: purchase more stock

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi sont mariés majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Somonodougouni dans la commune rurale de Konodimini dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’articles divers tels le balais, les feuilles séchées d’échalotes, de poissons frais et fumés etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire avec l’institution.
 Madame Azara  Sogoré, qui est un membre du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 corbeilles de poissons frais au bord du fleuve Niger dans le village. 
Pour avoir du poisson fumé, on lave proprement les poissons frais, les étale sur les matériels conçus pour la circonstance au dessous duquel on active le feu dans un coin de la cour de la maison pendant deux ou trois jours au moins. On procède ensuite au suivi régulier tout au long du processus. Le poisson ainsi fumé est vendu à domicile et dans les foires de Konodimini et Konobougou au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Azara  Sogoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif à l’image des autres femmes du groupe l’achat des petits ruminants pour des fins d’élevage.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi group are married and live mostly in monogamous families.  They are on average 29 years old and have two children.  They live in the village of Somonodougouni in the rural community of Konodimini, in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know each other through family and marriage ties.  The members of the group are in the business of selling various items such as balas, dried shallots,  fresh and smoked fish, etc.  With the goal of increasing their working capital, the members of the group have decided to take advantage of the credit program through Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their first joint loan with the institution.

Madame Azara Sogoré, a member of the group, plans to use her loan to buy 10 baskets of fresh fish on the shore of the Niger River in the village.  To smoke fish, one has to properly wash the fresh fish and spread them out on surfaces made for this purpose.  Under this a fire is lit, in one corner of the courtyard outside the house, for at least two or three days.  The fish must be tended to throughout the process.  The smoked fish is then sold door to door and in the markets in Konodimini and Konobougou for cash and on credit, generally to women.

Madame Azara Sogoré hopes to earn with this loan an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA to be used to meet the daily needs of her household, as well as to reinvest in her business.   Like the other women in the group, she plans to buy and raise small livestock.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de 4 femmes toutes mariées dans des familles polygames avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Somonodougouni dans la commune rurale de Konodimini dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage dans le village. 
Les membres du groupe font essentiellement le petit commerce de poissons frais et fumés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mahawa Niaré compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 7 corbeilles de  poissons frais au bord du fleuve Niger dans le village. 
Pour avoir du poisson fumé, elle lave proprement ses poissons frais, les étale sur les matériels conçus pour la circonstance au dessous duquel elle active le feu dans un coin de la cour de la maison pendant deux ou trois jours au moins. Le poisson ainsi fumé est vendu à domicile et à la foire de Konodimini au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Mahawa Niaré envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants et les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The Danaya group consists of 4 women, all married and living in polygamous families. They average 45 years of age and three children. They live in the village of Somonodougouni in the rural community of Konodimini in Segou region (the fourth administrative district of Mal) and know each other through family and marriage ties. The group members mainly sell fish, fresh and smoked.

In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are now on the first solidarity loan.
Mrs. Mahawa Niaré plans to use her loan to purchase seven baskets of fresh village at the Niger river in their village. In order to have smoked fish, she properly washes her fish, places it on top of appropriate materials designed for it and smokes them over fire in a corner of her yeard, for at least two or three days. The smoked fish is sold out of her home and at the Konodmini market, for cash and on credit, to a diverse customer base.

Mrs. Mahawa Niaré plans to achieve an average monthly benefit of 25,000 West African Francs, which will be used towards healthcare expenses for her children and some everyday household needs.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fish

loans.name: Eunice Kwamboka

texts.en:
Eunice Kwamboka, aged 30 years, is married to Enock and together they have two children at the primary school level. She  runs a grocery where she sells maize and onions and potatoes.

Eunice has been running this grocery shop for a period of three  years and she gets a monthly income of Kshs 15,000 while her husband gets Kshs 5,500 per day. Her customers are satisfied and they refer their friends to her grocery.

With the loan, she intends to buy onions to sell both retail and wholesale, and with the extra income generated, Eunice will increase the stock of other grocery items to maximize profit.

Eunice’s dream is to be able to supply her groceries wholesale which will give her more profit. This will enable her to improve the living standards of her children and give them quality education.

Eunice is ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy onions to sell both retail and wholesale

loans.name: Virginia Wairimu

texts.en:
Virginia Wairimu aged 31 is a single mother of one child aged 14 years and in primary school. Virginia runs a green grocery shop where she sells tomatoes, bananas, oranges, onions and potatoes among other things in the Lunga Lunga area which is in a slum district.

Virginia has been running this green grocery shop for a period of eight years and she gets a monthly income of Kshs 8,000. Her customers are satisfied and they refer their friends to her green grocery for her quality goods which are sold at fair prices.

With the loan Virginia intends to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges, and bananas to sell and with the extra income generated she will increase the stock of other groceries to maximize profit.

Virginia’s dream is to be able to supply her groceries wholesale which will give her more profit. This will enable her to improve the living standards of her children and give them quality education. She also wants to move her green grocery from the open air place to a shop.

Virginia is a very hardworking lady.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, bananas, oranges, onions, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Stephen Kundu

texts.en:
Stephen Kundu, aged 41 years, sells water in plastic tanks. He is married to Jane Wanjiku who is also a business lady and together they have two children aged three and one year old. He lives at Ruai which is a rural area and sells water in the rural areas near his town. Stephen has been running his water business for four years and his monthly profit is Kshs 18,000. 

Stephen learned about KADET Ltd through other Kadet clients with whom he formed a group to be taught about Kadet with the aim of being funded. Ruai is not very populated but Stephen works hard to make a good profit which he uses to take care of his family and to save for his children’s education. After getting this loan Stephen intends to use Kshs 52,000 to buy a water tank and the Kshs 18000 to put in purchases. If the loan boosts the business Stephen intends buy a vehicle for transporting water to the points within his area of business.

Stephen is polite and hardworking and dreams of becoming a big supplier of water to make more profit to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: David Njoki

texts.en:
David Njoki W. is 43 years old, married to Rahab Wambui who is a business lady, and this is a source of additional income for the family. They have four school-going children aged 15, 12, seven, and four years old respectively, Their residential place is in Eldoret-Kenya. He sells electrical supplies and has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly profit of Ksh.60,000.


David learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in his area and so he is applying for his first loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD, with which he intends to buy  dozens of bulbs, switches, wire, and screws,. The anticipated profits he plans to use to expand his electrical business.


In future David wishes to live a better life. His deepest desire is to see his children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy  dozens of bulbs, switches, wire, and screws

loans.name: Koitamet

texts.en:
Koitamet M., aged 25 years, is a single man who has a retail shop in Enkaroni which is in Kajiado. He rents his shop.

He has been running this business for the past two years and his monthly profit is Kshs 20,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office which is the nearest to Enkaroni Market.

Koitamet will use Kshs 5,000 to buy rice, Kshs 5,000 for sugar, Kshs. 10,000 for mattresses, Kshs 5,000 for blankets, kshs 10,000 for plastic chairs and Kshs 5,000 to buy bags  for sale. His business is fast moving because Enkaroni market is crowded with livestock traders who buy his goods a lot.

If the loan boosts the business, Koitamet will have a big business which will enable him to generate enough income to buy a piece of land where he can build his own shop to do business in and buy a pickup. He will also build rental houses.

Koitamet dreams of becoming a big distributor owning a manufacturing company and opening a supermarket. Koitamet is honest, ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rice, blankets, sugar, mattresses, plastic and bags

loans.name: Esther Wairimu

texts.en:
Esther Wairimu, aged 52 years, is married to Michael, and together they have four children. She lives on one of the estates in the Nairobi Eastlands area, and she sells her traditional wrap-overs and fabrics at the Masai open-air market. She has been in this business for eight years and is a hardworking lady.

Esther was introduced to KADET by one of the credit officers in charge of the Eastlands branch, and she has applied for a loan. She plans to use 25,000 KES to buy more wrap-overs and 25,000 KES to buy traditional fabrics to sell. With the extra income generated Esther plans to add more stock and sell more, as the market operates twice a week on an open-air ground.

Esther's dream is to buy a shop in town from which she can run her business.

loans.use: To buy traditional wrap-overs and fabrics

loans.name: Benson Tathi

texts.en:
Benson, aged 31 years, is a mechanic and is married to Jennifer Wambui, aged 27 years. He lives in Dandora which is near the Soweto slums, and his business is in the Nairobi city centre.

Benson was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET client. He intends to buy spare parts with the loan he has applied for so as to increase the availability of spare parts required by his clients. If the loan boosts his mechanic’s business, Benson plans to open a spare parts shop in town but near his business.

He dreams of owning a big garage one day and buying a piece of land on which he can run his businesses comfortably.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Jackson Makola

texts.en:
Jackson Makola is 50 years old, married, and has three adult children.  He lives in Tala, Kenya,  His wife Rachael is a businesswoman.  Jackson raises poultry, which he has been doing for one year.  His business generates a profit of KES 30,000.  He also receives income from his retail shop.

Jackson was introduced to Kadet by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office. With this loan, Jackson plans to buy food for his poultry, which includes growers mash, chicken feed, and starters meal. His customers are well served and satisfied with his poultry. With additional his income, he plans to buy more layers and chicks.

Jackson is hardworking and outgoing. For the future, he dreams of building a comfortable residential house.

loans.use: To buy food for his chicks

loans.name: Janet Akinyi

texts.en:
Janet Akinyi A. is 35 years old and is married to Raphael A. who is a businessman. They have four children in school, and they live in Eldoret-Kenya. She is a storekeeper and has been in this business for fifteen years, earning a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. Her husband’s business dealings are a source of additional income for the family.

Janet learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer. She is now applying for her first loan of 50,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to open up two other stores in town. The anticipated profits gained will be used to expand the businesses.

In the future Janet wishes to have rental houses of her own and have a good life.

loans.use: To open another two stores in town

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca Estela U. ella se dedica al negocio del destace de res y cerdo, tiene veinte y dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella ya tiene a sus clientes a quienes les entrega la carne, es acompañada y  tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y   cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de cerdo y res para ampliarle a su negocio y poder abastecer a sus clientes, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella  ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Estela U. has been in the business of butchering cows and pigs for twenty-two years. She has customers who purchase meat from her. Blanca has a son who works with her and is of school age.

She has had five loans with CEPRODEL and each one was used to buy pork and beef so that she could expand her business and satisfy her customers. Blanca has benefited greatly from these loans because they have helped improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase a cow & two pigs

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Emilia P. R. ella es trabajadora activa del colegio público “Santa Rita” Villa el Carmen desempeñándose como bibliotecaria del colegio tiene  diecisiete años de trabajar como docente, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Emlia P. R. is an active employee at the Santa Rita Public School in Villa del Carmen. She is the school librarian but also has seventeen years of experience as a teacher. Rosa is currently married.

She has had four loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used to buy construction materials so that she could expand and improve her house. Rosa has benefited greatly from the loans because they have helped improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements & expansion

loans.name: Ivania Margine

texts.es: La Sra. Ivania Margine C. G. ella es trabajadora activa del colegio público “Félix Pedro García” San Rafael del Sur desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  veinte años de trabajar como docente, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo  está solicitando para la compra de flores artificiales para arreglo florales para los difuntos porque ella aparte de ser maestra se dedica al negocio de  hacer arreglos florales, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
